26 /* Notes on so-called 'Large File Support':
27 
28  The C stdio functions such as fseek and ftell are defined using
29  'long' for file positioning: also fread/fwrite use size_t for size
30  and number of items. (The latter can cause problems with
31  reading/writing large blocks, but not in R.) POSIX introduced
32  off_t and fseeko/ftello to allow larger file sizes, since 'long'
33  may limit file positioning to 2GB. (C99 introduced fpos_t and
34  f[gs]etpos.)
35 
36  Note that the issue really only arises if 'long' is 32-bit, which
37  is not the case on all known 64-bit platforms except Windows.
38  However, off_t (defined in sys/types.h) is itself often 32-bit,
39  which has led to workarounds. On Linux systems, the macros
40 
41  __USE_FILE_OFFSET64
42  __USE_LARGEFILE64
43 
44  select between __off_t and __off64_t. Since these are different
45  types, the functions using them have to be remapped, and the
46  __off64_t versions call fopen64, fseeko64, ftello64 and so on.
47 
48  These macros are not intended to be used directly but via (features.h)
49 
50  _FILE_OFFSET_BITS=N Select default filesystem interface.
51  _LARGEFILE_SOURCE Some more functions for correct standard I/O.
52  _LARGEFILE64_SOURCE Additional functionality from LFS for large files.
53 
54  The last makes system calls like open64 visible directly, and so
55  should not be needed in R.
56 
57  This is commonly known as LFS; _but_ 'LFS Linux' is something else.
58  See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Large_file_support and
59  http://www.suse.de/~aj/linux_lfs.html
60 
61  Solaris has a similar scheme: see 'man lf64', 'man lfcompile' and
62  'man lfcompile64'.
63 
64  On macOS, off_t is typedef-ed to __darwin_off_t, which is
65  __int64_t, so the issue never arises. Similarly on FreeBSD.
66 
67  The situation with Windows is similar, but off64_t, fseeko64 etc
68  need to be selected explicitly (even on Win64).
69 
70  There are also issues with the glob(), readdir(), stat() system
71  calls: see platform.cpp and sysutils.cpp
72 
73  saveload.cpp uses f[gs]etpos: they have 64-bit versions on LFS Linux
74  and Solaris. But this only used for pre-1.4.0 formats, and fpos_t
75  is 64-bit on Windows.
76 */
77

145 constexpr int NCONNECTIONS = 128; /* snow needs one per no-echo node */
146 constexpr int NSINKS = 21;
147 
148 static Rconnection Connections[NCONNECTIONS];
149 static GCRoot<> OutTextData;
150 
151 static int R_SinkNumber;
152 static int SinkCons[NSINKS], SinkConsClose[NSINKS], R_SinkSplit[NSINKS];
153 
154 /* We need a unique id for a connection to ensure that the finalizer
155  does not try to close it after it is already closed. And that id
156  will be passed as a pointer, so it seemed easiest to use void *.
157 */
158 static void* current_id = nullptr;

160 /* ------------- admin functions (see also at end) ----------------- */
161 
162 static int NextConnection(void)
163 {
164  int i;
165  for(i = 3; i < NCONNECTIONS; i++)
166  if(!Connections[i]) break;
167  if(i >= NCONNECTIONS) {
168  R_gc(); /* Try to reclaim unused ones */
169  for(i = 3; i < NCONNECTIONS; i++)
170  if(!Connections[i]) break;
171  if(i >= NCONNECTIONS)
172  Rf_error(_("all connections are in use"));
173  }
174  return i;
175 }
176 
177 static int ConnIndex(Rconnection con)
178 {
179  int i;
180  for(i = 0; i < NCONNECTIONS; i++)
181  if(Connections[i] == con) break;
182  if(i >= NCONNECTIONS)
183  Rf_error(_("connection not found"));
184  return i;
185 }
186 
187 /* internal, not the same as R function getConnection */
188 Rconnection getConnection(int n)
189 {
190  Rconnection con = nullptr;
191 
192  if(n < 0 || n >= NCONNECTIONS || n == R_NaInt ||
193  !(con = Connections[n]))
194  Rf_error(_("invalid connection"));
195  return con;
196 
197 }
198 
199 HIDDEN int getActiveSink(int n)
200 {
201  if (n >= R_SinkNumber || n < 0)
202  return 0;
203  if (R_SinkSplit[R_SinkNumber - n])
204  return SinkCons[R_SinkNumber - n - 1];
205  else
206  return 0;
207 }
208 
209 static void conFinalizer(SEXP ptr)
210 {
211  int i, ncon;
212  void *cptr = R_ExternalPtrAddr(ptr);
213 
214  if(!cptr) return;
215 
216  for(i = 3; i < NCONNECTIONS; i++)
217  if(Connections[i] && Connections[i]->id == cptr) {
218  ncon = i;
219  break;
220  }
221  if(i >= NCONNECTIONS) return;
222  {
223  Rconnection thisconn = getConnection(ncon);
224  if(strcmp(thisconn->connclass, "textConnection"))
225  Rf_warning(_("closing unused connection %d (%s)\n"),
226  ncon, thisconn->description);
227  }
228 
229  con_destroy(ncon);
230  R_ClearExternalPtr(ptr); /* not really needed */
231 }

234 /* for use in REvprintf */
235 HIDDEN Rconnection getConnection_no_err(int n)
236 {
237  Rconnection con = nullptr;
238 
239  if (n < 0 || n >= NCONNECTIONS || n == R_NaInt
240  || !(con = Connections[n]))
241  return nullptr;
242  return con;
243 }

245 [[noreturn]] static void set_iconv_error(Rconnection con, const char* from, const char* to)
246 {
247  char buf[100];
248  snprintf(buf, 100, _("unsupported conversion from '%s' to '%s'"), from, to);
249  con_destroy(ConnIndex(con));
250  Rf_error(buf);
251 }

253 /* ------------------- buffering --------------------- */
254 
255 constexpr size_t RBUFFCON_LEN_DEFAULT = 4096;
256 
257 static size_t buff_set_len(Rconnection con, size_t len) {
258  size_t unread_len = 0;
259  unsigned char *buff;
260 
261  if (con->buff_len == len)
262  return len;
263 
264  if (con->buff) {
265  unread_len = con->buff_stored_len - con->buff_pos;
266  len = max(len, unread_len);
267  }
268 
269  buff = (unsigned char *)malloc(sizeof(unsigned char) * len);
270 
271  if (con->buff) {
272  memcpy(buff, con->buff + con->buff_pos, unread_len);
273  free(con->buff);
274  }
275 
276  con->buff = buff;
277  con->buff_len = len;
278  con->buff_pos = 0;
279  con->buff_stored_len = unread_len;
280 
281  return len;
282 }
283 
284 static void buff_init(Rconnection con)
285 {
286  con->buff_pos = con->buff_stored_len = 0;
287  buff_set_len(con, RBUFFCON_LEN_DEFAULT);
288 }
289 
290 static void buff_reset(Rconnection con) {
291  size_t unread_len = con->buff_stored_len - con->buff_pos;
292 
293  if (unread_len > 0)
294  memmove(con->buff, con->buff + con->buff_pos, unread_len);
295 
296  con->buff_pos = 0;
297  con->buff_stored_len = unread_len;
298 }
299 
300 static size_t buff_fill(Rconnection con) {
301  size_t free_len, read_len;
302 
303  buff_reset(con);
304 
305  free_len = con->buff_len - con->buff_stored_len;
306  read_len = con->read(con->buff, sizeof(unsigned char), free_len, con);
307 
308  con->buff_stored_len += read_len;
309 
310  return read_len;
311 }
312 
313 static int buff_fgetc(Rconnection con)
314 {
315  size_t unread_len;
316 
317  unread_len = con->buff_stored_len - con->buff_pos;
318  if (unread_len == 0) {
319  size_t filled_len = buff_fill(con);
320  if (filled_len == 0)
321  return R_EOF;
322  }
323 
324  return con->buff[con->buff_pos++];
325 }
326 
327 static double buff_seek(Rconnection con, double where, int origin, int rw)
328 {
329  size_t unread_len = con->buff_stored_len - con->buff_pos;
330 
331  if (rw == 2) /* write */
332  return con->seek(con, where, origin, rw);
333 
334  if (ISNA(where)) /* tell */
335  return con->seek(con, where, origin, rw) - unread_len;
336 
337  if (origin == 2) { /* current */
338  if (where < unread_len) {
339  con->buff_pos += where;
340  return con->seek(con, R_NaReal, origin, rw);
341  } else {
342  where -= unread_len;
343  }
344  }
345  con->buff_pos = con->buff_stored_len = 0;
346 
347  return con->seek(con, where, origin, rw);
348 }
349 
350 void set_buffer(Rconnection con)
351 {
352  if (con->canread && con->text) {
353  buff_init(con);
354  }
355 }
356 
357 void set_iconv(Rconnection con)
358 {
359  void *tmp;
360 
361  /* need to test if this is text, open for reading to writing or both,
362  and set inconv and/or outconv */
363  if(!con->text || !strlen(con->encname) ||
364  streql(con->encname, "native.enc")) {
365  con->UTF8out = FALSE;
366  return;
367  }
368  if(con->canread) {
369  size_t onb = 50;
370  char *ob = con->oconvbuff;
371  /* UTF8out is set in readLines() and scan()
372  Was Windows-only until 2.12.0, but we now require iconv.
373  */
374  Rboolean useUTF8 = Rboolean(!utf8locale && con->UTF8out);
375  const char *enc =
376  streql(con->encname, "UTF-8-BOM") ? "UTF-8" : con->encname;
377  tmp = Riconv_open(useUTF8 ? "UTF-8" : "", enc);
378  if(tmp != reinterpret_cast<void *>(-1)) con->inconv = tmp;
379  else set_iconv_error(con, con->encname, useUTF8 ? "UTF-8" : "");
380  con->EOF_signalled = FALSE;
381  /* initialize state, and prepare any initial bytes */
382  Riconv(tmp, nullptr, nullptr, &ob, &onb);
383  con->navail = short(50-onb); con->inavail = 0;
384  /* libiconv can handle BOM marks on Windows Unicode files, but
385  glibc's iconv cannot. Aargh ... */
386  if(streql(con->encname, "UCS-2LE") ||
387  streql(con->encname, "UTF-16LE")) con->inavail = -2;
388  /* Discaard BOM */
389  if(streql(con->encname, "UTF-8-BOM")) con->inavail = -3;
390  }
391  if(con->canwrite) {
392  size_t onb = 25;
393  char *ob = con->init_out;
394  tmp = Riconv_open(con->encname, "");
395  if(tmp != reinterpret_cast<void *>(-1)) con->outconv = tmp;
396  else set_iconv_error(con, con->encname, "");
397  /* initialize state, and prepare any initial bytes */
398  Riconv(tmp, nullptr, nullptr, &ob, &onb);
399  ob[25-onb] = '\0';
400  }
401 }

426 /* va_copy is C99, but a draft standard had __va_copy. Glibc has
427  __va_copy declared uncondiitonally */
428 
429 
430 // 2007/06/19 arr: Gives -pedantic error. FIXME : handle in configure script
431 #if defined(HAVE_VASPRINTF) && !HAVE_DECL_VASPRINTF
432 //int vasprintf(char **strp, const char *fmt, va_list ap);
433 #endif
434 
435 // 2007/06/14 arr: C++98 ain't C99. FIXME : handle in configure script
436 #ifdef __cplusplus
437 #undef HAVE_VA_COPY
438 #endif
439 
440 #if !HAVE_VA_COPY && HAVE___VA_COPY
441 # define va_copy __va_copy
442 # undef HAVE_VA_COPY
443 # define HAVE_VA_COPY 1
444 #endif
445 
446 #ifdef HAVE_VA_COPY
447 constexpr size_t BUFSIZE = 10000;
448 #else
449 constexpr size_t BUFSIZE = 100000;
450 #endif
451 int dummy_vfprintf(Rconnection con, const char *format, va_list ap)
452 {
453  R_CheckStack2(BUFSIZE); // prudence
454  char buf[BUFSIZE], *b = buf;
455  int res;
456  const void *vmax = nullptr; /* -Wall*/
457  int usedVasprintf = FALSE;
458  va_list aq;
459 
460  va_copy(aq, ap);
461  res = vsnprintf(buf, BUFSIZE, format, aq);
462  va_end(aq);
463 #ifdef HAVE_VASPRINTF
464  if(res >= int(BUFSIZE) || res < 0) {
465  res = vasprintf(&b, format, ap);
466  if (res < 0) {
467  b = buf;
468  buf[BUFSIZE-1] = '\0';
469  Rf_warning(_("printing of extremely long output is truncated"));
470  } else usedVasprintf = TRUE;
471  }
472 #else
473  if(res >= BUFSIZE) { /* res is the desired output length */
474  vmax = vmaxget();
475  /* apparently some implementations count short,
476  <http://unixpapa.com/incnote/stdio.html>
477  so add some margin here */
478  b = R_alloc(res + 101, sizeof(char));
479  vsnprintf(b, res + 100, format, ap);
480  } else if(res < 0) { /* just a failure indication */
481  vmax = vmaxget();
482  b = R_alloc(10*BUFSIZE, sizeof(char));
483  res = vsnprintf(b, 10*BUFSIZE, format, ap);
484  if (res < 0) {
485  b[10*BUFSIZE - 1] = '\0';
486  Rf_warning(_("printing of extremely long output is truncated"));
487  res = 10*BUFSIZE;
488  }
489  }
490 #endif /* HAVE_VASPRINTF */
491  if(con->outconv) { /* translate the buffer */
492  char outbuf[BUFSIZE+1], *ob;
493  const char *ib = b;
494  size_t inb = res, onb, ires;
495  Rboolean again = FALSE;
496  size_t ninit = strlen(con->init_out);
497  do {
498  onb = BUFSIZE; /* leave space for nul */
499  ob = outbuf;
500  if(ninit) {
501  strcpy(ob, con->init_out);
502  ob += ninit; onb -= ninit; ninit = 0;
503  }
504  errno = 0;
505  ires = Riconv(con->outconv, &ib, &inb, &ob, &onb);
506  again = Rboolean(ires == (size_t)(-1) && errno == E2BIG);
507  if(ires == size_t((-1)) && errno != E2BIG)
508  /* is this safe? */
509  Rf_warning(_("invalid char string in output conversion"));
510  *ob = '\0';
511  con->write(outbuf, 1, ob - outbuf, con);
512  } while(again && inb > 0); /* it seems some iconv signal -1 on
513  zero-length input */
514  } else
515  con->write(b, 1, res, con);
516  if(vmax) vmaxset(vmax);
517  if(usedVasprintf) free(b);
518  return res;
519 }
520 
521 int dummy_fgetc(Rconnection con)
522 {
523  int c;
524  Rboolean checkBOM = FALSE, checkBOM8 = FALSE;
525 
526  if(con->inconv) {
527  if(con->navail <= 0) {
528  unsigned int inew = 0;
529  char *p, *ob;
530  const char *ib;
531  size_t inb, onb, res;
532 
533  if(con->EOF_signalled) return R_EOF;
534  if(con->inavail == -2) {
535  con->inavail = 0;
536  checkBOM = TRUE;
537  }
538  if(con->inavail == -3) {
539  con->inavail = 0;
540  checkBOM8 = TRUE;
541  }
542  p = con->iconvbuff + con->inavail;
543  for(auto i = con->inavail; i < 25; i++) {
544  c = buff_fgetc(con);
545  if(c == R_EOF){ con->EOF_signalled = TRUE; break; }
546  *p++ = char(c);
547  con->inavail++;
548  inew++;
549  }
550  if(inew == 0) return R_EOF;
551  if(checkBOM && con->inavail >= 2 &&
552  (int(con->iconvbuff[0]) & 0xff) == 255 &&
553  (int(con->iconvbuff[1]) & 0xff) == 254) {
554  con->inavail -= short( 2);
555  memmove(con->iconvbuff, con->iconvbuff+2, con->inavail);
556  }
557  if(inew == 0) return R_EOF;
558  if(checkBOM8 && con->inavail >= 3 &&
559  !memcmp(con->iconvbuff, "\xef\xbb\xbf", 3)) {
560  con->inavail -= short( 3);
561  memmove(con->iconvbuff, con->iconvbuff+3, con->inavail);
562  }
563  ib = con->iconvbuff; inb = con->inavail;
564  ob = con->oconvbuff; onb = 50;
565  errno = 0;
566  res = Riconv(con->inconv, &ib, &inb, &ob, &onb);
567  con->inavail = short(inb);
568  if(res == size_t(-1)) { /* an error condition */
569  if(errno == EINVAL || errno == E2BIG) {
570  /* incomplete input char or no space in output buffer */
571  memmove(con->iconvbuff, ib, inb);
572  } else {/* EILSEQ invalid input */
573  Rf_warning(_("invalid input found on input connection '%s'"),
574  con->description);
575  con->inavail = 0;
576  con->EOF_signalled = TRUE;
577  }
578  }
579  con->next = con->oconvbuff;
580  con->navail = short(50 - onb);
581  }
582  con->navail--;
583  /* the cast prevents sign extension of 0xFF to -1 (R_EOF) */
584  return (unsigned char)*con->next++;
585  } else if (con->buff)
586  return buff_fgetc(con);
587  else
588  return con->fgetc_internal(con);
589 }

623 void init_con(Rconnection newconn, const char *description, int enc,
624  const char * const mode)
625 {
626  strcpy(newconn->description, description);
627  newconn->enc = enc;
628  strncpy(newconn->mode, mode, 4); newconn->mode[4] = '\0';
629  newconn->isopen = newconn->incomplete = newconn->blocking = newconn->isGzcon = FALSE;
630  newconn->canread = newconn->canwrite = TRUE; /* in principle */
631  newconn->canseek = FALSE;
632  newconn->text = TRUE;
633  newconn->open = &null_open;
634  newconn->close = &null_close;
635  newconn->destroy = &null_destroy;
636  newconn->vfprintf = &null_vfprintf;
637  newconn->fgetc = newconn->fgetc_internal = &null_fgetc;
638  newconn->seek = &null_seek;
639  newconn->truncate = &null_truncate;
640  newconn->fflush = &null_fflush;
641  newconn->read = &null_read;
642  newconn->write = &null_write;
643  newconn->nPushBack = 0;
644  newconn->save = newconn->save2 = -1000;
645  newconn->connprivate = nullptr;
646  newconn->inconv = newconn->outconv = nullptr;
647  newconn->UTF8out = FALSE;
648  newconn->buff = nullptr;
649  newconn->buff_pos = newconn->buff_stored_len = newconn->buff_len = 0;
650  /* increment id, avoid NULL */
651  current_id = reinterpret_cast<void *>(size_t(current_id)+1);
652  if(!current_id) current_id = reinterpret_cast<void *>(1);
653  newconn->id = current_id;
654  newconn->ex_ptr = nullptr;
655  newconn->status = R_NaInt;
656 }

658 /* ------------------- file connections --------------------- */
659 
660 #ifdef Win32
661 # define f_seek fseeko64
662 # define f_tell ftello64
663 # define OFF_T off64_t
664 #elif defined(HAVE_OFF_T) && defined(HAVE_FSEEKO)
665 # define f_seek fseeko
666 # define f_tell ftello
667 # define OFF_T off_t
668 #else
669 # define f_seek fseek
670 # define f_tell ftell
671 # define OFF_T long
672 #endif

674 #ifdef Win32
675 size_t Rf_utf8towcs(wchar_t *wc, const char *s, size_t n);
676 #endif

678 struct fileconn {
679  FILE *fp;
680  OFF_T rpos, wpos;
681  Rboolean last_was_write;
682  Rboolean raw;
683 #ifdef Win32
684  Rboolean anon_file;
685  Rboolean use_fgetwc;
686  Rboolean have_wcbuffered;
687  char wcbuf;
688  char name[PATH_MAX+1];
689 #endif
690 };
691 typedef fileconn* Rfileconn;
692 
693 static Rboolean file_open(Rconnection con)
694 {
695  const char *name;
696  FILE *fp = nullptr;
697  Rfileconn thisconn = static_cast<fileconn*>(con->connprivate);
698  Rboolean temp = FALSE;
699 #ifdef HAVE_FCNTL
700  int fd, flags;
701 #endif
702  int mlen = int(strlen(con->mode)); // short
703 
704  if(strlen(con->description) == 0) {
705  temp = TRUE;
706  name = R_tmpnam("Rf", R_TempDir);
707  } else name = R_ExpandFileName(con->description);
708  errno = 0; /* some systems require this */
709  if(strcmp(name, "stdin")) {
710 #ifdef Win32
711  char mode[20]; /* 4 byte mode plus "t,ccs=UTF-16LE" plus one for luck. */
712  strncpy(mode, con->mode, 4);
713  mode[4] = '\0';
714  if (!strpbrk(mode, "bt"))
715  strcat(mode, "t");
716  if (strchr(mode, 't')
717  && (!strcmp(con->encname, "UTF-16LE") || !strcmp(con->encname, "UCS-2LE"))) {
718  strcat(mode, ",ccs=UTF-16LE");
719  if (con->canread) {
720  thisconn->use_fgetwc = TRUE;
721  thisconn->have_wcbuffered = FALSE;
722  }
723  }
724  if(con->enc == CE_UTF8) {
725  int n = strlen(name);
726  wchar_t wname[2 * (n+1)], wmode[20];
727  mbstowcs(wmode, mode, 19);
728  R_CheckStack();
729  Rf_utf8towcs(wname, name, n+1);
730  fp = _wfopen(wname, wmode);
731  if(!fp) {
732  Rf_warning(_("cannot open file '%ls': %s"), wname, strerror(errno));
733  return FALSE;
734  }
735  } else {
736  fp = R_fopen(name, mode);
737  }
738 #else
739  fp = R_fopen(name, con->mode);
740 #endif
741  } else { /* use file("stdin") to refer to the file and not the console */
742 #ifdef HAVE_FDOPEN
743  int dstdin = dup(0);
744 # ifdef Win32
745  if (strchr(con->mode, 'b'))
746  /* fdopen won't set dstdin to binary mode */
747  setmode(dstdin, _O_BINARY);
748 # endif
749  fp = fdopen(dstdin, con->mode);
750 #else
751  Rf_warning(_("cannot open file '%s': %s"), name,
752  "fdopen is not supported on this platform");
753 #endif
754  }
755  if(!fp) {
756  Rf_warning(_("cannot open file '%s': %s"), name, strerror(errno));
757  return FALSE;
758  }
759  if(temp) {
760  /* This will fail on Windows, so arrange to remove in
761  * file_close. An alternative strategy would be to manipulate
762  * the underlying file handle to add FILE_SHARE_DELETE (so the
763  * unlink is valid) or FILE_FLAG_DELETE_ON_CLOSE. E.g. create
764  * via CreateFile, get an fd by _open_osfhandle and a file
765  * stream by fdopen. See
766  * e.g. http://www.codeproject.com/KB/files/handles.aspx
767  */
768  unlink(name);
769 #ifdef Win32
770  strncpy(thisconn->name, name, PATH_MAX);
771  thisconn->name[PATH_MAX - 1] = '\0';
772 #endif
773  free(const_cast<char *>(name)); /* only free if allocated by R_tmpnam */
774  }
775 #ifdef Win32
776  thisconn->anon_file = temp;
777 #endif
778  thisconn->fp = fp;
779  con->isopen = TRUE;
780  con->canwrite = Rboolean((con->mode[0] == 'w' || con->mode[0] == 'a'));
781  con->canread = Rboolean(!con->canwrite);
782  if(mlen >= 2 && con->mode[1] == '+')
783  con->canread = con->canwrite = TRUE;
784  thisconn->last_was_write = Rboolean(!con->canread);
785  thisconn->rpos = 0;
786  if(con->canwrite) thisconn->wpos = f_tell(fp);
787  if(mlen >= 2 && con->mode[mlen-1] == 'b') con->text = FALSE;
788  else con->text = TRUE;
789  con->save = -1000;
790  set_buffer(con);
791  set_iconv(con);
792 
793 #ifdef HAVE_FCNTL
794  if(!con->blocking) {
795  fd = fileno(fp);
796  flags = fcntl(fd, F_GETFL);
797  flags |= O_NONBLOCK;
798  fcntl(fd, F_SETFL, flags);
799  }
800 #endif
801  return TRUE;
802 }
803 
804 static void file_close(Rconnection con)
805 {
806  Rfileconn thisconn = static_cast<fileconn*>(con->connprivate);
807  if(con->isopen) // && strcmp(con->description, "stdin"))
808  con->status = fclose(thisconn->fp);
809  con->isopen = FALSE;
810 #ifdef Win32
811  if(thisconn->anon_file) unlink(thisconn->name);
812 #endif
813 }
814 
815 static int file_vfprintf(Rconnection con, const char *format, va_list ap)
816 {
817  Rfileconn thisconn = static_cast<fileconn*>(con->connprivate);
818 
819  if(!thisconn->last_was_write) {
820  thisconn->rpos = f_tell(thisconn->fp);
821  thisconn->last_was_write = TRUE;
822  f_seek(thisconn->fp, thisconn->wpos, SEEK_SET);
823  }
824  if(con->outconv) return dummy_vfprintf(con, format, ap);
825  else return vfprintf(thisconn->fp, format, ap);
826 }
827 
828 static int file_fgetc_internal(Rconnection con)
829 {
830  Rfileconn thisconn = static_cast<fileconn*>(con->connprivate);
831  FILE *fp = thisconn->fp;
832  int c;
833 
834  if(thisconn->last_was_write) {
835  thisconn->wpos = f_tell(thisconn->fp);
836  thisconn->last_was_write = FALSE;
837  f_seek(thisconn->fp, thisconn->rpos, SEEK_SET);
838  }
839 #ifdef Win32
840  if (thisconn->use_fgetwc) {
841  if (thisconn->have_wcbuffered) {
842  c = thisconn->wcbuf;
843  thisconn->have_wcbuffered = FALSE;
844  } else {
845  wint_t wc = fgetwc(fp);
846  c = (char) wc & 0xFF;
847  thisconn->wcbuf = (char) wc >> 8;
848  thisconn->have_wcbuffered = TRUE;
849  }
850  } else
851 #endif
852  c =fgetc(fp);
853  return feof(fp) ? R_EOF : c;
854 }
855 
856 static double file_seek(Rconnection con, double where, int origin, int rw)
857 {
858  Rfileconn thisconn = static_cast<fileconn*>(con->connprivate);
859  FILE *fp = thisconn->fp;
860  OFF_T pos;
861  int whence = SEEK_SET;
862 
863  /* make sure both positions are set */
864  pos = f_tell(fp);
865  if(thisconn->last_was_write) thisconn->wpos = pos; else thisconn->rpos = pos;
866  if(rw == 1) {
867  if(!con->canread) Rf_error(_("connection is not open for reading"));
868  pos = thisconn->rpos;
869  thisconn->last_was_write = FALSE;
870  }
871  if(rw == 2) {
872  if(!con->canwrite) Rf_error(_("connection is not open for writing"));
873  pos = thisconn->wpos;
874  thisconn->last_was_write = TRUE;
875  }
876  if(ISNA(where)) return double(pos);
877 
878  switch(origin) {
879  case 2: whence = SEEK_CUR; break;
880  case 3: whence = SEEK_END;
881 //#ifdef Win32
882  /* work around a bug in MinGW runtime 3.8 fseeko64, PR#7896
883  seems no longer to be needed */
884 // if(con->canwrite) fflush(fp);
885 //#endif
886  break;
887  default: whence = SEEK_SET;
888  }
889  f_seek(fp, OFF_T(where), whence);
890  if(thisconn->last_was_write) thisconn->wpos = f_tell(thisconn->fp);
891  else thisconn->rpos = f_tell(thisconn->fp);
892  return double(pos);
893 }
894 
895 static void file_truncate(Rconnection con)
896 {
897  Rfileconn thisconn = static_cast<fileconn*>(con->connprivate);
898 #ifdef HAVE_FTRUNCATE
899  FILE *fp = thisconn->fp;
900  int fd = fileno(fp);
901 /* ftruncate64 is in Mingw-64 trunk, but not in current toolkit */
902 # ifdef W64_to_come
903  off64_t size = lseek64(fd, 0, SEEK_CUR);
904 # else
905  OFF_T size = lseek(fd, 0, SEEK_CUR);
906 # endif
907 #endif
908 
909  if(!con->isopen || !con->canwrite)
910  Rf_error(_("can only truncate connections open for writing"));
911 
912  if(!thisconn->last_was_write) thisconn->rpos = f_tell(thisconn->fp);
913 #ifdef W64_to_come
914  if(ftruncate64(fd, size)) Rf_error(_("file truncation failed"));
915 #elif defined(HAVE_FTRUNCATE)
916  if(ftruncate(fd, size)) Rf_error(_("file truncation failed"));
917 #else
918  Rf_error(_("file truncation unavailable on this platform"));
919 #endif
920  thisconn->last_was_write = TRUE;
921  thisconn->wpos = f_tell(thisconn->fp);
922 }
923 
924 static int file_fflush(Rconnection con)
925 {
926  FILE *fp = (static_cast<Rfileconn>(con->connprivate))->fp;
927 
928  return fflush(fp);
929 }

931 static size_t file_read(void *ptr, size_t size, size_t nitems,
932  Rconnection con)
933 {
934  Rfileconn thisconn = static_cast<fileconn*>(con->connprivate);
935  FILE *fp = thisconn->fp;
936 
937  if(thisconn->last_was_write) {
938  thisconn->wpos = f_tell(thisconn->fp);
939  thisconn->last_was_write = FALSE;
940  f_seek(thisconn->fp, thisconn->rpos, SEEK_SET);
941  }
942  return fread(ptr, size, nitems, fp);
943 }

945 static size_t file_write(const void *ptr, size_t size, size_t nitems,
946  Rconnection con)
947 {
948  Rfileconn thisconn = static_cast<fileconn*>(con->connprivate);
949  FILE *fp = thisconn->fp;
950 
951  if(!thisconn->last_was_write) {
952  thisconn->rpos = f_tell(thisconn->fp);
953  thisconn->last_was_write = TRUE;
954  f_seek(thisconn->fp, thisconn->wpos, SEEK_SET);
955  }
956  return fwrite(ptr, size, nitems, fp);
957 }

959 static Rconnection newfile(const char *description, int enc, const char *mode,
960  int raw)
961 {
962  Rconnection newconn;
963  newconn = static_cast<Rconnection>(malloc(sizeof(struct Rconn)));
964  if(!newconn) Rf_error(_("allocation of file connection failed"));
965  newconn->connclass = static_cast<char *>(malloc(strlen("file") + 1));
966  if(!newconn->connclass) {
967  free(newconn);
968  Rf_error(_("allocation of file connection failed"));
969  /* for Solaris 12.5 */ newconn = nullptr;
970  }
971  strcpy(newconn->connclass, "file");
972  newconn->description = static_cast<char *>(malloc(strlen(description) + 1));
973  if(!newconn->description) {
974  free(newconn->connclass); free(newconn);
975  Rf_error(_("allocation of file connection failed"));
976  /* for Solaris 12.5 */ newconn = nullptr;
977  }
978  init_con(newconn, description, enc, mode);
979  newconn->open = &file_open;
980  newconn->close = &file_close;
981  newconn->vfprintf = &file_vfprintf;
982  newconn->fgetc_internal = &file_fgetc_internal;
983  newconn->fgetc = &dummy_fgetc;
984  newconn->seek = &file_seek;
985  newconn->truncate = &file_truncate;
986  newconn->fflush = &file_fflush;
987  newconn->read = &file_read;
988  newconn->write = &file_write;
989  newconn->canseek = Rboolean(raw == 0);
990  newconn->connprivate = malloc(sizeof(struct fileconn));
991  if(!newconn->connprivate) {
992  free(newconn->description); free(newconn->connclass); free(newconn);
993  Rf_error(_("allocation of file connection failed"));
994  /* for Solaris 12.5 */ newconn = nullptr;
995  }
996  (static_cast<Rfileconn>(newconn->connprivate))->raw = Rboolean(raw);
997 #ifdef Win32
998  (static_cast<Rfileconn>(newconn->connprivate))->use_fgetwc = FALSE;
999 #endif
1000  return newconn;
1001 }

1007 
1008 #if defined(HAVE_MKFIFO) && defined(HAVE_FCNTL_H)
1009 
1010 #ifdef HAVE_SYS_TYPES_H
1011 # include <sys/types.h>
1012 #endif
1013 #ifdef HAVE_SYS_STAT_H
1014 # include <sys/stat.h>
1015 #endif
1016 
1017 # include <errno.h>

1019 struct fifoconn {
1020  int fd;
1021 };
1022 typedef fifoconn* Rfifoconn;

1024 
1025 static Rboolean fifo_open(Rconnection con)
1026 {
1027  const char *name;
1028  Rfifoconn thisconn = static_cast<fifoconn*>(con->connprivate);
1029  int fd, flags, res;
1030  int mlen = int(strlen(con->mode)); // short
1031  struct stat sb;
1032  Rboolean temp = FALSE;
1033 
1034  if(strlen(con->description) == 0) {
1035  temp = TRUE;
1036  name = R_tmpnam("Rf", R_TempDir);
1037  } else name = R_ExpandFileName(con->description);
1038  con->canwrite = Rboolean((con->mode[0] == 'w' || con->mode[0] == 'a'));
1039  con->canread = Rboolean(!con->canwrite);
1040  if(mlen >= 2 && con->mode[1] == '+') con->canread = TRUE;
1041 
1042  /* if we are to write, create the fifo if needed */
1043  if(con->canwrite) {
1044  res = stat(name, &sb);
1045  if(res) { /* error, does not exist? */
1046  errno = 0;
1047  res = mkfifo(name, 00644);
1048  if(res) {
1049  Rf_warning(_("cannot create fifo '%s', reason '%s'"), name,
1050  strerror(errno));
1051  }
1052  if(res) return FALSE;
1053  } else {
1054  if(!(sb.st_mode & S_IFIFO)) {
1055  Rf_warning(_("'%s' exists but is not a fifo"), name);
1056  return FALSE;
1057  }
1058  }
1059  }
1060 
1061  if(con->canread && con->canwrite) flags = O_RDWR;
1062  else if(con->canread) flags = O_RDONLY;
1063  else flags = O_WRONLY;
1064  if(!con->blocking) flags |= O_NONBLOCK;
1065  if(con->mode[0] == 'a') flags |= O_APPEND;
1066  errno = 0; /* precaution */
1067  fd = open(name, flags);
1068  if(fd < 0) {
1069  if(errno == ENXIO) Rf_warning(_("fifo '%s' is not ready"), name);
1070  else Rf_warning(_("cannot open fifo '%s'"), name);
1071  return FALSE;
1072  }
1073  if(temp) {
1074  unlink(name);
1075  free(const_cast<char *>(name)); /* allocated by R_tmpnam */
1076  }
1077 
1078  thisconn->fd = fd;
1079  con->isopen = TRUE;
1080 
1081  if(mlen >= 2 && con->mode[mlen-1] == 'b') con->text = FALSE;
1082  else con->text = TRUE;
1083  set_buffer(con);
1084  set_iconv(con);
1085  con->save = -1000;
1086  return TRUE;
1087 }
1088 
1089 static void fifo_close(Rconnection con)
1090 {
1091  con->status = close((static_cast<Rfifoconn>((con->connprivate)))->fd);
1092  con->isopen = FALSE;
1093 }
1094 
1095 static int fifo_fgetc_internal(Rconnection con)
1096 {
1097  Rfifoconn thisconn = static_cast<Rfifoconn>(con->connprivate);
1098  unsigned char c;
1099  ssize_t n;
1100 
1101  n = read(thisconn->fd, &c, 1);
1102  return (n == 1) ? c : R_EOF;
1103 }

1105 static size_t fifo_read(void *ptr, size_t size, size_t nitems,
1106  Rconnection con)
1107 {
1108  Rfifoconn thisconn = static_cast<Rfifoconn>(con->connprivate);
1109 
1110  /* uses 'size_t' for len */
1111  if (double(size) * double(nitems) > double(SSIZE_MAX))
1112  Rf_error(_("too large a block specified"));
1113  return read(thisconn->fd, ptr, size * nitems)/size;
1114 }

1116 static size_t fifo_write(const void *ptr, size_t size, size_t nitems,
1117  Rconnection con)
1118 {
1119  Rfifoconn thisconn = static_cast<Rfifoconn>(con->connprivate);
1120 
1121  /* uses 'size_t' for len */
1122  if (double(size) * double(nitems) > double(SSIZE_MAX))
1123  Rf_error(_("too large a block specified"));
1124  return write(thisconn->fd, ptr, size * nitems)/size;
1125 }

1127 #elif defined(Win32) // ----- Windows part ------
1128 
1129 // PR#15600, based on https://github.com/0xbaadf00d/r-project_win_fifo
1130 # define WIN32_LEAN_AND_MEAN 1
1131 #include <Windows.h>
1132 #include <wchar.h>
1133

1135 errno_t strcat_s(char *strDestination, size_t numberOfElements,
1136  const char *strSource);
1137 */

1146 static char* win_getlasterror_str(void)
1147 {
1148  LPVOID lpv_tempmsg = nullptr;
1149  unsigned int err_msg_len;
1150  char *err_msg = nullptr;
1151 
1152  err_msg_len =
1153  FormatMessage(FORMAT_MESSAGE_ALLOCATE_BUFFER |
1154  FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_SYSTEM |
1155  FORMAT_MESSAGE_IGNORE_INSERTS, nullptr, GetLastError(),
1156  MAKELANGID(LANG_NEUTRAL, SUBLANG_DEFAULT),
1157  (LPTSTR)&lpv_tempmsg, 0, nullptr);
1158  err_msg = static_cast<char *>(malloc(err_msg_len));
1159  if (!err_msg) return nullptr;
1160  ZeroMemory(err_msg, err_msg_len);
1161  strncpy(err_msg, (LPTSTR)lpv_tempmsg, err_msg_len - sizeof(wchar_t));
1162  LocalFree(lpv_tempmsg);
1163  return err_msg;
1164 }
1165 
1166 static Rboolean fifo_open(Rconnection con)
1167 {
1168  Rfifoconn thisconn = con->connprivate;
1169  unsigned int uin_pipname_len = strlen(con->description);
1170  unsigned int uin_mode_len = strlen(con->mode);
1171  char *hch_pipename = nullptr;
1172  const char *hch_tempname = nullptr;
1173  Rboolean boo_retvalue = TRUE;
1174 
1175  /* Prepare FIFO filename */
1176  if (!uin_pipname_len) {
1177  hch_pipename = R_tmpnam("fifo", "\\\\.\\pipe\\");
1178  } else {
1179  if (strncmp("\\\\.\\pipe\\", con->description, 9) != 0) {
1180  uin_pipname_len += strlen("\\\\.\\pipe\\") + 1;
1181  hch_pipename = (char*) malloc(uin_pipname_len);
1182  if (!hch_pipename) Rf_error(_("allocation of fifo name failed"));
1183  ZeroMemory(hch_pipename, uin_pipname_len);
1184 /* strcpy_s(hch_pipename, uin_pipname_len, "\\\\.\\pipe\\"); Win XP doesn't support this */
1185  strcpy(hch_pipename, "\\\\.\\pipe\\");
1186  } else {
1187  hch_pipename = (char*)malloc(uin_pipname_len);
1188  if (!hch_pipename) Rf_error(_("allocation of fifo name failed"));
1189  ZeroMemory(hch_pipename, uin_pipname_len);
1190  }
1191  hch_tempname = R_ExpandFileName(con->description);
1192 /* strcat_s(hch_pipename, uin_pipname_len, hch_tempname); Win XP doesn't support this */
1193  strcat(hch_pipename, hch_tempname);
1194  }
1195 
1196  /* Prepare FIFO open mode */
1197  con->canwrite = (con->mode[0] == 'w' || con->mode[0] == 'a');
1198  con->canread = !con->canwrite;
1199  if (uin_mode_len >= 2 && con->mode[1] == '+') con->canread = TRUE;
1200 
1201  /*
1202  ** FIFO using Windows API -> CreateNamedPipe() OR CreateFile()
1203  ** http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa363858(v=vs.85).aspx
1204  ** http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa365150(v=vs.85).aspx
1205  */
1206  thisconn->hdl_namedpipe = nullptr;
1207  thisconn->overlapped_write = (LPOVERLAPPED)malloc(sizeof(OVERLAPPED));
1208  thisconn->overlapped_write = CreateEventA(nullptr, TRUE, TRUE, nullptr);
1209  if (con->canwrite) {
1210  SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES win_namedpipe_secattr = {0};
1211  win_namedpipe_secattr.nLength = sizeof(SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES);
1212  win_namedpipe_secattr.lpSecurityDescriptor = nullptr;
1213  win_namedpipe_secattr.bInheritHandle = FALSE;
1214 
1215  thisconn->hdl_namedpipe =
1216  CreateNamedPipeA(hch_pipename,
1217  (con->canread ? PIPE_ACCESS_DUPLEX :
1218  PIPE_ACCESS_OUTBOUND) | FILE_FLAG_OVERLAPPED,
1219  PIPE_TYPE_BYTE, PIPE_UNLIMITED_INSTANCES , 0, 0,
1220  FILE_FLAG_NO_BUFFERING, &win_namedpipe_secattr);
1221  if (thisconn->hdl_namedpipe == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) {
1222  /*
1223  ** If GetLastError() return 231 (All pipe instances are busy) == File
1224  ** already exist on Unix/Linux...
1225  */
1226  if (GetLastError() != 231) {
1227  char *hch_err_msg = win_getlasterror_str();
1228  Rf_warning(_("cannot create fifo '%s', reason '%s'"),
1229  hch_pipename, hch_err_msg);
1230  free(hch_err_msg);
1231  boo_retvalue = FALSE;
1232  }
1233  }
1234  }
1235 
1236  /* Open existing named pipe */
1237  if ((boo_retvalue || GetLastError() == 231) &&
1238  thisconn->hdl_namedpipe <= (HANDLE)(LONG_PTR) 0) {
1239  DWORD dwo_openmode = 0;
1240  if (con->canread) dwo_openmode |= GENERIC_READ;
1241  if (con->canwrite) dwo_openmode |= GENERIC_WRITE;
1242  thisconn->hdl_namedpipe =
1243  CreateFileA(hch_pipename, dwo_openmode,
1244  FILE_SHARE_READ | FILE_SHARE_WRITE,
1245  nullptr, OPEN_EXISTING,
1246  FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NORMAL | FILE_FLAG_OVERLAPPED,
1247  nullptr);
1248  if (thisconn->hdl_namedpipe == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) {
1249  char *hch_err_msg = win_getlasterror_str();
1250  Rf_warning(_("cannot open fifo '%s', reason '%s'"),
1251  hch_pipename, hch_err_msg);
1252  free(hch_err_msg);
1253  boo_retvalue = FALSE;
1254  }
1255  }
1256 
1257  /* Free malloc-ed variables */
1258  free(hch_pipename);
1259  if (hch_tempname) free((void*) hch_tempname);
1260 
1261  /* Finalize FIFO configuration (only if FIFO is opened/created) */
1262  if (boo_retvalue && thisconn->hdl_namedpipe) {
1263  con->isopen = TRUE;
1264  con->text = uin_mode_len >= 2 && con->mode[uin_mode_len - 1] == 'b';
1265  set_buffer(con);
1266  set_iconv(con);
1267  con->save = -1000;
1268  }
1269 
1270  /* Done */
1271  return boo_retvalue;
1272 }
1273 
1274 static void fifo_close(Rconnection con)
1275 {
1276  Rfifoconn thisconn = con->connprivate;
1277  con->isopen = FALSE;
1278  con->status = CloseHandle(thisconn->hdl_namedpipe) ? 0 : -1;
1279  if (thisconn->overlapped_write) CloseHandle(thisconn->overlapped_write);
1280 }
1281 
1282 static size_t fifo_read(void* ptr, size_t size, size_t nitems, Rconnection con)
1283 {
1284  Rfifoconn thisconn = con->connprivate;
1285  size_t read_byte = 0;
1286 
1287  // avoid integer overflow
1288  if ((double)size * sizeof(wchar_t) * nitems > UINT_MAX)
1289  Rf_error(_("too large a block specified"));
1290 
1291  wchar_t *buffer = (wchar_t*)malloc((size * sizeof(wchar_t)) * nitems);
1292  if (!buffer) Rf_error(_("allocation of fifo buffer failed"));
1293  ReadFile(thisconn->hdl_namedpipe, buffer,
1294  (size * sizeof(wchar_t)) * nitems, (LPDWORD)&read_byte,
1295  thisconn->overlapped_write);
1296  wcstombs(ptr, buffer, read_byte / sizeof(wchar_t));
1297  free(buffer);
1298  return (read_byte / sizeof(wchar_t)) / size;
1299 }
1300 
1301 static size_t fifo_write(const void *ptr, size_t size, size_t nitems, Rconnection con)
1302 {
1303  Rfifoconn thisconn = con->connprivate;
1304  size_t written_bytes = 0;
1305 
1306  if (size * sizeof(wchar_t) * nitems > UINT_MAX)
1307  Rf_error(_("too large a block specified"));
1308 
1309  /* Wait for a client process to connect */
1310  ConnectNamedPipe(thisconn->hdl_namedpipe, nullptr);
1311 
1312  /* Convert char* to wchar_t* */
1313  int str_len = size * nitems;
1314  wchar_t *buffer = malloc((str_len + 1) * sizeof(wchar_t));
1315  if (!buffer) Rf_error(_("allocation of fifo buffer failed"));
1316  mbstowcs(buffer, (const char*) ptr, str_len);
1317 
1318  /* Write data */
1319  if (WriteFile(thisconn->hdl_namedpipe, buffer,
1320  size * sizeof(wchar_t) * nitems, (LPDWORD) &written_bytes,
1321  nullptr) == FALSE && GetLastError() != ERROR_IO_PENDING) {
1322  char *hch_err_msg = win_getlasterror_str();
1323  Rf_warning(_("cannot write FIFO '%s'"), hch_err_msg);
1324  free(hch_err_msg);
1325  }
1326 
1327  /* Free data malloc-ed by windows_towchar */
1328  free(buffer);
1329 
1330  /* Done */
1331  return written_bytes / nitems;
1332 }
1333 
1334 static int fifo_fgetc_internal(Rconnection con)
1335 {
1336  Rfifoconn thisconn = con->connprivate;
1337  DWORD available_bytes = 0;
1338  DWORD read_byte = 0;
1339  DWORD len = 1 * sizeof(wchar_t);
1340  wchar_t c;
1341 
1342  /* Check available bytes on named pipe */
1343  PeekNamedPipe(thisconn->hdl_namedpipe, nullptr, 0, nullptr, &available_bytes, nullptr);
1344 
1345  /* Read char if available bytes > 0, otherwize, return R_EOF */
1346  if (available_bytes > 0) {
1347  ReadFile(thisconn->hdl_namedpipe, &c, len, &read_byte, nullptr);
1348  return (read_byte == len) ? (char) c : R_EOF;
1349  }
1350  return R_EOF;
1351 }
1352 
1353 #endif // WIN32
1354 
1355 static Rconnection newfifo(const char *description, const char *mode)
1356 {
1357  Rconnection newconn;
1358  newconn = static_cast<Rconnection>(malloc(sizeof(struct Rconn)));
1359  if(!newconn) Rf_error(_("allocation of fifo connection failed"));
1360  newconn->connclass = static_cast<char *>(malloc(strlen("fifo") + 1));
1361  if(!newconn->connclass) {
1362  free(newconn);
1363  Rf_error(_("allocation of fifo connection failed"));
1364  /* for Solaris 12.5 */ newconn = nullptr;
1365  }
1366  strcpy(newconn->connclass, "fifo");
1367  newconn->description = static_cast<char *>(malloc(strlen(description) + 1));
1368  if(!newconn->description) {
1369  free(newconn->connclass); free(newconn);
1370  Rf_error(_("allocation of fifo connection failed"));
1371  /* for Solaris 12.5 */ newconn = nullptr;
1372  }
1373  init_con(newconn, description, CE_NATIVE, mode);
1374  newconn->open = &fifo_open;
1375  newconn->close = &fifo_close;
1376  newconn->vfprintf = &dummy_vfprintf;
1377  newconn->fgetc_internal = &fifo_fgetc_internal;
1378  newconn->fgetc = &dummy_fgetc;
1379  newconn->seek = &null_seek;
1380  newconn->truncate = &null_truncate;
1381  newconn->fflush = &null_fflush;
1382  newconn->read = &fifo_read;
1383  newconn->write = &fifo_write;
1384  newconn->connprivate = malloc(sizeof(struct fifoconn));
1385  if(!newconn->connprivate) {
1386  free(newconn->description); free(newconn->connclass); free(newconn);
1387  Rf_error(_("allocation of fifo connection failed"));
1388  /* for Solaris 12.5 */ newconn = nullptr;
1389  }
1390  return newconn;
1391 }

1393 HIDDEN SEXP do_fifo(/*const*/ Expression* call, const BuiltInFunction* op, RObject* description_, RObject* open_, RObject* blocking_, RObject* encoding_)
1394 {
1395 #if (defined(HAVE_MKFIFO) && defined(HAVE_FCNTL_H)) || defined(_WIN32)
1396  SEXP sfile, sopen, ans, connclass, enc;
1397  const char *file, *open;
1398  int ncon, block;
1399  Rconnection con = nullptr;
1400 
1401  sfile = description_;
1402  if(!Rf_isString(sfile) || Rf_length(sfile) != 1)
1403  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "description");
1404  if(Rf_length(sfile) > 1)
1405  Rf_warning(_("only first element of 'description' argument used"));
1406  file = Rf_translateChar(STRING_ELT(sfile, 0)); /* for now, like fopen */
1407  sopen = open_;
1408  if(!Rf_isString(sopen) || Rf_length(sopen) != 1)
1409  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "open");
1410  block = Rf_asLogical(blocking_);
1411  if(block == R_NaLog)
1412  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "block");
1413  enc = encoding_;
1414  if(!Rf_isString(enc) || Rf_length(enc) != 1 ||
1415  strlen(R_CHAR(STRING_ELT(enc, 0))) > 100) /* ASCII */
1416  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "encoding");
1417  open = R_CHAR(STRING_ELT(sopen, 0)); /* ASCII */
1418  if(strlen(file) == 0) {
1419  if(!strlen(open)) open ="w+";
1420  if(strcmp(open, "w+") != 0 && strcmp(open, "w+b") != 0) {
1421  open ="w+";
1422  Rf_warning(_("fifo(\"\") only supports open = \"w+\" and open = \"w+b\": using the former"));
1423  }
1424  }
1425  ncon = NextConnection();
1426  con = Connections[ncon] = newfifo(file, strlen(open) ? open : const_cast<char *>("r"));
1427  con->blocking = Rboolean(block);
1428  strncpy(con->encname, R_CHAR(STRING_ELT(enc, 0)), 100); /* ASCII */
1429  con->encname[100 - 1] = '\0';
1430  con->ex_ptr = PROTECT(R_MakeExternalPtr(con->id, Rf_install("connection"), nullptr));
1431 
1432  /* open it if desired */
1433  if(strlen(open)) {
1434  Rboolean success = con->open(con);
1435  if(!success) {
1436  con_destroy(ncon);
1437  Rf_error(_("cannot open the connection"));
1438  }
1439  }
1440 
1441  PROTECT(ans = Rf_ScalarInteger(ncon));
1442  PROTECT(connclass = Rf_allocVector(STRSXP, 2));
1443  SET_STRING_ELT(connclass, 0, Rf_mkChar("fifo"));
1444  SET_STRING_ELT(connclass, 1, Rf_mkChar("connection"));
1445  Rf_classgets(ans, connclass);
1446  Rf_setAttrib(ans, Symbols::ConnIdSymbol, static_cast<SEXP>(con->ex_ptr));
1447  R_RegisterCFinalizerEx(static_cast<SEXP>(con->ex_ptr), conFinalizer, FALSE);
1448  UNPROTECT(3);
1449 
1450  return ans;
1451 #else
1452  Rf_error(_("fifo connections are not available on this system"));
1453  return nullptr; /* -Wall */
1454 #endif
1455 }

1458 
1459 static Rboolean pipe_open(Rconnection con)
1460 {
1461  FILE *fp;
1462  char mode[3];
1463  Rfileconn thisconn = (Rfileconn)con->connprivate;
1464 
1465 #ifdef Win32
1466  strncpy(mode, con->mode, 2);
1467  mode[2] = '\0';
1468 #else
1469  mode[0] = con->mode[0];
1470  mode[1] = '\0';
1471 #endif
1472  errno = 0;
1473 #ifdef Win32
1474  if(con->enc == CE_UTF8) {
1475  int n = strlen(con->description);
1476  wchar_t wname[2 * (n+1)], wmode[10];
1477  R_CheckStack();
1478  Rf_utf8towcs(wname, con->description, n+1);
1479  mbstowcs(wmode, con->mode, 10);
1480  fp = _wpopen(wname, wmode);
1481  if(!fp) {
1482  Rf_warning(_("cannot pipe() cmd '%ls': %s"), wname, strerror(errno));
1483  return FALSE;
1484  }
1485  } else
1486 #endif
1487  fp = R_popen(con->description, mode);
1488  if(!fp) {
1489  Rf_warning(_("cannot open pipe() cmd '%s': %s"), con->description,
1490  strerror(errno));
1491  return FALSE;
1492  }
1493  thisconn->fp = fp;
1494  con->isopen = TRUE;
1495  con->canwrite = Rboolean((con->mode[0] == 'w'));
1496  con->canread = Rboolean(!con->canwrite);
1497  if(strlen(con->mode) >= 2 && con->mode[1] == 'b') con->text = FALSE;
1498  else con->text = TRUE;
1499  thisconn->last_was_write = Rboolean(!con->canread);
1500  thisconn->rpos = thisconn->wpos = 0;
1501  set_buffer(con);
1502  set_iconv(con);
1503  con->save = -1000;
1504  return TRUE;
1505 }
1506 
1507 static void pipe_close(Rconnection con)
1508 {
1509  con->status = pclose((static_cast<Rfileconn>((con->connprivate)))->fp);
1510  con->isopen = FALSE;
1511 }

1513 static Rconnection newpipe(const char *description, int ienc, const char *mode)
1514 {
1515  Rconnection newconn;
1516  newconn = static_cast<Rconnection>(malloc(sizeof(struct Rconn)));
1517  if(!newconn) Rf_error(_("allocation of pipe connection failed"));
1518  newconn->connclass = static_cast<char *>(malloc(strlen("pipe") + 1));
1519  if(!newconn->connclass) {
1520  free(newconn);
1521  Rf_error(_("allocation of pipe connection failed"));
1522  /* for Solaris 12.5 */ newconn = nullptr;
1523  }
1524  strcpy(newconn->connclass, "pipe");
1525  newconn->description = static_cast<char *>(malloc(strlen(description) + 1));
1526  if(!newconn->description) {
1527  free(newconn->connclass); free(newconn);
1528  Rf_error(_("allocation of pipe connection failed"));
1529  /* for Solaris 12.5 */ newconn = nullptr;
1530  }
1531  init_con(newconn, description, ienc, mode);
1532  newconn->open = &pipe_open;
1533  newconn->close = &pipe_close;
1534  newconn->vfprintf = &file_vfprintf;

1536  newconn->fgetc = &dummy_fgetc;
1537  newconn->fflush = &file_fflush;
1538  newconn->read = &file_read;
1539  newconn->write = &file_write;
1540  newconn->connprivate = malloc(sizeof(struct fileconn));
1541  if(!newconn->connprivate) {
1542  free(newconn->description); free(newconn->connclass); free(newconn);
1543  Rf_error(_("allocation of pipe connection failed"));
1544  /* for Solaris 12.5 */ newconn = nullptr;
1545  }
1546  return newconn;
1547 }

1554 HIDDEN SEXP do_pipe(/*const*/ Expression* call, const BuiltInFunction* op, RObject* description_, RObject* open_, RObject* encoding_)
1555 {
1556  SEXP scmd, sopen, ans, connclass, enc;
1557  const char *file, *open;
1558  int ncon;
1559  cetype_t ienc = CE_NATIVE;
1560  Rconnection con = nullptr;
1561 
1562  scmd = description_;
1563  if(!Rf_isString(scmd) || Rf_length(scmd) != 1)
1564  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "description");
1565  if(Rf_length(scmd) > 1)
1566  Rf_warning(_("only first element of 'description' argument used"));
1567 #ifdef Win32
1568  if( !IS_ASCII(STRING_ELT(scmd, 0)) ) {
1569  ienc = CE_UTF8;
1570  file = Rf_translateCharUTF8(STRING_ELT(scmd, 0));
1571  } else {
1572  ienc = CE_NATIVE;
1573  file = Rf_translateChar(STRING_ELT(scmd, 0));
1574  }
1575 #else
1576  file = Rf_translateChar(STRING_ELT(scmd, 0));
1577 #endif
1578  sopen = open_;
1579  if(!Rf_isString(sopen) || Rf_length(sopen) != 1)
1580  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "open");
1581  open = R_CHAR(STRING_ELT(sopen, 0)); /* ASCII */
1582  enc = encoding_;
1583  if(!Rf_isString(enc) || Rf_length(enc) != 1 ||
1584  strlen(R_CHAR(STRING_ELT(enc, 0))) > 100) /* ASCII */
1585  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "encoding");
1586 
1587  ncon = NextConnection();
1588 #ifdef Win32
1589  if(CharacterMode != RTerm)
1590  con = newWpipe(file, ienc, strlen(open) ? open : "r");
1591  else
1592 #endif
1593  con = newpipe(file, ienc, strlen(open) ? open : "r");
1594  Connections[ncon] = con;
1595  strncpy(con->encname, R_CHAR(STRING_ELT(enc, 0)), 100); /* ASCII */
1596  con->encname[100 - 1] = '\0';
1597  con->ex_ptr = PROTECT(R_MakeExternalPtr(con->id, Rf_install("connection"), nullptr));
1598 
1599  /* open it if desired */
1600  if(strlen(open)) {
1601  Rboolean success = con->open(con);
1602  if(!success) {
1603  con_destroy(ncon);
1604  Rf_error(_("cannot open the connection"));
1605  }
1606  }
1607 
1608  PROTECT(ans = Rf_ScalarInteger(ncon));
1609  PROTECT(connclass = Rf_allocVector(STRSXP, 2));
1610  SET_STRING_ELT(connclass, 0, Rf_mkChar("pipe"));
1611 #ifdef Win32
1612  if(CharacterMode != RTerm)
1613  SET_STRING_ELT(connclass, 0, Rf_mkChar("pipeWin32"));
1614 #endif
1615  SET_STRING_ELT(connclass, 1, Rf_mkChar("connection"));
1616  Rf_classgets(ans, connclass);
1617  Rf_setAttrib(ans, Symbols::ConnIdSymbol, static_cast<SEXP>(con->ex_ptr));
1618  R_RegisterCFinalizerEx(static_cast<SEXP>(con->ex_ptr), conFinalizer, FALSE);
1619  UNPROTECT(3);
1620 
1621  return ans;
1622 }

1649 static Rboolean gzfile_open(Rconnection con)
1650 {
1651  gzFile fp;
1652  char mode[6];
1653  Rgzfileconn gzcon = static_cast<Rgzfileconn>(con->connprivate);
1654 
1655  strcpy(mode, con->mode);
1656  /* Must open as binary */
1657  if(strchr(con->mode, 'w')) snprintf(mode, 6, "wb%1d", gzcon->compress);
1658  else if (con->mode[0] == 'a') snprintf(mode, 6, "ab%1d", gzcon->compress);
1659  else strcpy(mode, "rb");
1660  errno = 0; /* precaution */
1661  fp = R_gzopen(R_ExpandFileName(con->description), mode);
1662  if(!fp) {
1663  Rf_warning(_("cannot open compressed file '%s', probable reason '%s'"),
1664  R_ExpandFileName(con->description), strerror(errno));
1665  return FALSE;
1666  }
1667  (static_cast<Rgzfileconn>((con->connprivate)))->fp = fp;
1668  con->isopen = TRUE;
1669  con->canwrite = Rboolean((con->mode[0] == 'w' || con->mode[0] == 'a'));
1670  con->canread = Rboolean(!con->canwrite);
1671  con->text = strchr(con->mode, 'b') ? FALSE : TRUE;
1672  set_buffer(con);
1673  set_iconv(con);
1674  con->save = -1000;
1675  return TRUE;
1676 }
1677 
1678 static void gzfile_close(Rconnection con)
1679 {
1680  R_gzclose((static_cast<Rgzfileconn>((con->connprivate)))->fp);
1681  con->isopen = FALSE;
1682 }

1684 static int gzfile_fgetc_internal(Rconnection con)
1685 {
1686  gzFile fp = (static_cast<Rgzfileconn>((con->connprivate)))->fp;
1687  unsigned char c;
1688 
1689  return R_gzread(fp, &c, 1) == 1 ? c : R_EOF;
1690 }
1691 
1692 /* This can only seek forwards when writing (when it writes nul bytes).
1693  When reading, it either seeks forwards or rewinds and reads again */
1694 static double gzfile_seek(Rconnection con, double where, int origin, int rw)
1695 {
1696  gzFile fp = (static_cast<Rgzfileconn>((con->connprivate)))->fp;
1697  Rz_off_t pos = R_gztell(fp);
1698  int res, whence = SEEK_SET;
1699 
1700  if (ISNA(where)) return double(pos);
1701 
1702  switch(origin) {
1703  case 2: whence = SEEK_CUR; break;
1704  case 3: Rf_error(_("whence = \"end\" is not implemented for gzfile connections"));
1705  default: whence = SEEK_SET;
1706  }
1707  res = R_gzseek(fp, z_off_t( where), whence);
1708  if(res == -1)
1709  Rf_warning(_("seek on a gzfile connection returned an internal error"));
1710  return double(pos);
1711 }

1722  /* uses 'unsigned' for len */
1723  if (double(size) * double(nitems) > UINT_MAX)
1724  Rf_error(_("too large a block specified"));
1725  return R_gzread(fp, ptr, static_cast<unsigned int>(size*nitems))/size;

1787 static Rboolean bzfile_open(Rconnection con)
1788 {
1789  Rbzfileconn bz = static_cast<Rbzfileconn>(con->connprivate);
1790  FILE* fp;
1791  BZFILE* bfp;
1792  int bzerror;
1793  char mode[] = "rb";
1794 
1795  con->canwrite = Rboolean((con->mode[0] == 'w' || con->mode[0] == 'a'));
1796  con->canread = Rboolean(!con->canwrite);
1797  /* regardless of the R view of the file, the file must be opened in
1798  binary mode where it matters */
1799  mode[0] = con->mode[0];
1800  errno = 0; /* precaution */
1801  fp = R_fopen(R_ExpandFileName(con->description), mode);
1802  if(!fp) {
1803  Rf_warning(_("cannot open bzip2-ed file '%s', probable reason '%s'"),
1804  R_ExpandFileName(con->description), strerror(errno));
1805  return FALSE;
1806  }
1807  if(con->canread) {
1808  bfp = BZ2_bzReadOpen(&bzerror, fp, 0, 0, nullptr, 0);
1809  if(bzerror != BZ_OK) {
1810  BZ2_bzReadClose(&bzerror, bfp);
1811  fclose(fp);
1812  Rf_warning(_("file '%s' appears not to be compressed by bzip2"),
1813  R_ExpandFileName(con->description));
1814  return FALSE;
1815  }
1816  } else {
1817  bfp = BZ2_bzWriteOpen(&bzerror, fp, bz->compress, 0, 0);
1818  if(bzerror != BZ_OK) {
1819  BZ2_bzWriteClose(&bzerror, bfp, 0, nullptr, nullptr);
1820  fclose(fp);
1821  Rf_warning(_("initializing bzip2 compression for file '%s' failed"),
1822  R_ExpandFileName(con->description));
1823  return FALSE;
1824  }
1825  }
1826  bz->fp = fp;
1827  bz->bfp = bfp;
1828  con->isopen = TRUE;
1829  con->text = strchr(con->mode, 'b') ? FALSE : TRUE;
1830  set_buffer(con);
1831  set_iconv(con);
1832  con->save = -1000;
1833  return TRUE;
1834 }
1835 
1836 static void bzfile_close(Rconnection con)
1837 {
1838  int bzerror;
1839  Rbzfileconn bz = static_cast<Rbzfileconn>(con->connprivate);
1840 
1841  if(con->canread)
1842  BZ2_bzReadClose(&bzerror, bz->bfp);
1843  else
1844  BZ2_bzWriteClose(&bzerror, bz->bfp, 0, nullptr, nullptr);
1845  fclose(bz->fp);
1846  con->isopen = FALSE;
1847 }
1848 
1849 static size_t bzfile_read(void *ptr, size_t size, size_t nitems,
1850  Rconnection con)
1851 {
1852  Rbzfileconn bz = static_cast<Rbzfileconn>(con->connprivate);
1853  int nread = 0, nleft;
1854  int bzerror;
1855 
1856  /* BZ2 uses 'int' for len */
1857  if (double(size) * double(nitems) > INT_MAX)
1858  Rf_error(_("too large a block specified"));
1859 
1860  nleft = int(size * nitems);
1861  /* we try to fill the buffer, because fgetc can interact with the stream boundaries
1862  resulting in truncated text streams while binary streams work fine */
1863  while (nleft > 0) {
1864  /* Need a cast as 'nread' needs to be interpreted in bytes */
1865  int n = BZ2_bzRead(&bzerror, bz->bfp, static_cast<char *>(ptr) + nread, nleft);
1866  if (bzerror == BZ_STREAM_END) { /* this could mean multiple streams so we need to check */
1867  char *unused, *next_unused = nullptr;
1868  int nUnused;
1869  BZ2_bzReadGetUnused(&bzerror, bz->bfp, reinterpret_cast<void**>(&unused), &nUnused);
1870  if (bzerror == BZ_OK) {
1871  if (nUnused > 0) { /* unused bytes present - need to retain them */
1872  /* given that this should be rare I don't want to add that overhead
1873  to the entire bz structure so we allocate memory temporarily */
1874  next_unused = static_cast<char*>(malloc(nUnused));
1875  if (!next_unused)
1876  Rf_error(_("allocation of overflow buffer for bzfile failed"));
1877  memcpy(next_unused, unused, nUnused);
1878  }
1879  if (nUnused > 0 || !feof(bz->fp)) {
1880  BZ2_bzReadClose(&bzerror, bz->bfp);
1881  bz->bfp = BZ2_bzReadOpen(&bzerror, bz->fp, 0, 0, next_unused, nUnused);
1882  if(bzerror != BZ_OK)
1883  Rf_warning(_("file '%s' has trailing content that appears not to be compressed by bzip2"),
1884  R_ExpandFileName(con->description));
1885  }
1886  if (next_unused) free(next_unused);
1887  }
1888  } else if (bzerror != BZ_OK) {
1889  /* bzlib docs say in this case n is invalid - but historically
1890  we still used n in that case, so I keep it for now */
1891  nread += n;
1892  break;
1893  }
1894  nread += n;
1895  nleft -= n;
1896  }
1897 
1898  return nread / size;
1899 }
1900 
1901 static int bzfile_fgetc_internal(Rconnection con)
1902 {
1903  char buf[1];
1904  size_t size;
1905 
1906  size = bzfile_read(buf, 1, 1, con);
1907  return (size < 1) ? R_EOF : (buf[0] % 256);
1908 }

1910 static size_t bzfile_write(const void *ptr, size_t size, size_t nitems,
1911  Rconnection con)
1912 {
1913  Rbzfileconn bz = static_cast<Rbzfileconn>(con->connprivate);
1914  int bzerror;
1915 
1916  /* uses 'int' for len */
1917  if (double(size) * double(nitems) > INT_MAX)
1918  Rf_error(_("too large a block specified"));
1919  BZ2_bzWrite(&bzerror, bz->bfp, const_cast<voidp>(ptr), int(size*nitems));
1920  if(bzerror != BZ_OK) return 0;
1921  else return nitems;
1922 }

1967 struct xzfileconn {
1968  FILE *fp;
1969  lzma_stream stream;
1970  lzma_action action;
1971  int compress;
1972  int type;
1973  lzma_filter filters[2];
1974  lzma_options_lzma opt_lzma;
1975  unsigned char buf[BUFSIZE];
1976 };
1977 typedef xzfileconn* Rxzfileconn;
1978 
1979 static Rboolean xzfile_open(Rconnection con)
1980 {
1981  Rxzfileconn xz = static_cast<Rxzfileconn>(con->connprivate);
1982  lzma_ret ret;
1983  char mode[] = "rb";
1984 
1985  con->canwrite = Rboolean((con->mode[0] == 'w' || con->mode[0] == 'a'));
1986  con->canread = Rboolean(!con->canwrite);
1987  /* regardless of the R view of the file, the file must be opened in
1988  binary mode where it matters */
1989  mode[0] = con->mode[0];
1990  errno = 0; /* precaution */
1991  xz->fp = R_fopen(R_ExpandFileName(con->description), mode);
1992  if(!xz->fp) {
1993  Rf_warning(_("cannot open compressed file '%s', probable reason '%s'"),
1994  R_ExpandFileName(con->description), strerror(errno));
1995  return FALSE;
1996  }
1997  if(con->canread) {
1998  xz->action = LZMA_RUN;
1999  /* probably about 80Mb is required, but 512Mb seems OK as a limit */
2000  if (xz->type == 1)
2001  ret = lzma_alone_decoder(&xz->stream, 536870912);
2002  else
2003  ret = lzma_stream_decoder(&xz->stream, 536870912,
2004  LZMA_CONCATENATED);
2005  if (ret != LZMA_OK) {
2006  Rf_warning(_("cannot initialize lzma decoder, error %d"), ret);
2007  return FALSE;
2008  }
2009  xz->stream.avail_in = 0;
2010  } else {
2011  lzma_stream *strm = &xz->stream;
2012  uint32_t preset_number = abs(xz->compress);
2013  if(xz->compress < 0) preset_number |= LZMA_PRESET_EXTREME;
2014  if(lzma_lzma_preset(&xz->opt_lzma, preset_number))
2015  Rf_error("problem setting presets");
2016  xz->filters[0].id = LZMA_FILTER_LZMA2;
2017  xz->filters[0].options = &(xz->opt_lzma);
2018  xz->filters[1].id = LZMA_VLI_UNKNOWN;
2019 
2020  ret = lzma_stream_encoder(strm, xz->filters, LZMA_CHECK_CRC32);
2021  if (ret != LZMA_OK) {
2022  Rf_warning(_("cannot initialize lzma encoder, error %d"), ret);
2023  return FALSE;
2024  }
2025  }
2026  con->isopen = TRUE;
2027  con->text = strchr(con->mode, 'b') ? FALSE : TRUE;
2028  set_buffer(con);
2029  set_iconv(con);
2030  con->save = -1000;
2031  return TRUE;
2032 }
2033 
2034 static void xzfile_close(Rconnection con)
2035 {
2036  Rxzfileconn xz = static_cast<Rxzfileconn>(con->connprivate);
2037 
2038  if(con->canwrite) {
2039  lzma_ret ret;
2040  lzma_stream *strm = &(xz->stream);
2041  size_t nout, res;
2042  unsigned char buf[BUFSIZE];
2043  while(1) {
2044  strm->avail_out = BUFSIZE; strm->next_out = buf;
2045  ret = lzma_code(strm, LZMA_FINISH);
2046  nout = BUFSIZE - strm->avail_out;
2047  res = fwrite(buf, 1, nout, xz->fp);
2048  if (res != nout) Rf_error("fwrite error");
2049  if (ret != LZMA_OK) break;
2050  }
2051  }
2052  lzma_end(&(xz->stream));
2053  fclose(xz->fp);
2054  con->isopen = FALSE;
2055 }
2056 
2057 static size_t xzfile_read(void *ptr, size_t size, size_t nitems,
2058  Rconnection con)
2059 {
2060  Rxzfileconn xz = static_cast<Rxzfileconn>(con->connprivate);
2061  lzma_stream *strm = &(xz->stream);
2062  lzma_ret ret;
2063  size_t s = size*nitems, have, given = 0;
2064  unsigned char *p = static_cast<unsigned char *>(ptr);
2065 
2066  if (!s) return 0;
2067 
2068  while(1) {
2069  if (strm->avail_in == 0 && xz->action != LZMA_FINISH) {
2070  strm->next_in = xz->buf;
2071  strm->avail_in = fread(xz->buf, 1, BUFSIZ, xz->fp);
2072  if (feof(xz->fp)) xz->action = LZMA_FINISH;
2073  }
2074  strm->avail_out = s; strm->next_out = p;
2075  ret = lzma_code(strm, xz->action);
2076  have = s - strm->avail_out; given += have;
2077  //printf("available: %d, ready: %d/%d\n", strm->avail_in, given, s);
2078  if (ret != LZMA_OK) {
2079  if (ret != LZMA_STREAM_END) {
2080  switch(ret) {
2081  case LZMA_MEM_ERROR:
2082  case LZMA_MEMLIMIT_ERROR:
2083  Rf_warning("lzma decoder needed more memory");
2084  break;
2085  case LZMA_FORMAT_ERROR:
2086  Rf_warning("lzma decoder format error");
2087  break;
2088  case LZMA_DATA_ERROR:
2089  Rf_warning("lzma decoder corrupt data");
2090  break;
2091  default:
2092  Rf_warning("lzma decoding result %d", ret);
2093  }
2094  }
2095  return given/size;
2096  }
2097  s -= have;
2098  if (!s) return nitems;
2099  p += have;
2100  }
2101 }

2103 static int xzfile_fgetc_internal(Rconnection con)
2104 {
2105  char buf[1];
2106  size_t size = xzfile_read(buf, 1, 1, con);
2107 
2108  return (size < 1) ? R_EOF : (buf[0] % 256);

2112 static size_t xzfile_write(const void *ptr, size_t size, size_t nitems,
2113  Rconnection con)
2114 {
2115  Rxzfileconn xz = static_cast<Rxzfileconn>(con->connprivate);
2116  lzma_stream *strm = &(xz->stream);
2117  lzma_ret ret;
2118  size_t s = size*nitems, nout, res;
2119  const unsigned char *p = static_cast<const unsigned char*>(ptr);
2120  unsigned char buf[BUFSIZE];
2121 
2122  if (!s) return 0;
2123 
2124  strm->avail_in = s;
2125  strm->next_in = p;
2126  while(1) {
2127  strm->avail_out = BUFSIZE; strm->next_out = buf;
2128  ret = lzma_code(strm, LZMA_RUN);
2129  if (ret > 1) {
2130  switch(ret) {
2131  case LZMA_MEM_ERROR:
2132  Rf_warning("lzma encoder needed more memory");
2133  break;
2134  default:
2135  Rf_warning("lzma encoding result %d", ret);
2136  }
2137  return 0;
2138  }
2139  nout = BUFSIZE - strm->avail_out;
2140  res = fwrite(buf, 1, nout, xz->fp);
2141  if (res != nout) Rf_error("fwrite error");
2142  if (strm->avail_in == 0) return nitems;
2143  }
2144 }

2188 /* op 0 is gzfile, 1 is bzfile, 2 is xv/lzma */
2189 HIDDEN SEXP do_gzfile(/*const*/ Expression* call, const BuiltInFunction* op, RObject* description_, RObject* open_, RObject* encoding_, RObject* compression_)
2190 {
2191  SEXP sfile, sopen, ans, connclass, enc;
2192  const char *file, *open;
2193  int ncon, compress = 9;
2194  Rconnection con = nullptr;
2195  int type = op->variant();
2196  int subtype = 0;
2197 
2198  sfile = description_;
2199  if(!Rf_isString(sfile) || Rf_length(sfile) != 1)
2200  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "description");
2201  if(Rf_length(sfile) > 1)
2202  Rf_warning(_("only first element of 'description' argument used"));
2203  file = Rf_translateChar(STRING_ELT(sfile, 0));
2204  sopen = open_;
2205  if(!Rf_isString(sopen) || Rf_length(sopen) != 1)
2206  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "open");
2207  enc = encoding_;
2208  if(!Rf_isString(enc) || Rf_length(enc) != 1 ||
2209  strlen(R_CHAR(STRING_ELT(enc, 0))) > 100) /* ASCII */
2210  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "encoding");
2211  if(type < 2) {
2212  compress = Rf_asInteger(compression_);
2213  if(compress == R_NaLog || compress < 0 || compress > 9)
2214  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "compress");
2215  }
2216  if(type == 2) {
2217  compress = Rf_asInteger(compression_);
2218  if(compress == R_NaLog || abs(compress) > 9)
2219  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "compress");
2220  }
2221  open = R_CHAR(STRING_ELT(sopen, 0)); /* ASCII */
2222  if (type == 0 && (!open[0] || open[0] == 'r')) {
2223  /* check magic no */
2224  FILE *fp = fopen(R_ExpandFileName(file), "rb");
2225  char buf[7];
2226  if (fp) {
2227  size_t res;
2228  memset(buf, 0, 7); res = fread(buf, 5, 1, fp); fclose(fp);
2229  if(res == 1) {
2230  if(streqln(buf, "BZh", 3)) type = 1;
2231  if((buf[0] == '\xFD') && streqln(buf+1, "7zXZ", 4)) type = 2;
2232  if((buf[0] == '\xFF') && streqln(buf+1, "LZMA", 4)) {
2233  type = 2; subtype = 1;
2234  }
2235  if(!memcmp(buf, "]\0\0\200\0", 5)) {
2236  type = 2; subtype = 1;
2237  }
2238  if((buf[0] == '\x89') && streqln(buf+1, "LZO", 3))
2239  Rf_error(_("this is a %s-compressed file which this build of R does not support"), "lzop");
2240  }
2241  }
2242  }
2243  switch(type) {
2244  case 0:
2245  con = newgzfile(file, strlen(open) ? open : "rb", compress);
2246  break;
2247  case 1:
2248  con = newbzfile(file, strlen(open) ? open : "rb", compress);
2249  break;
2250  case 2:
2251  con = newxzfile(file, strlen(open) ? open : "rb", subtype, compress);
2252  break;
2253  }
2254  ncon = NextConnection();
2255  Connections[ncon] = con;
2256  strncpy(con->encname, R_CHAR(STRING_ELT(enc, 0)), 100); /* ASCII */
2257  con->encname[100 - 1] = '\0';
2258 
2259  /* see the comment in do_url */
2260  if (con->encname[0] && !streql(con->encname, "native.enc"))
2261  con->canseek = FALSE;
2262  con->ex_ptr = PROTECT(R_MakeExternalPtr(con->id, Rf_install("connection"), nullptr));
2263 
2264  /* open it if desired */
2265  if(strlen(open)) {
2266  Rboolean success = con->open(con);
2267  if(!success) {
2268  con_destroy(ncon);
2269  Rf_error(_("cannot open the connection"));
2270  }
2271  }
2272 
2273  PROTECT(ans = Rf_ScalarInteger(ncon));
2274  PROTECT(connclass = Rf_allocVector(STRSXP, 2));
2275  switch(type) {
2276  case 0:
2277  SET_STRING_ELT(connclass, 0, Rf_mkChar("gzfile"));
2278  break;
2279  case 1:
2280  SET_STRING_ELT(connclass, 0, Rf_mkChar("bzfile"));
2281  break;
2282  case 2:
2283  SET_STRING_ELT(connclass, 0, Rf_mkChar("xzfile"));
2284  break;
2285  }
2286  SET_STRING_ELT(connclass, 1, Rf_mkChar("connection"));
2287  Rf_classgets(ans, connclass);
2288  Rf_setAttrib(ans, Symbols::ConnIdSymbol, static_cast<SEXP>(con->ex_ptr));
2289  R_RegisterCFinalizerEx(static_cast<SEXP>(con->ex_ptr), conFinalizer, FALSE);
2290  UNPROTECT(3);
2291 
2292  return ans;
2293 }

2296 
2297 #ifdef Win32
2298 # define WIN32_LEAN_AND_MEAN 1
2299 #include <windows.h>
2300 extern int GA_clipboardhastext(void); /* from ga.h */
2301 #endif
2302 
2303 #ifdef Unix
2304 // Defined in unix/X11.cpp :
2305 Rboolean R_ReadClipboard(Rclpconn clpcon, char *type);
2306 #endif

2308 static Rboolean clp_open(Rconnection con)
2309 {
2310  Rclpconn thisconn = static_cast<clpconn*>(con->connprivate);
2311 
2312  con->isopen = TRUE;
2313  con->canwrite = Rboolean((con->mode[0] == 'w' || con->mode[0] == 'a'));
2314  con->canread = Rboolean(!con->canwrite);
2315  thisconn->pos = 0;
2316  if(con->canread) {
2317  /* copy the clipboard contents now */
2318 #ifdef Win32
2319  HGLOBAL hglb;
2320  char *pc;
2321  if(GA_clipboardhastext() &&
2322  OpenClipboard(nullptr) &&
2323  (hglb = GetClipboardData(CF_TEXT)) &&
2324  (pc = (char *)GlobalLock(hglb))) {
2325  int len = int(strlen(pc)); // will be fairly small
2326  thisconn->buff = (char *)malloc(len + 1);
2327  thisconn->last = thisconn->len = len;
2328  if(thisconn->buff) {
2329  strcpy(thisconn->buff, pc);
2330  GlobalUnlock(hglb);
2331  CloseClipboard();
2332  } else {
2333  GlobalUnlock(hglb);
2334  CloseClipboard();
2335  thisconn->buff = nullptr; thisconn->last = thisconn->len = 0;
2336  Rf_warning(_("memory allocation to copy clipboard failed"));
2337  return FALSE;
2338  }
2339  } else {
2340  thisconn->buff = nullptr; thisconn->last = thisconn->len = 0;
2341  Rf_warning(_("clipboard cannot be opened or contains no text"));
2342  return FALSE;
2343  }
2344 #else
2345  Rboolean res = R_ReadClipboard(thisconn, con->description);
2346  if(!res) return FALSE;
2347 #endif
2348  } else {
2349  int len = (thisconn->sizeKB)*1024;
2350  thisconn->buff = static_cast<char *>(malloc(len + 1));
2351  if(!thisconn->buff) {
2352  Rf_warning(_("memory allocation to open clipboard failed"));
2353  return FALSE;
2354  }
2355  thisconn->len = len;
2356  thisconn->last = 0;
2357  }
2358  con->text = TRUE;
2359  /* Not calling set_buffer(con) as the data is already buffered */
2360  set_iconv(con);
2361  con->save = -1000;
2362  thisconn->warned = FALSE;
2363 
2364  return TRUE;
2365 }
2366 
2367 static void clp_writeout(Rconnection con)
2368 {
2369 #ifdef Win32
2370  Rclpconn thisconn = con->connprivate;
2371 
2372  HGLOBAL hglb;
2373  char *s, *p;
2374  if ( (hglb = GlobalAlloc(GHND, thisconn->len)) &&
2375  (s = (char *)GlobalLock(hglb)) ) {
2376  p = thisconn->buff;
2377  while(p < thisconn->buff + thisconn->pos) *s++ = *p++;
2378  *s = '\0';
2379  GlobalUnlock(hglb);
2380  if (!OpenClipboard(nullptr) || !EmptyClipboard()) {
2381  Rf_warning(_("unable to open the clipboard"));
2382  GlobalFree(hglb);
2383  } else {
2384  if(!SetClipboardData(CF_TEXT, hglb)) {
2385  Rf_warning(_("unable to write to the clipboard"));
2386  GlobalFree(hglb);
2387  }
2388  CloseClipboard();
2389  }
2390  }
2391 #endif
2392 }
2393 
2394 static void clp_close(Rconnection con)
2395 {
2396  Rclpconn thisconn = static_cast<clpconn*>(con->connprivate);
2397 
2398  con->isopen = FALSE;
2399  if(con->canwrite)
2400  clp_writeout(con);
2401  if(thisconn-> buff) free(thisconn->buff);
2402 }
2403 
2404 static int clp_fgetc_internal(Rconnection con)
2405 {
2406  Rclpconn thisconn = static_cast<clpconn*>(con->connprivate);
2407 
2408  if (thisconn->pos >= thisconn->len) return R_EOF;
2409  return thisconn->buff[thisconn->pos++];
2410 }
2411 
2412 static double clp_seek(Rconnection con, double where, int origin, int rw)
2413 {
2414  Rclpconn thisconn = static_cast<clpconn*>(con->connprivate);
2415  int newpos, oldpos = thisconn->pos;
2416 
2417  if(ISNA(where)) return oldpos;
2418 
2419  switch(origin) {
2420  case 2: newpos = thisconn->pos + int(where); break;
2421  case 3: newpos = thisconn->last + int(where); break;
2422  default: newpos = int(where);
2423  }
2424  if(newpos < 0 || newpos >= thisconn->last)
2425  Rf_error(_("attempt to seek outside the range of the clipboard"));
2426  else thisconn->pos = newpos;
2427 
2428  return double(oldpos);
2429 }
2430 
2431 static void clp_truncate(Rconnection con)
2432 {
2433  Rclpconn thisconn = static_cast<clpconn*>(con->connprivate);
2434 
2435  if(!con->isopen || !con->canwrite)
2436  Rf_error(_("can only truncate connections open for writing"));
2437  thisconn->last = thisconn->pos;
2438 }
2439 
2440 static int clp_fflush(Rconnection con)
2441 {
2442  if(!con->isopen || !con->canwrite) return 1;
2443  clp_writeout(con);
2444  return 0;
2445 }
2446 
2447 static size_t clp_read(void *ptr, size_t size, size_t nitems,
2448  Rconnection con)
2449 {
2450  Rclpconn thisconn = static_cast<clpconn*>(con->connprivate);
2451  int available = thisconn->len - thisconn->pos, request = int(size*nitems), used;
2452  if (double(size) * double(nitems) > INT_MAX)
2453  Rf_error(_("too large a block specified"));
2454  used = (request < available) ? request : available;
2455  strncpy(static_cast<char *>(ptr), thisconn->buff + thisconn->pos, used);
2456  thisconn->pos += used;
2457  return size_t(used)/size;
2458 }
2459 
2460 static size_t clp_write(const void *ptr, size_t size, size_t nitems,
2461  Rconnection con)
2462 {
2463  Rclpconn thisconn = static_cast<clpconn*>(con->connprivate);
2464  int len = int(size * nitems), used = 0;
2465  char c, *p = static_cast<char *>(const_cast<void *>(ptr)), *q = thisconn->buff + thisconn->pos;
2466 
2467  if(!con->canwrite)
2468  Rf_error(_("clipboard connection is open for reading only"));
2469  if (double(size) * double(nitems) > INT_MAX)
2470  Rf_error(_("too large a block specified"));
2471 
2472  for(auto i = 0; i < len; i++) {
2473  if(thisconn->pos >= thisconn->len) break;
2474  c = *p++;
2475 #ifdef Win32
2476  /* clipboard requires CRLF termination */
2477  if(c == '\n') {
2478  *q++ = '\r';
2479  thisconn->pos++;
2480  if(thisconn->pos >= thisconn->len) break;
2481  }
2482 #endif
2483  *q++ = c;
2484  thisconn->pos++;
2485  used++;
2486  }
2487  if (used < len && !thisconn->warned) {
2488  Rf_warning(_("clipboard buffer is full and output lost"));
2489  thisconn->warned = TRUE;
2490  }
2491  if(thisconn->last < thisconn->pos) thisconn->last = thisconn->pos;
2492  return size_t(used)/size;
2493 }
2494 
2495 static Rconnection newclp(const char *url, const char *inmode)
2496 {
2497  Rconnection newconn;
2498  const char *description;
2499  int sizeKB = 32;
2500  char mode[4];
2501 
2502  mode[3] = '\0';
2503  strncpy(mode, inmode, 3);
2504 
2505  if(strlen(mode) == 2 && mode[1] == 't') mode[1] = '\0';
2506 
2507  if(strlen(mode) != 1 ||
2508  (mode[0] != 'r' && mode[0] != 'w'))
2509  Rf_error(_("'mode' for the clipboard must be 'r' or 'w'"));
2510 #ifdef Unix
2511  if(mode[0] != 'r')
2512  Rf_error(_("'mode' for the clipboard must be 'r' on Unix"));
2513 #endif
2514  newconn = static_cast<Rconnection>(malloc(sizeof(struct Rconn)));
2515  if(!newconn) Rf_error(_("allocation of clipboard connection failed"));
2516  if(streqln(url, "clipboard", 9)) description = "clipboard";
2517  else description = url;
2518  newconn->connclass = static_cast<char *>(malloc(strlen(description) + 1));
2519  if(!newconn->connclass) {
2520  free(newconn);
2521  Rf_error(_("allocation of clipboard connection failed"));
2522  /* for Solaris 12.5 */ newconn = nullptr;
2523  }
2524  strcpy(newconn->connclass, description);
2525  newconn->description = static_cast<char *>(malloc(strlen(description) + 1));
2526  if(!newconn->description) {
2527  free(newconn->connclass); free(newconn);
2528  Rf_error(_("allocation of clipboard connection failed"));
2529  /* for Solaris 12.5 */ newconn = nullptr;
2530  }
2531  init_con(newconn, description, CE_NATIVE, mode);
2532  newconn->open = &clp_open;
2533  newconn->close = &clp_close;
2534  newconn->vfprintf = &dummy_vfprintf;
2535  newconn->fgetc_internal = &clp_fgetc_internal;
2536  newconn->fgetc = &dummy_fgetc;
2537  newconn->seek = &clp_seek;
2538  newconn->truncate = &clp_truncate;
2539  newconn->fflush = &clp_fflush;
2540  newconn->read = &clp_read;
2541  newconn->write = &clp_write;
2542  newconn->canseek = TRUE;
2543  newconn->connprivate = malloc(sizeof(struct clpconn));
2544  if(!newconn->connprivate) {
2545  free(newconn->description); free(newconn->connclass); free(newconn);
2546  Rf_error(_("allocation of clipboard connection failed"));
2547  /* for Solaris 12.5 */ newconn = nullptr;
2548  }
2549  (static_cast<Rclpconn>(newconn->connprivate))->buff = nullptr;
2550  if (streqln(url, "clipboard-", 10)) {
2551  sizeKB = atoi(url+10);
2552  if(sizeKB < 32) sizeKB = 32;
2553  /* Rprintf("setting clipboard size to %dKB\n", sizeKB); */
2554  }
2555  (static_cast<Rclpconn>(newconn->connprivate))->sizeKB = sizeKB;
2556  return newconn;
2557 }

2561 static unsigned char ConsoleBuf[CONSOLE_BUFFER_SIZE + 1];
2562 static unsigned char* ConsoleBufp;
2563 static int ConsoleBufCnt;
2564 
2565 static int ConsoleGetchar(void)
2566 {
2567  if (--ConsoleBufCnt < 0) {
2568  ConsoleBuf[CONSOLE_BUFFER_SIZE] = '\0';
2569  if (R_ReadConsole("", ConsoleBuf, CONSOLE_BUFFER_SIZE, 0) == 0) {
2570  R_ClearerrConsole();
2571  return R_EOF;
2572  }
2573  ConsoleBufp = ConsoleBuf;
2574  ConsoleBufCnt = int(strlen(reinterpret_cast<char*>(ConsoleBuf))); // must be short
2575  ConsoleBufCnt--;
2576  }
2577  return *ConsoleBufp++;
2578 }

2695 /* ------------------- raw connections --------------------- */
2696 
2697 /* Possible future redesign: store nbytes as TRUELENGTH */
2698 
2699 struct rawconn {
2700  rho::RObject* data; /* all the data, stored as a raw vector */
2701  /* replace nbytes by TRUELENGTH in due course? */
2702  size_t pos; /* current pos */
2703  size_t nbytes; /* number of bytes (same pos for read and write) */
2704 };
2705 typedef rawconn* Rrawconn;
2706 
2707 
2708 /* copy a raw vector into a buffer */
2709 static void raw_init(Rconnection con, SEXP raw)
2710 {
2711  Rrawconn thisconn = static_cast<Rrawconn>(con->connprivate);
2712  thisconn->data = MAYBE_REFERENCED(raw) ? Rf_duplicate(raw) : raw;
2713  R_PreserveObject(thisconn->data);
2714  thisconn->nbytes = XLENGTH(thisconn->data);
2715  thisconn->pos = 0;
2716 }
2717 
2718 static Rboolean raw_open(Rconnection con)
2719 {
2720  return TRUE;
2721 }
2722 
2723 static void raw_close(Rconnection con)
2724 {
2725 }
2726 
2727 static void raw_destroy(Rconnection con)
2728 {
2729  Rrawconn thisconn = static_cast<Rrawconn>(con->connprivate);
2730 
2731  R_ReleaseObject(thisconn->data);
2732  free(thisconn);
2733 }
2734 
2735 static void raw_resize(Rrawconn thisconn, size_t needed)
2736 {
2737  size_t nalloc = 64;
2738  SEXP tmp;
2739 
2740  if (needed > 8192) nalloc = size_t(1.2*double(needed)); /* 20% over-allocation */
2741  else while(nalloc < needed) nalloc *= 2; /* use powers of 2 if small */
2742  PROTECT(tmp = Rf_allocVector(RAWSXP, nalloc));
2743  memcpy(RAW(tmp), RAW(thisconn->data), thisconn->nbytes);
2744  R_ReleaseObject(thisconn->data);
2745  thisconn->data = tmp;
2746  R_PreserveObject(thisconn->data);
2747  UNPROTECT(1);
2748 }
2749 
2750 static size_t raw_write(const void *ptr, size_t size, size_t nitems,
2751  Rconnection con)
2752 {
2753  Rrawconn thisconn = static_cast<Rrawconn>(con->connprivate);
2754  size_t freespace = XLENGTH(thisconn->data) - thisconn->pos, bytes = size*nitems;
2755 
2756  if (double(size) * double(nitems) + double(thisconn->pos) > R_LEN_T_MAX)
2757  Rf_error(_("attempting to add too many elements to raw vector"));
2758  /* resize may fail, when this will give an error */
2759  if(bytes >= freespace) raw_resize(thisconn, bytes + thisconn->pos);
2760  /* the source just might be this raw vector */
2761  memmove(RAW(thisconn->data) + thisconn->pos, ptr, bytes);
2762  thisconn->pos += bytes;
2763  if(thisconn->nbytes < thisconn->pos) thisconn->nbytes = thisconn->pos;
2764  return nitems;
2765 }
2766 
2767 static void raw_truncate(Rconnection con)
2768 {
2769  Rrawconn thisconn = static_cast<Rrawconn>(con->connprivate);
2770  thisconn->nbytes = thisconn->pos;
2771 }
2772 
2773 static size_t raw_read(void *ptr, size_t size, size_t nitems,
2774  Rconnection con)
2775 {
2776  Rrawconn thisconn = static_cast<Rrawconn>(con->connprivate);
2777  size_t available = thisconn->nbytes - thisconn->pos, request = size*nitems, used;
2778 
2779  if (double(size) * double(nitems) + double(thisconn->pos) > R_LEN_T_MAX)
2780  Rf_error(_("too large a block specified"));
2781  used = (request < available) ? request : available;
2782  memmove(ptr, RAW(thisconn->data) + thisconn->pos, used);
2783  thisconn->pos += used;
2784  return used/size;
2785 }
2786 
2787 static int raw_fgetc(Rconnection con)
2788 {
2789  Rrawconn thisconn = static_cast<Rrawconn>(con->connprivate);
2790  if(thisconn->pos >= thisconn->nbytes) return R_EOF;
2791  else return int(RAW(thisconn->data)[thisconn->pos++]);
2792 }
2793 
2794 static double raw_seek(Rconnection con, double where, int origin, int rw)
2795 {
2796  Rrawconn thisconn = static_cast<Rrawconn>(con->connprivate);
2797  double newpos;
2798  size_t oldpos = thisconn->pos;
2799 
2800  if(ISNA(where)) return double(oldpos);
2801 
2802  /* Do the calculations here as double to avoid integer overflow */
2803  switch(origin) {
2804  case 2: newpos = double(thisconn->pos) + where; break;
2805  case 3: newpos = double(thisconn->nbytes) + where; break;
2806  default: newpos = where;
2807  }
2808  if(newpos < 0 || newpos > thisconn->nbytes)
2809  Rf_error(_("attempt to seek outside the range of the raw connection"));
2810  else thisconn->pos = size_t(newpos);
2811 
2812  return double(oldpos);
2813 }
