2815 static Rconnection newraw(const char* description, SEXP raw, const char* mode)
2816 {
2817  Rconnection newconn;
2818 
2819  newconn = Rconnection(malloc(sizeof(struct Rconn)));
2820  if(!newconn) Rf_error(_("allocation of raw connection failed"));
2821  newconn->connclass = static_cast<char *>(malloc(strlen("rawConnection") + 1));
2822  if(!newconn->connclass) {
2823  free(newconn);
2824  Rf_error(_("allocation of raw connection failed"));
2825  /* for Solaris 12.5 */ newconn = nullptr;
2826  }
2827  strcpy(newconn->connclass, "rawConnection");
2828  newconn->description = static_cast<char *>(malloc(strlen(description) + 1));
2829  if(!newconn->description) {
2830  free(newconn->connclass); free(newconn);
2831  Rf_error(_("allocation of raw connection failed"));
2832  /* for Solaris 12.5 */ newconn = nullptr;
2833  }
2834  init_con(newconn, description, CE_NATIVE, mode);
2835  newconn->isopen = TRUE;
2836  newconn->text = FALSE;
2837  newconn->blocking = TRUE;
2838  newconn->canseek = TRUE;
2839  newconn->canwrite = Rboolean((mode[0] == 'w' || mode[0] == 'a'));
2840  newconn->canread = Rboolean(mode[0] == 'r');
2841  if(strlen(mode) >= 2 && mode[1] == '+') newconn->canread = newconn->canwrite = TRUE;
2842  newconn->open = &raw_open;
2843  newconn->close = &raw_close;
2844  newconn->destroy = &raw_destroy;
2845  if(newconn->canwrite) {
2846  newconn->write = &raw_write;
2847  newconn->vfprintf = &dummy_vfprintf;
2848  newconn->truncate = &raw_truncate;
2849  }
2850  if(newconn->canread) {
2851  newconn->read = &raw_read;
2852  newconn->fgetc = &raw_fgetc;
2853  }
2854  newconn->seek = &raw_seek;
2855  newconn->connprivate = malloc(sizeof(struct rawconn));
2856  if(!newconn->connprivate) {
2857  free(newconn->description); free(newconn->connclass); free(newconn);
2858  Rf_error(_("allocation of raw connection failed"));
2859  /* for Solaris 12.5 */ newconn = nullptr;
2860  }
2861  raw_init(newconn, raw);
2862  if(mode[0] == 'a') raw_seek(newconn, 0, 3, 0);
2863  return newconn;
2864 }

2866 HIDDEN SEXP do_rawconnection(/*const*/ Expression* call, const BuiltInFunction* op, RObject* sfile, RObject* sraw, RObject* sopen)
2867 {
2868  SEXP ans, connclass;
2869  const char *desc, *open;
2870  int ncon;
2871  Rconnection con = nullptr;
2872 
2873  if (!Rf_isString(sfile) || Rf_length(sfile) != 1)
2874  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "description");
2875  desc = Rf_translateChar(STRING_ELT(sfile, 0));
2876  if (!Rf_isString(sopen) || Rf_length(sopen) != 1)
2877  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "open");
2878  open = R_CHAR(STRING_ELT(sopen, 0)); /* ASCII */
2879  if (strchr(open, 't'))
2880  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "open");
2881  ncon = NextConnection();
2882  if (TYPEOF(sraw) != RAWSXP)
2883  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "raw");
2884  con = Connections[ncon] = newraw(desc, sraw, open);
2885 
2886  /* already opened */
2887 
2888  PROTECT(ans = Rf_ScalarInteger(ncon));
2889  PROTECT(connclass = Rf_allocVector(STRSXP, 2));
2890  SET_STRING_ELT(connclass, 0, Rf_mkChar("rawConnection"));
2891  SET_STRING_ELT(connclass, 1, Rf_mkChar("connection"));
2892  Rf_classgets(ans, connclass);
2893  con->ex_ptr = R_MakeExternalPtr(con->id, Rf_install("connection"), nullptr);
2894  Rf_setAttrib(ans, Symbols::ConnIdSymbol, static_cast<SEXP>(con->ex_ptr));
2895  R_RegisterCFinalizerEx(static_cast<SEXP>(con->ex_ptr), conFinalizer, FALSE);
2896  UNPROTECT(2);
2897  return ans;
2898 }

2900 HIDDEN SEXP do_rawconvalue(/*const*/ Expression* call, const BuiltInFunction* op, RObject* con_)
2901 {
2902  Rconnection con = nullptr;
2903  Rrawconn thisconn;
2904  SEXP ans;
2905 
2906  if(!Rf_inherits(con_, "rawConnection"))
2907  Rf_error(_("'con' is not a rawConnection"));
2908  con = getConnection(Rf_asInteger(con_));
2909  if(!con->canwrite)
2910  Rf_error(_("'con' is not an output rawConnection"));
2911  thisconn = static_cast<Rrawconn>(con->connprivate);
2912  ans = Rf_allocVector(RAWSXP, thisconn->nbytes); /* later, use TRUELENGTH? */
2913  memcpy(RAW(ans), RAW(thisconn->data), thisconn->nbytes);
2914  return ans;
2915 }

2917 /* ------------------- text connections --------------------- */
2918 
2919 struct textconn {
2920  char *data; /* all the data */
2921  size_t cur, nchars; /* current pos and number of chars */
2922  char save; /* pushback */
2923 };
2924 typedef textconn* Rtextconn;
2925 
2926 struct outtextconn {
2927  size_t len; /* number of lines */
2928  SEXP namesymbol;
2929  SEXP data;
2930  char *lastline;
2931  size_t lastlinelength; /* buffer size */
2932 };
2933 typedef outtextconn* Routtextconn;
2934 
2935 /* read a R character vector into a buffer */
2936 static void text_init(Rconnection con, SEXP text, int type)
2937 {
2938  R_xlen_t nlines = Rf_xlength(text); // not very plausible that this is long
2939  size_t nchars = 0; /* -Wall */
2940  double dnc = 0.0;
2941  Rtextconn thisconn = static_cast<Rtextconn>(con->connprivate);
2942  const void *vmax = vmaxget();
2943 
2944  for(auto i = 0; i < nlines; i++)
2945  dnc +=
2946  double(strlen(type == 1 ? Rf_translateChar(STRING_ELT(text, i))
2947  : ((type == 3) ?Rf_translateCharUTF8(STRING_ELT(text, i))
2948  : R_CHAR(STRING_ELT(text, i))) ) + 1);
2949  if (dnc >= double(std::numeric_limits<size_t>::max()))
2950  Rf_error(_("too many characters for text connection"));
2951  else nchars = size_t(dnc);
2952  thisconn->data = static_cast<char *>(malloc(nchars+1));
2953  if(!thisconn->data) {
2954  free(thisconn); free(con->description); free(con->connclass); free(con);
2955  Rf_error(_("cannot allocate memory for text connection"));
2956  }
2957  char *t = thisconn->data;
2958  for(auto i = 0; i < nlines; i++) {
2959  const char *s = (type == 1) ? Rf_translateChar(STRING_ELT(text, i))
2960  : ((type == 3) ? Rf_translateCharUTF8(STRING_ELT(text, i))
2961  : R_CHAR(STRING_ELT(text, i)));
2962  while(*s) *t++ = *s++;
2963  *t++ = '\n';
2964  }
2965  *t = '\0';
2966  thisconn->nchars = nchars;
2967  thisconn->cur = thisconn->save = 0;
2968  vmaxset(vmax);
2969 }
2970

2974  return TRUE;

2984

2986  /* thisconn->cur = thisconn->nchars = 0; */
2987  free(thisconn);
2988 }

2990 static int text_fgetc(Rconnection con)
2991 {
2992  Rtextconn thisconn = static_cast<Rtextconn>(con->connprivate);
2993  if(thisconn->save) {
2994  int c;
2995  c = thisconn->save;
2996  thisconn->save = 0;
2997  return c;
2998  }
2999  if(thisconn->cur >= thisconn->nchars) return R_EOF;
3000  else return int((thisconn->data[thisconn->cur++]));
3001 }

3009 static Rconnection newtext(const char *description, SEXP text, int type)
3010 {
3011  Rconnection newconn;

3013  if(!newconn) Rf_error(_("allocation of text connection failed"));
3014  newconn->connclass = static_cast<char *>(malloc(strlen("textConnection") + 1));
3015  if(!newconn->connclass) {
3016  free(newconn);
3017  Rf_error(_("allocation of text connection failed"));
3018  /* for Solaris 12.5 */ newconn = nullptr;
3019  }
3020  strcpy(newconn->connclass, "textConnection");
3021  newconn->description = static_cast<char *>(malloc(strlen(description) + 1));
3022  if(!newconn->description) {
3023  free(newconn->connclass); free(newconn);
3024  Rf_error(_("allocation of text connection failed"));
3025  /* for Solaris 12.5 */ newconn = nullptr;
3026  }

3033  newconn->fgetc = &text_fgetc;
3034  newconn->seek = &text_seek;

3036  if(!newconn->connprivate) {
3037  free(newconn->description); free(newconn->connclass); free(newconn);
3038  Rf_error(_("allocation of text connection failed"));

3040  }

3046 static SEXP mkCharLocal(const char *s)

3054 static void outtext_close(Rconnection con)
3055 {
3056  Routtextconn thisconn = static_cast<Routtextconn>(con->connprivate);
3057  int idx = ConnIndex(con);
3058  SEXP tmp, env = VECTOR_ELT(OutTextData, idx);
3059 
3060  if(thisconn->namesymbol &&
3061  Rf_findVarInFrame3(env, thisconn->namesymbol, FALSE) != R_UnboundValue)
3062  R_unLockBinding(thisconn->namesymbol, env);
3063  if(strlen(thisconn->lastline) > 0) {
3064  PROTECT(tmp = Rf_xlengthgets(thisconn->data, ++thisconn->len));
3065  SET_STRING_ELT(tmp, thisconn->len - 1, mkCharLocal(thisconn->lastline));
3066  if(thisconn->namesymbol) Rf_defineVar(thisconn->namesymbol, tmp, env);
3067  ENSURE_NAMEDMAX(tmp);
3068  thisconn->data = tmp;
3069  UNPROTECT(1);
3070  }
3071 }

3073 static void outtext_destroy(Rconnection con)
3074 {
3075  Routtextconn thisconn = static_cast<Routtextconn>(con->connprivate);
3076  int idx = ConnIndex(con);
3077  /* OutTextData is preserved, and that implies that the environment
3078  we are writing it and hence the character vector is protected.
3079  However, this could be quite expensive.
3080  */
3081  SET_VECTOR_ELT(OutTextData, idx, nullptr);
3082  if(!thisconn->namesymbol) R_ReleaseObject(thisconn->data);
3083  free(thisconn->lastline); free(thisconn);
3084 }

3086 constexpr size_t LAST_LINE_LEN = 256;
3087 
3088 static int text_vfprintf(Rconnection con, const char *format, va_list ap)
3089 {
3090  Routtextconn thisconn = static_cast<Routtextconn>(con->connprivate);
3091  char buf[BUFSIZE], *b = buf, *p, *q;
3092  const void *vmax = nullptr;
3093  int res = 0, buffree;
3094  size_t already = strlen(thisconn->lastline); // we do not allow longer lines
3095  SEXP tmp;
3096 
3097  va_list aq;
3098  va_copy(aq, ap);
3099  if(already >= BUFSIZE) {
3100  /* This will fail so just call vsnprintf to get the length of
3101  the new piece */
3102  res = vsnprintf(buf, 0, format, aq);
3103  if(res > 0) res += already;
3104  buffree = 0;
3105  } else {
3106  strcpy(b, thisconn->lastline);
3107  p = b + already;
3108  buffree = BUFSIZE - already; // checked < BUFSIZE above
3109  res = vsnprintf(p, buffree, format, aq);
3110  }
3111  va_end(aq);
3112  if(res >= buffree) { /* res is the desired output length */
3113  vmax = vmaxget();
3114  b = R_alloc(res + already + 1, sizeof(char));
3115  strcpy(b, thisconn->lastline);
3116  p = b + already;
3117  vsprintf(p, format, ap);
3118  } else if(res < 0) { /* just a failure indication */
3119  const size_t NBUFSIZE = (already + 100 * BUFSIZE);
3120  vmax = vmaxget();
3121  b = R_alloc(NBUFSIZE, sizeof(char));
3122  strncpy(b, thisconn->lastline, NBUFSIZE);
3123  *(b + NBUFSIZE - 1) = '\0';
3124  p = b + already;
3125  res = vsnprintf(p, NBUFSIZE - already, format, ap);
3126  if (res < 0) {
3127  *(b + NBUFSIZE - 1) = '\0';
3128  Rf_warning(_("printing of extremely long output is truncated"));
3129  }
3130  }
3131 
3132  /* copy buf line-by-line to object */
3133  for(auto p = b; ; p = q+1) {
3134  q = Rf_strchr(p, '\n');
3135  if(q) {
3136  int idx = ConnIndex(con);
3137  SEXP env = VECTOR_ELT(OutTextData, idx);
3138  *q = '\0';
3139  PROTECT(tmp = Rf_xlengthgets(thisconn->data, ++thisconn->len));
3140  SET_STRING_ELT(tmp, thisconn->len - 1, mkCharLocal(p));
3141  if(thisconn->namesymbol) {
3142  if(Rf_findVarInFrame3(env, thisconn->namesymbol, FALSE)
3143  != R_UnboundValue) R_unLockBinding(thisconn->namesymbol, env);
3144  Rf_defineVar(thisconn->namesymbol, tmp, env);
3145  R_LockBinding(thisconn->namesymbol, env);
3146  } else {
3147  R_ReleaseObject(thisconn->data);
3148  R_PreserveObject(tmp);
3149  }
3150  thisconn->data = tmp;
3151  ENSURE_NAMEDMAX(tmp);
3152  UNPROTECT(1);
3153  } else {
3154  /* retain the last line */
3155  if(strlen(p) >= thisconn->lastlinelength) {
3156  size_t newlen = strlen(p) + 1;
3157  if (newlen > INT_MAX) Rf_error("last line is too long");
3158  void * tmp = realloc(thisconn->lastline, newlen);
3159  if (tmp) {
3160  thisconn->lastline = static_cast<char *>(tmp);
3161  thisconn->lastlinelength = int(newlen);
3162  } else {
3163  Rf_warning("allocation problem for last line");
3164  thisconn->lastline = nullptr;
3165  thisconn->lastlinelength = 0;
3166  }
3167  }
3168  strcpy(thisconn->lastline, p);
3169  con->incomplete = Rboolean(strlen(thisconn->lastline) > 0);
3170  break;
3171  }
3172  }
3173  if(vmax) vmaxset(vmax);
3174  return res;
3175 }
3176 
3177 static void outtext_init(Rconnection con, SEXP stext, const char *mode, int idx)
3178 {
3179  Routtextconn thisconn = static_cast<Routtextconn>(con->connprivate);
3180  SEXP val;
3181 
3182  if(stext == nullptr) {
3183  thisconn->namesymbol = nullptr;
3184  /* create variable pointed to by con->description */
3185  val = Rf_allocVector(STRSXP, 0);
3186  R_PreserveObject(val);
3187  } else {
3188  thisconn->namesymbol = rho::Symbol::obtain(con->description);
3189  if(streql(mode, "w")) {
3190  /* create variable pointed to by con->description */
3191  PROTECT(val = Rf_allocVector(STRSXP, 0));
3192  Rf_defineVar(thisconn->namesymbol, val, VECTOR_ELT(OutTextData, idx));
3193  /* Not clear if this is needed, but be conservative */
3194  ENSURE_NAMEDMAX(val);
3195  UNPROTECT(1);
3196  } else {
3197  /* take over existing variable */
3198  val = Rf_findVar1(thisconn->namesymbol, VECTOR_ELT(OutTextData, idx),
3199  STRSXP, FALSE);
3200  if(val == R_UnboundValue) {
3201  Rf_warning(_("text connection: appending to a non-existent char vector"));
3202  PROTECT(val = Rf_allocVector(STRSXP, 0));
3203  Rf_defineVar(thisconn->namesymbol, val, VECTOR_ELT(OutTextData, idx));
3204  ENSURE_NAMEDMAX(val);
3205  UNPROTECT(1);
3206  }
3207  R_LockBinding(thisconn->namesymbol, VECTOR_ELT(OutTextData, idx));
3208  }
3209  }
3210  thisconn->len = LENGTH(val);
3211  thisconn->data = val;
3212  thisconn->lastline[0] = '\0';
3213  thisconn->lastlinelength = LAST_LINE_LEN;
3214 }

3217 static Rconnection newouttext(const char *description, SEXP stext,
3218  const char *mode, int idx)

3220  Rconnection newconn;
3221  void *tmp;
3222 
3223  newconn = static_cast<Rconnection>(malloc(sizeof(struct Rconn)));
3224  if(!newconn) Rf_error(_("allocation of text connection failed"));
3225  newconn->connclass = static_cast<char *>(malloc(strlen("textConnection") + 1));
3226  if(!newconn->connclass) {
3227  free(newconn);
3228  Rf_error(_("allocation of text connection failed"));
3229  /* for Solaris 12.5 */ newconn = nullptr;
3230  }
3231  strcpy(newconn->connclass, "textConnection");
3232  newconn->description = static_cast<char *>(malloc(strlen(description) + 1));
3233  if(!newconn->description) {
3234  free(newconn->connclass); free(newconn);
3235  Rf_error(_("allocation of text connection failed"));
3236  /* for Solaris 12.5 */ newconn = nullptr;

3239  newconn->isopen = TRUE;

3250  /* for Solaris 12.5 */ newconn = nullptr;

3256  free(newconn->description); free(newconn->connclass); free(newconn);
3257  Rf_error(_("allocation of text connection failed"));
3258  /* for Solaris 12.5 */ newconn = nullptr;
3259  }
3260  outtext_init(newconn, stext, mode, idx);
3261  return newconn;
3262 }

3264 HIDDEN SEXP do_textconnection(/*const*/ Expression* call, const BuiltInFunction* op, RObject* nm_, RObject* object_, RObject* open_, RObject* env_, RObject* type_)
3265 {
3266  SEXP sfile, stext, sopen, ans, connclass, venv;
3267  const char *desc, *open;
3268  int ncon, type;
3269  Rconnection con = nullptr;
3270 
3271  sfile = nm_;
3272  if(!Rf_isString(sfile) || Rf_length(sfile) != 1)
3273  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "description");
3274  desc = Rf_translateChar(STRING_ELT(sfile, 0));
3275  stext = object_;
3276  sopen = open_;
3277  if(!Rf_isString(sopen) || Rf_length(sopen) != 1)
3278  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "open");
3279  open = R_CHAR(STRING_ELT(sopen, 0)); /* ASCII */
3280  venv = downcast_to_env(env_);
3281  if (!venv)
3282  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "environment");
3283  type = Rf_asInteger(type_);
3284  if (type == R_NaInt)
3285  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "encoding");
3286  ncon = NextConnection();
3287  if(!strlen(open) || streqln(open, "r", 1)) {
3288  if(!Rf_isString(stext))
3289  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "text");
3290  con = Connections[ncon] = newtext(desc, stext, type);
3291  } else if (streqln(open, "w", 1) || streqln(open, "a", 1)) {
3292  if (OutTextData == nullptr) {
3293  OutTextData = Rf_allocVector(VECSXP, NCONNECTIONS);
3294  R_PreserveObject(OutTextData);
3295  }
3296  SET_VECTOR_ELT(OutTextData, ncon, venv);
3297  if(stext == nullptr)
3298  con = Connections[ncon] = newouttext("NULL", stext, open, ncon);
3299  else if(Rf_isString(stext) && Rf_length(stext) == 1)
3300  con = Connections[ncon] =
3301  newouttext(Rf_translateChar(STRING_ELT(stext, 0)), stext,
3302  open, ncon);
3303  else
3304  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "text");
3305  }
3306  else
3307  Rf_error(_("unsupported mode"));
3308  /* already opened */
3309 
3310  PROTECT(ans = Rf_ScalarInteger(ncon));
3311  PROTECT(connclass = Rf_allocVector(STRSXP, 2));
3312  SET_STRING_ELT(connclass, 0, Rf_mkChar("textConnection"));
3313  SET_STRING_ELT(connclass, 1, Rf_mkChar("connection"));
3314  Rf_classgets(ans, connclass);
3315  con->ex_ptr = R_MakeExternalPtr(con->id, Rf_install("connection"), nullptr);
3316  Rf_setAttrib(ans, Symbols::ConnIdSymbol, static_cast<SEXP>(con->ex_ptr));
3317  R_RegisterCFinalizerEx(static_cast<SEXP>(con->ex_ptr), conFinalizer, FALSE);
3318  UNPROTECT(2);
3319  return ans;
3320 }

3341 /* socketConnection(host, port, server, blocking, open, encoding) */
3342 HIDDEN SEXP do_sockconn(/*const*/ Expression* call, const BuiltInFunction* op, RObject* host_, RObject* port_, RObject* server_, RObject* blocking_, RObject* open_, RObject* encoding_, RObject* timeout_)
3343 {
3344  SEXP scmd, sopen, ans, connclass, enc;
3345  const char *host, *open;
3346  int ncon, port, server, blocking, timeout;
3347  Rconnection con = nullptr;
3348 
3349  scmd = host_;
3350  if(!Rf_isString(scmd) || Rf_length(scmd) != 1)
3351  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "host");
3352  host = Rf_translateChar(STRING_ELT(scmd, 0));
3353  port = Rf_asInteger(port_);
3354  if(port == R_NaInt || port < 0)
3355  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "port");
3356  server = Rf_asLogical(server_);
3357  if(server == R_NaLog)
3358  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "server");
3359  blocking = Rf_asLogical(blocking_);
3360  if(blocking == R_NaLog)
3361  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "blocking");
3362  sopen = open_;
3363  if(!Rf_isString(sopen) || Rf_length(sopen) != 1)
3364  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "open");
3365  open = R_CHAR(STRING_ELT(sopen, 0)); /* ASCII */
3366  enc = encoding_;
3367  if(!Rf_isString(enc) || Rf_length(enc) != 1 ||
3368  strlen(R_CHAR(STRING_ELT(enc, 0))) > 100) /* ASCII */
3369  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "encoding");
3370  timeout = Rf_asInteger(timeout_);
3371 
3372  ncon = NextConnection();
3373  con = R_newsock(host, port, server, open, timeout);
3374  Connections[ncon] = con;
3375  con->blocking = Rboolean(blocking);
3376  strncpy(con->encname, R_CHAR(STRING_ELT(enc, 0)), 100); /* ASCII */
3377  con->encname[100 - 1] = '\0';
3378  con->ex_ptr = PROTECT(R_MakeExternalPtr(con->id, Rf_install("connection"), nullptr));
3379 
3380  /* open it if desired */
3381  if(strlen(open)) {
3382  Rboolean success = con->open(con);
3383  if(!success) {
3384  con_destroy(ncon);
3385  Rf_error(_("cannot open the connection"));
3386  }
3387  }
3388 
3389  PROTECT(ans = Rf_ScalarInteger(ncon));
3390  PROTECT(connclass = Rf_allocVector(STRSXP, 2));
3391  SET_STRING_ELT(connclass, 0, Rf_mkChar("sockconn"));
3392  SET_STRING_ELT(connclass, 1, Rf_mkChar("connection"));
3393  Rf_classgets(ans, connclass);
3394  Rf_setAttrib(ans, Symbols::ConnIdSymbol, static_cast<SEXP>(con->ex_ptr));
3395  R_RegisterCFinalizerEx(static_cast<SEXP>(con->ex_ptr), conFinalizer, FALSE);
3396  UNPROTECT(3);
3397  return ans;
3398 }

3443  UNPROTECT(3);
3444 
3445  return ans;
3446 }
3447 
3448 /* -------------- open, close, seek, truncate, flush ------------------ */
3449 
3450 HIDDEN SEXP do_open(/*const*/ Expression* call, const BuiltInFunction* op, RObject* con_, RObject* open_, RObject* blocking_)
3451 {
3452  int i, block;
3453  Rconnection con=nullptr;
3454  SEXP sopen;
3455  const char *open;
3456  Rboolean success;
3457 
3458  if(!Rf_inherits(con_, "connection"))
3459  Rf_error(_("'con' is not a connection"));
3460  i = Rf_asInteger(con_);
3461  con = getConnection(i);
3462  if(i < 3) Rf_error(_("cannot open standard connections"));
3463  if(con->isopen) {
3464  Rf_warning(_("connection is already open"));
3465  return nullptr;
3466  }
3467  sopen = open_;
3468  if(!Rf_isString(sopen) || Rf_length(sopen) != 1)
3469  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "open");
3470  block = Rf_asLogical(blocking_);
3471  if(block == R_NaLog)
3472  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "blocking");
3473  open = R_CHAR(STRING_ELT(sopen, 0)); /* ASCII */
3474  if(strlen(open) > 0) strcpy(con->mode, open);
3475  con->blocking = Rboolean(block);
3476  success = con->open(con);
3477  if(!success) {
3478  /* con_destroy(i); user might have a reference */
3479  Rf_error(_("cannot open the connection"));
3480  }
3481  return nullptr;
3482 }
3483 
3484 HIDDEN SEXP do_isopen(/*const*/ Expression* call, const BuiltInFunction* op, RObject* con_, RObject* rw_)
3485 {
3486  Rconnection con;
3487  int rw, res;
3488 
3489  con = getConnection(Rf_asInteger(con_));
3490  rw = Rf_asInteger(rw_);
3491  res = con->isopen != FALSE;
3492  switch(rw) {
3493  case 0: break;
3494  case 1: res = res & con->canread; break;
3495  case 2: res = res & con->canwrite; break;
3496  default: Rf_error(_("unknown 'rw' value"));
3497  }
3498  return Rf_ScalarLogical(res);
3499 }

3521 static void checkClose(Rconnection con)
3522 {
3523  if (con->isopen) {
3524  errno = 0;
3525  con->close(con);
3526  if (con->status != R_NaInt && con->status < 0) {
3527  int serrno = errno;
3528  if (serrno)
3529  Rf_warning(_("Problem closing connection: %s"), strerror(serrno));
3530  else
3531  Rf_warning(_("Problem closing connection"));
3532  }
3533  }
3534 }
3535 
3536 static int con_close1(Rconnection con)
3537 {
3538  int status;
3539  checkClose(con);
3540  status = con->status;
3541  if(con->isGzcon) {
3542  Rgzconn priv = static_cast<Rgzconn>(con->connprivate);
3543  con_close1(priv->con);
3544  R_ReleaseObject(static_cast<SEXP>(priv->con->ex_ptr));
3545  }
3546  /* close inconv and outconv if open */
3547  if(con->inconv) Riconv_close(con->inconv);
3548  if(con->outconv) Riconv_close(con->outconv);
3549  con->destroy(con);
3550  free(con->connclass);
3551  con->connclass = nullptr;
3552  free(con->description);
3553  con->description = nullptr;
3554  /* clear the pushBack */
3555  if(con->nPushBack > 0) {
3556  for(size_t j = 0; j < con->nPushBack; j++)
3557  free(con->PushBack[j]);
3558  free(con->PushBack);
3559  }
3560  con->nPushBack = 0;
3561  if (con->buff) {
3562  free(con->buff);
3563  con->buff = nullptr;
3564  }
3565  con->buff_len = con->buff_pos = con->buff_stored_len = 0;
3566  con->open = &null_open;
3567  con->close = &null_close;
3568  con->destroy = &null_destroy;
3569  con->vfprintf = &null_vfprintf;
3570  con->fgetc = con->fgetc_internal = &null_fgetc;
3571  con->seek = &null_seek;
3572  con->truncate = &null_truncate;
3573  con->fflush = &null_fflush;
3574  con->read = &null_read;
3575  con->write = &null_write;
3576  return status;
3577 }
3578

3580 static void con_destroy(int i)
3581 {
3582  Rconnection con=nullptr;
3583 
3584  con = getConnection(i);
3585  con_close1(con);
3586  free(Connections[i]);
3587  Connections[i] = nullptr;
3588 }
3589 
3590 
3591 HIDDEN SEXP do_close(/*const*/ Expression* call, const BuiltInFunction* op, RObject* con_, RObject* dots_)
3592 {
3593  int i, j;
3594 
3595  if(!Rf_inherits(con_, "connection"))
3596  Rf_error(_("'con' is not a connection"));
3597  i = Rf_asInteger(con_);
3598  if(i < 3) Rf_error(_("cannot close standard connections"));
3599  for(j = 0; j < R_SinkNumber; j++)
3600  if(i == SinkCons[j])
3601  Rf_error(_("cannot close output sink connection"));
3602  if(i == R_ErrorCon)
3603  Rf_error(_("cannot close messages sink connection"));
3604  Rconnection con = getConnection(i);
3605  int status = con_close1(con);
3606  free(Connections[i]);
3607  Connections[i] = nullptr;
3608  return (status != R_NaInt) ? Rf_ScalarInteger(status) : nullptr;
3609 }

3664 /* ------------------- read, write text --------------------- */
3665 
3666 int Rconn_fgetc(Rconnection con)
3667 {
3668  char *curLine;
3669  int c;
3670 
3671  if (con->save2 != -1000) {
3672  c = con->save2;
3673  con->save2 = -1000;
3674  return c;
3675  }
3676  if(con->nPushBack <= 0) {
3677  /* map CR or CRLF to LF */
3678  if (con->save != -1000) {
3679  c = con->save;
3680  con->save = -1000;
3681  return c;
3682  }
3683  c = con->fgetc(con);
3684  if (c == '\r') {
3685  c = con->fgetc(con);
3686  if (c != '\n') {
3687  con->save = (c != '\r') ? c : '\n';
3688  return('\n');
3689  }
3690  }
3691  return c;
3692  }
3693  curLine = con->PushBack[con->nPushBack-1];
3694  c = static_cast<unsigned char>(curLine[con->posPushBack++]);
3695  if(con->posPushBack >= strlen(curLine)) {
3696  /* last character on a line, so pop the line */
3697  free(curLine);
3698  con->nPushBack--;
3699  con->posPushBack = 0;
3700  if(con->nPushBack == 0) free(con->PushBack);
3701  }
3702  return c;
3703 }
3704 
3705 #ifdef UNUSED
3706 int Rconn_ungetc(int c, Rconnection con)
3707 {
3708  con->save2 = c;
3709  return c;
3710 }
3711 #endif
3712 
3713 /* read one line (without trailing newline) from con and store it in buf */
3714 /* return number of characters read, -1 on EOF */
3715 HIDDEN
3716 size_t Rconn_getline(Rconnection con, char *buf, size_t bufsize)
3717 {
3718  int c;
3719  ssize_t nbuf = -1;
3720 
3721  while((c = Rconn_fgetc(con)) != R_EOF) {
3722  if(size_t(nbuf+1) >= bufsize)
3723  Rf_error(_("line longer than buffer size %lu"), (unsigned long) bufsize);
3724  if(c != '\n'){
3725  buf[++nbuf] = char(c);
3726  } else {
3727  buf[++nbuf] = '\0';
3728  break;
3729  }
3730  }
3731  /* Make sure it is null-terminated and count is correct, even if
3732  * file did not end with newline.
3733  */
3734  if(nbuf >= 0 && buf[nbuf]) {
3735  if(size_t(nbuf+1) >= bufsize)
3736  Rf_error(_("line longer than buffer size %lu"), (unsigned long) bufsize);
3737  buf[++nbuf] = '\0';
3738  }
3739  return size_t(nbuf);
3740 }
3741 
3742 int Rconn_printf(Rconnection con, const char *format, ...)
3743 {
3744  int res;
3745  errno = 0;
3746  va_list ap;
3747  va_start(ap, format);
3748  /* Parentheses added for FC4 with gcc4 and -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2 */
3749  res = (con->vfprintf)(con, format, ap);
3750  va_end(ap);
3751  /* PR#17243: write.table and friends silently failed if the disk was full (or there was another error) */
3752  if (res < 0) {
3753  if (errno)
3754  Rf_error(_("Error writing to connection: %s"), strerror(errno));
3755  else
3756  Rf_error(_("Error writing to connection"));
3757  }
3758  return res;
3759 }
3760 
3761 /* readLines(con = stdin(), n = 1, ok = TRUE, warn = TRUE) */
3762 constexpr size_t BUF_SIZE = 1000;
3763 HIDDEN SEXP do_readLines(/*const*/ Expression* call, const BuiltInFunction* op, RObject* con_, RObject* n_, RObject* ok_, RObject* warn_, RObject* encoding_, RObject* skipNul_)
3764 {
3765  SEXP ans = nullptr, ans2;
3766  int ok, warn, skipNul, c;
3767  size_t nbuf, buf_size = BUF_SIZE;
3768  cetype_t oenc = CE_NATIVE;
3769  Rconnection con = nullptr;
3770  Rboolean wasopen;
3771  char *buf;
3772  const char *encoding;
3773  R_xlen_t i, n, nn, nnn, nread;
3774 
3775  if(!Rf_inherits(con_, "connection"))
3776  Rf_error(_("'con' is not a connection"));
3777  con = getConnection(Rf_asInteger(con_));
3778  n = asVecSize(n_);
3779  if(n == -999)
3780  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "n");
3781  ok = Rf_asLogical(ok_);
3782  if(ok == R_NaLog)
3783  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "ok");
3784  warn = Rf_asLogical(warn_);
3785  if(warn == R_NaLog)
3786  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "warn");
3787  if(!Rf_isString(encoding_) || LENGTH(encoding_) != 1)
3788  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' value"), "encoding");
3789  encoding = R_CHAR(STRING_ELT(encoding_, 0)); /* ASCII */
3790  skipNul = Rf_asLogical(skipNul_);
3791  if(skipNul == R_NaLog)
3792  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "skipNul");
3793 
3794  wasopen = con->isopen;
3795  try {
3796  if(!wasopen) {
3797  char mode[5];
3798  con->UTF8out = TRUE; /* a request */
3799  strcpy(mode, con->mode);
3800  strcpy(con->mode, "rt");
3801  if(!con->open(con)) Rf_error(_("cannot open the connection"));
3802  strcpy(con->mode, mode);
3803  if(!con->canread) { /* recheck */
3804  con->close(con);
3805  Rf_error(_("cannot read from this connection"));
3806  }
3807  } else {
3808  if(!con->canread) Rf_error(_("cannot read from this connection"));
3809  /* for a non-blocking connection, more input may
3810  have become available, so re-position */
3811  if(con->canseek && !con->blocking)
3812  Rconn_seek(con, con->seek(con, -1, 1, 1), 1, 1);
3813  }
3814  con->incomplete = FALSE;
3815  if(con->UTF8out || streql(encoding, "UTF-8")) oenc = CE_UTF8;
3816  else if(streql(encoding, "latin1")) oenc = CE_LATIN1;
3817 
3818  buf = static_cast<char *>(malloc(buf_size));
3819  if(!buf)
3820  Rf_error(_("cannot allocate buffer in readLines"));
3821  nn = (n < 0) ? 1000 : n; /* initially allocate space for 1000 lines */
3822  nnn = (n < 0) ? R_XLEN_T_MAX : n;
3823  PROTECT(ans = Rf_allocVector(STRSXP, nn));
3824  for(nread = 0; nread < nnn; nread++) {
3825  if(nread >= nn) {
3826  double dnn = 2.* nn;
3827  if (dnn > double(R_XLEN_T_MAX)) Rf_error("too many items");
3828  ans2 = Rf_allocVector(STRSXP, 2*nn);
3829  for(i = 0; i < nn; i++)
3830  SET_STRING_ELT(ans2, i, STRING_ELT(ans, i));
3831  nn *= 2;
3832  UNPROTECT(1); /* old ans */
3833  PROTECT(ans = ans2);
3834  }
3835  nbuf = 0;
3836  while((c = Rconn_fgetc(con)) != R_EOF) {
3837  if(nbuf == buf_size-1) { /* need space for the terminator */
3838  buf_size *= 2;
3839  char* tmp = static_cast<char *>(realloc(buf, buf_size));
3840  if(!buf) {
3841  free(buf);
3842  Rf_error(_("cannot allocate buffer in readLines"));
3843  } else buf = tmp;
3844  }
3845  if(skipNul && c == '\0') continue;
3846  if(c != '\n') buf[nbuf++] = char(c); else break;
3847  }
3848  buf[nbuf] = '\0';
3849  /* Remove UTF-8 BOM */
3850  const char *qbuf = buf;
3851  // avoid valgrind warning if < 3 bytes
3852  if (nread == 0 && utf8locale && strlen(buf) >= 3 &&
3853  !memcmp(buf, "\xef\xbb\xbf", 3)) qbuf = buf + 3;
3854  SET_STRING_ELT(ans, nread, Rf_mkCharCE(qbuf, oenc));
3855  if (warn && strlen(buf) < nbuf)
3856  Rf_warning(_("line %d appears to contain an embedded nul"),
3857  nread + 1);
3858  if(c == R_EOF) goto no_more_lines;
3859  }
3860  if(!wasopen) con->close(con);
3861  UNPROTECT(1);
3862  free(buf);
3863  ProvenanceTracker::flagXenogenesis();
3864  return ans;
3865  no_more_lines:
3866  if(!wasopen) con->close(con);
3867  if(nbuf > 0) { /* incomplete last line */
3868  if(con->text && !con->blocking &&
3869  !streql(con->connclass, "gzfile")) {
3870  /* push back the rest */
3871  con_pushback(con, FALSE, buf);
3872  con->incomplete = TRUE;
3873  } else {
3874  nread++;
3875  if(warn)
3876  Rf_warning(_("incomplete final line found on '%s'"), con->description);
3877  }
3878  }
3879  } catch (...) {
3880  if (!wasopen && con->isopen)
3881  con->close(con);
3882  throw;
3883  }
3884  free(buf);
3885  if(nread < nnn && !ok)
3886  Rf_error(_("too few lines read in readLines"));
3887  PROTECT(ans2 = Rf_allocVector(STRSXP, nread));
3888  for(i = 0; i < nread; i++)
3889  SET_STRING_ELT(ans2, i, STRING_ELT(ans, i));
3890  UNPROTECT(2);
3891  ProvenanceTracker::flagXenogenesis();
3892  return ans2;
3893 }
3894 
3895 /* writeLines(text, con = stdout(), sep = "\n", useBytes) */
3896 HIDDEN SEXP do_writelines(/*const*/ Expression* call, const BuiltInFunction* op, RObject* text_, RObject* con_, RObject* sep_, RObject* useBytes_)
3897 {
3898  int con_num, useBytes;
3899  Rboolean wasopen;
3900  Rconnection con=nullptr;
3901  const char *ssep;
3902  SEXP text, sep;
3903 
3904  text = text_;
3905  if(!Rf_isString(text)) Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "text");
3906  if(!Rf_inherits(con_, "connection"))
3907  Rf_error(_("'con' is not a connection"));
3908  con_num = Rf_asInteger(con_);
3909  con = getConnection(con_num);
3910  sep = sep_;
3911  if(!Rf_isString(sep)) Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "sep");
3912  useBytes = Rf_asLogical(useBytes_);
3913  if(useBytes == R_NaLog)
3914  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "useBytes");
3915 
3916  wasopen = con->isopen;
3917  if(!wasopen) {
3918  char mode[5];
3919  /* Documented behaviour */
3920  strcpy(mode, con->mode);
3921  strcpy(con->mode, "wt");
3922  if(!con->open(con)) Rf_error(_("cannot open the connection"));
3923  strcpy(con->mode, mode);
3924  if(!con->canwrite) /* unlikely, but be safe */
3925  con->close(con);
3926  }
3927  if(!con->canwrite) Rf_error(_("cannot write to this connection"));
3928  /* NB: Rf_translateChar0() is the same as R_CHAR() for IS_BYTES strings */
3929  try {
3930  if(useBytes)
3931  ssep = R_CHAR(STRING_ELT(sep, 0));
3932  else
3933  ssep = Rf_translateChar0(STRING_ELT(sep, 0));
3934 
3935  /* New for 2.7.0: split the output if sink was split.
3936  It would be slightly simpler just to call Rvprintf if the
3937  connection was stdout(), but this way is more efficent */
3938  if(con_num == R_OutputCon) {
3939  int j = 0;
3940  Rconnection con0;
3941  do {
3942  con0 = getConnection(con_num);
3943  for(R_xlen_t i = 0; i < Rf_xlength(text); i++)
3944  Rconn_printf(con0, "%s%s",
3945  useBytes ? R_CHAR(STRING_ELT(text, i)) :
3946  Rf_translateChar0(STRING_ELT(text, i)), ssep);
3947  con0->fflush(con0);
3948  con_num = getActiveSink(j++);
3949  } while (con_num > 0);
3950  } else {
3951  for(R_xlen_t i = 0; i < Rf_xlength(text); i++)
3952  Rconn_printf(con, "%s%s",
3953  useBytes ? R_CHAR(STRING_ELT(text, i)) :
3954  Rf_translateChar0(STRING_ELT(text, i)), ssep);
3955  }
3956  } catch (...) {
3957  if (!wasopen && con->isopen)
3958  con->close(con);
3959  throw;
3960  }
3961 
3962  if(!wasopen) {
3963  checkClose(con);
3964  }
3965  return nullptr;
3966 }
3967 
3968 /* ------------------- read, write binary --------------------- */
3969 
3970 static void swapb(void *result, int size)
3971 {
3972  int i;
3973  char *p = static_cast<char *>(result), tmp;
3974 
3975  if (size == 1) return;
3976  for (i = 0; i < size/2; i++) {
3977  tmp = p[i];
3978  p[i] = p[size - i - 1];
3979  p[size - i - 1] = tmp;
3980  }
3981 }
3982 
3983 static SEXP readOneString(Rconnection con)
3984 {
3985  char buf[10001], *p;
3986  int pos, m;
3987 
3988  for(pos = 0; pos < 10000; pos++) {
3989  p = buf + pos;
3990  m = (int) con->read(p, sizeof(char), 1, con);
3991  if (m < 0) Rf_error("error reading from the connection");
3992  if(!m) {
3993  if(pos > 0)
3994  Rf_warning(_("incomplete string at end of file has been discarded"));
3995  return nullptr;
3996  }
3997  if(*p == '\0') break;
3998  }
3999  if(pos == 10000)
4000  Rf_warning(_("null terminator not found: breaking string at 10000 bytes"));
4001  return Rf_mkChar(buf);
4002 }
4003 
4004 static R_xlen_t
4005 rawRead(char *p, int size, R_xlen_t n, Rbyte *bytes, R_xlen_t nbytes, R_xlen_t *np)
4006 {
4007  R_xlen_t avail, m;
4008 
4009  avail = (nbytes - *np)/size;
4010  m = n;
4011  if (m > avail) m = avail;
4012  if (m > 0) {
4013  memcpy(p, bytes + *(np), m*size);
4014  *np += m*size;
4015  }
4016  return m;
4017 }
4018 
4019 static SEXP rawOneString(Rbyte *bytes, R_xlen_t nbytes, R_xlen_t *np)
4020 {
4021  Rbyte *p;
4022  R_xlen_t i;
4023  char *buf;
4024  SEXP res;
4025 
4026  /* just look for null terminator */
4027  for(i = *np, p = bytes+(*np); i < nbytes; p++, i++)
4028  if(*p == '\0') break;
4029  if(i < nbytes) { /* has terminator */
4030  p = bytes+(*np);
4031  *np = i+1;
4032  return Rf_mkChar(reinterpret_cast<char *>(p));
4033  }
4034  /* so no terminator */
4035  buf = static_cast<char *>(R_chk_calloc(nbytes - (*np) + 1, 1));
4036  memcpy(buf, bytes+(*np), nbytes-(*np));
4037  res = Rf_mkChar(buf);
4038  Free(buf);
4039  *np = nbytes;
4040  return res;
4041 }
4042 
4043 /* readBin(con, what, n, swap) */
4044 #define BLOCK 8096
4045 HIDDEN SEXP do_readbin(/*const*/ Expression* call, const BuiltInFunction* op, RObject* con_, RObject* what_, RObject* n_, RObject* size_, RObject* signed_, RObject* endian_)
4046 {
4047  SEXP ans = nullptr, swhat;
4048  int size, signd, swap, sizedef= 4, mode = 1;
4049  const char *what;
4050  void *p = nullptr;
4051  Rboolean wasopen = TRUE, isRaw = FALSE;
4052  Rconnection con = nullptr;
4053  Rbyte *bytes = nullptr;
4054  R_xlen_t i, n, m = 0, nbytes = 0, np = 0;
4055 
4056  if(TYPEOF(con_) == RAWSXP) {
4057  isRaw = TRUE;
4058  bytes = RAW(con_);
4059  nbytes = XLENGTH(con_);
4060  } else {
4061  con = getConnection(Rf_asInteger(con_));
4062  if(con->text) Rf_error(_("can only read from a binary connection"));
4063  }
4064 
4065  swhat = what_;
4066  if(!Rf_isString(swhat) || Rf_length(swhat) != 1)
4067  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "what");
4068  what = R_CHAR(STRING_ELT(swhat, 0)); /* ASCII */
4069  n = asVecSize(n_);
4070  if(n < 0) Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "n");
4071  size = Rf_asInteger(size_);
4072  signd = Rf_asLogical(signed_);
4073  if(signd == R_NaLog)
4074  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "signed");
4075  swap = Rf_asLogical(endian_);
4076  if(swap == R_NaLog)
4077  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "swap");
4078  if(!isRaw) {
4079  wasopen = con->isopen;
4080  if(!wasopen) {
4081  /* Documented behaviour */
4082  char mode[5];
4083  strcpy(mode, con->mode);
4084  strcpy(con->mode, "rb");
4085  if(!con->open(con)) Rf_error(_("cannot open the connection"));
4086  strcpy(con->mode, mode);
4087  if(!con->canread)
4088  con->close(con);
4089  }
4090  if(!con->canread) Rf_error(_("cannot read from this connection"));
4091  }
4092 
4093  try {
4094  if(streql(what, "character")) {
4095  SEXP onechar;
4096  PROTECT(ans = Rf_allocVector(STRSXP, n));
4097  for(i = 0, m = 0; i < n; i++) {
4098  onechar = isRaw ? rawOneString(bytes, nbytes, &np)
4099  : readOneString(con);
4100  if(onechar != nullptr) {
4101  SET_STRING_ELT(ans, i, onechar);
4102  m++;
4103  } else break;
4104  }
4105  } else if(streql(what, "complex")) {
4106  if(size == R_NaInt) size = sizeof(Rcomplex);
4107  if(size != sizeof(Rcomplex))
4108  Rf_error(_("size changing is not supported for complex vectors"));
4109  PROTECT(ans = Rf_allocVector(CPLXSXP, n));
4110  p = COMPLEX(ans);
4111  if(isRaw) {
4112  m = rawRead(static_cast<char *>(p), size, n, bytes, nbytes, &np);
4113  } else {
4114  /* Do this in blocks to avoid large buffers in the connection */
4115  char *pp = static_cast<char *>(p);
4116  R_xlen_t m0, n0 = n;
4117  m = 0;
4118  while(n0) {
4119  size_t n1 = (n0 < BLOCK) ? n0 : BLOCK;
4120  m0 = con->read(pp, size, n1, con);
4121  if (m0 < 0) Rf_error("error reading from the connection");
4122  m += m0;
4123  if (m0 < static_cast<R_xlen_t>(n1)) break;
4124  n0 -= n1;
4125  pp += n1 * size;
4126  }
4127  }
4128  if(swap)
4129  for(i = 0; i < m; i++) {
4130  swapb(&(COMPLEX(ans)[i].r), sizeof(double));
4131  swapb(&(COMPLEX(ans)[i].i), sizeof(double));
4132  }
4133  } else {
4134  if (streql(what, "integer") || streql(what, "int")) {
4135  sizedef = sizeof(int); mode = 1;
4136  if(size == R_NaInt) size = sizedef;
4137  switch (size) {
4138  case sizeof(signed char):
4139  case sizeof(short):
4140  case sizeof(int):
4141 #if SIZEOF_LONG == 8
4142  case sizeof(long):
4143 #elif SIZEOF_LONG_LONG == 8
4144  case sizeof(_lli_t):
4145 #endif
4146  break;
4147  default:
4148  Rf_error(_("size %d is unknown on this machine"), size);
4149  }
4150  PROTECT(ans = Rf_allocVector(INTSXP, n));
4151  p = INTEGER(ans);
4152  } else if (streql(what, "logical")) {
4153  sizedef = sizeof(int); mode = 1;
4154  if(size == R_NaInt) size = sizedef;
4155  switch (size) {
4156  case sizeof(signed char):
4157  case sizeof(short):
4158  case sizeof(int):
4159 #if SIZEOF_LONG == 8
4160  case sizeof(long):
4161 #elif SIZEOF_LONG_LONG == 8
4162  case sizeof(_lli_t):
4163 #endif
4164  break;
4165  default:
4166  Rf_error(_("size %d is unknown on this machine"), size);
4167  }
4168  PROTECT(ans = Rf_allocVector(LGLSXP, n));
4169  p = LOGICAL(ans);
4170  } else if (streql(what, "raw")) {
4171  sizedef = 1; mode = 1;
4172  if(size == R_NaInt) size = sizedef;
4173  switch (size) {
4174  case 1:
4175  break;
4176  default:
4177  Rf_error(_("raw is always of size 1"));
4178  }
4179  PROTECT(ans = Rf_allocVector(RAWSXP, n));
4180  p = RAW(ans);
4181  } else if (streql(what, "numeric") || streql(what, "double")) {
4182  sizedef = sizeof(double); mode = 2;
4183  if(size == R_NaInt) size = sizedef;
4184  switch (size) {
4185  case sizeof(double):
4186  case sizeof(float):
4187 #if HAVE_LONG_DOUBLE && (SIZEOF_LONG_DOUBLE > SIZEOF_DOUBLE)
4188  case sizeof(long double):
4189 #endif
4190  break;
4191  default:
4192  Rf_error(_("size %d is unknown on this machine"), size);
4193  }
4194  PROTECT(ans = Rf_allocVector(REALSXP, n));
4195  p = REAL(ans);
4196  } else
4197  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "what");
4198 
4199  if(!signd && (mode != 1 || size > 2))
4200  Rf_warning(_("'signed = FALSE' is only valid for integers of sizes 1 and 2"));
4201  if(size == sizedef) {
4202  if(isRaw) {
4203  m = rawRead(static_cast<char *>(p), size, n, bytes, nbytes, &np);
4204  } else {
4205  /* Do this in blocks to avoid large buffers in the connection */
4206  char *pp = static_cast<char *>(p);
4207  R_xlen_t m0, n0 = n;
4208  m = 0;
4209  while(n0) {
4210  size_t n1 = (n0 < BLOCK) ? n0 : BLOCK;
4211  m0 = con->read(pp, size, n1, con);
4212  m += m0;
4213  if (m0 < 0) Rf_error("error reading from the connection");
4214  if (m0 < static_cast<R_xlen_t>(n1)) break;
4215  n0 -= n1;
4216  pp += n1 * size;
4217  }
4218  }
4219  if(swap && size > 1)
4220  for(i = 0; i < m; i++) swapb(static_cast<char *>(p)+i*size, size);
4221  } else {
4222  union {
4223  char buf[16];
4224  signed char signed_char_value;
4225  unsigned char unsigned_char_value;
4226  short short_value;
4227  unsigned short unsigned_short_value;
4228  long long_value;
4229  _lli_t lli_t_value;
4230  float float_value;
4231 #ifdef HAVE_LONG_DOUBLE
4232  long double long_double_value;
4233 #endif
4234  } buf;
4235  R_xlen_t s;
4236  if(mode == 1) {
4237  for(i = 0, m = 0; i < n; i++) {
4238  s = isRaw ? rawRead(buf.buf, size, 1, bytes, nbytes, &np)
4239  : int(con->read(buf.buf, size, 1, con));
4240  if (s < 0) Rf_error("error reading from the connection");
4241  if(s) m++; else break;
4242  if(swap && size > 1) swapb(buf.buf, size);
4243  switch(size) {
4244  case sizeof(signed char):
4245  if(signd)
4246  INTEGER(ans)[i] = buf.signed_char_value;
4247  else
4248  INTEGER(ans)[i] = buf.unsigned_char_value;
4249  break;
4250  case sizeof(short):
4251  if(signd)
4252  INTEGER(ans)[i] = buf.short_value;
4253  else
4254  INTEGER(ans)[i] = buf.unsigned_short_value;
4255  break;
4256 #if SIZEOF_LONG == 8
4257  case sizeof(long):
4258  INTEGER(ans)[i] = buf.long_value;
4259  break;
4260 #elif SIZEOF_LONG_LONG == 8
4261  case sizeof(_lli_t):
4262  INTEGER(ans)[i] = buf.lli_t_value;
4263  break;
4264 #endif
4265  default:
4266  Rf_error(_("size %d is unknown on this machine"), size);
4267  }
4268  }
4269  } else if (mode == 2) {
4270  for(i = 0, m = 0; i < n; i++) {
4271  s = isRaw ? rawRead(buf.buf, size, 1, bytes, nbytes, &np)
4272  : int(con->read(buf.buf, size, 1, con));
4273  if (s < 0) Rf_error("error reading from the connection");
4274  if(s) m++; else break;
4275  if(swap && size > 1) swapb(buf.buf, size);
4276  switch(size) {
4277  case sizeof(float):
4278  REAL(ans)[i] = buf.float_value;
4279  break;
4280 #if HAVE_LONG_DOUBLE && (SIZEOF_LONG_DOUBLE > SIZEOF_DOUBLE)
4281  case sizeof(long double):
4282  REAL(ans)[i] = double(buf.long_double_value);
4283  break;
4284 #endif
4285  default:
4286  Rf_error(
4287  _("size %d is unknown on this machine"),
4288  size);
4289  }
4290  }
4291  }
4292  }
4293  }
4294  } catch (...) {
4295  if (!wasopen && con->isopen)
4296  con->close(con);
4297  throw;
4298  }
4299  if(!wasopen) con->close(con);
4300  if(m < n) {
4301  PROTECT(ans = Rf_xlengthgets(ans, m));
4302  UNPROTECT(1);
4303  }
4304  UNPROTECT(1);
4305  ProvenanceTracker::flagXenogenesis();
4306  return ans;
4307 
4308 }
4309 
4310 /* writeBin(object, con, size, swap, useBytes) */
4311 HIDDEN SEXP do_writebin(/*const*/ Expression* call, const BuiltInFunction* op, RObject* object_, RObject* con_, RObject* size_, RObject* endian_, RObject* useBytes_)
4312 {
4313  SEXP object, ans = nullptr;
4314  int i, j, size, swap, len, useBytes;
4315  const char* s;
4316  char* buf;
4317  Rboolean wasopen = TRUE, isRaw = FALSE;
4318  Rconnection con = nullptr;
4319 
4320  object = object_;
4321  if(!Rf_isVectorAtomic(object))
4322  Rf_error(_("'x' is not an atomic vector type"));
4323 
4324  if(TYPEOF(con_) == RAWSXP) {
4325  isRaw = TRUE;
4326  } else {
4327  con = getConnection(Rf_asInteger(con_));
4328  if(con->text) Rf_error(_("can only write to a binary connection"));
4329  wasopen = con->isopen;
4330  if(!con->canwrite) Rf_error(_("cannot write to this connection"));
4331  }
4332 
4333  size = Rf_asInteger(size_);
4334  swap = Rf_asLogical(endian_);
4335  if(swap == R_NaLog)
4336  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "swap");
4337  useBytes = Rf_asLogical(useBytes_);
4338  if(useBytes == R_NaLog)
4339  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "useBytes");
4340  len = LENGTH(object);
4341  if(len == 0) {
4342  if(isRaw) return Rf_allocVector(RAWSXP, 0); else return nullptr;
4343  }
4344  /* RAW vectors are limited to 2^31 - 1 bytes */
4345  if(static_cast<double>(len) *size > INT_MAX) {
4346  if(isRaw)
4347  Rf_error(_("only 2^31-1 bytes can be written to a raw vector"));
4348  else
4349  Rf_error(_("only 2^31-1 bytes can be written in a single writeBin() call"));
4350  }
4351 
4352  if(!wasopen) {
4353  /* Documented behaviour */
4354  char mode[5];
4355  strcpy(mode, con->mode);
4356  strcpy(con->mode, "wb");
4357  if(!con->open(con)) Rf_error(_("cannot open the connection"));
4358  strcpy(con->mode, mode);
4359  if(!con->canwrite) {
4360  con->close(con);
4361  Rf_error(_("cannot write to this connection"));
4362  }
4363  }
4364 
4365 
4366  try {
4367  if(TYPEOF(object) == STRSXP) {
4368  if(isRaw) {
4369  Rbyte *bytes;
4370  size_t np, outlen = 0;
4371  if(useBytes)
4372  for(i = 0; i < len; i++)
4373  outlen += strlen(R_CHAR(STRING_ELT(object, i))) + 1;
4374  else
4375  for(i = 0; i < len; i++)
4376  outlen += strlen(Rf_translateChar0(STRING_ELT(object, i))) + 1;
4377  PROTECT(ans = Rf_allocVector(RAWSXP, outlen));
4378  bytes = RAW(ans);
4379  /* Rf_translateChar0() is the same as CHAR for IS_BYTES strings */
4380  for(i = 0, np = 0; i < len; i++) {
4381  if(useBytes)
4382  s = R_CHAR(STRING_ELT(object, i));
4383  else
4384  s = Rf_translateChar0(STRING_ELT(object, i));
4385  memcpy(bytes+np, s, strlen(s) + 1);
4386  np += strlen(s) + 1;
4387  }
4388  } else {
4389  /* Rf_translateChar0() is the same as CHAR for IS_BYTES strings */
4390  for(i = 0; i < len; i++) {
4391  if(useBytes)
4392  s = R_CHAR(STRING_ELT(object, i));
4393  else
4394  s = Rf_translateChar0(STRING_ELT(object, i));
4395  size_t nwrite = con->write(s, sizeof(char), strlen(s) + 1, con);
4396  if(!nwrite) {
4397  Rf_warning(_("problem writing to connection"));
4398  break;
4399  }
4400  }
4401  }
4402  } else {
4403  switch(TYPEOF(object)) {
4404  case LGLSXP:
4405  case INTSXP:
4406  if(size == R_NaInt) size = sizeof(int);
4407  switch (size) {
4408  case sizeof(signed char):
4409  case sizeof(short):
4410  case sizeof(int):
4411 #if SIZEOF_LONG == 8
4412  case sizeof(long):
4413 #elif SIZEOF_LONG_LONG == 8
4414  case sizeof(_lli_t):
4415 #endif
4416  break;
4417  default:
4418  Rf_error(_("size %d is unknown on this machine"), size);
4419  }
4420  break;
4421  case REALSXP:
4422  if(size == R_NaInt) size = sizeof(double);
4423  switch (size) {
4424  case sizeof(double):
4425  case sizeof(float):
4426 #if HAVE_LONG_DOUBLE && (SIZEOF_LONG_DOUBLE > SIZEOF_DOUBLE)
4427  case sizeof(long double):
4428 #endif
4429  break;
4430  default:
4431  Rf_error(_("size %d is unknown on this machine"), size);
4432  }
4433  break;
4434  case CPLXSXP:
4435  if(size == R_NaInt) size = sizeof(Rcomplex);
4436  if(size != sizeof(Rcomplex))
4437  Rf_error(_("size changing is not supported for complex vectors"));
4438  break;
4439  case RAWSXP:
4440  if(size == R_NaInt) size = 1;
4441  if(size != 1)
4442  Rf_error(_("size changing is not supported for raw vectors"));
4443  break;
4444  default:
4445  UNIMPLEMENTED_TYPE("writeBin", object);
4446  }
4447  buf = static_cast<char *>(R_chk_calloc(len, size));
4448  switch(TYPEOF(object)) {
4449  case LGLSXP:
4450  case INTSXP:
4451  switch (size) {
4452  case sizeof(int):
4453  memcpy(buf, INTEGER(object), size * len);
4454  break;
4455 #if SIZEOF_LONG == 8
4456  case sizeof(long):
4457  {
4458  long l1;
4459  for (i = 0, j = 0; i < len; i++, j += size) {
4460  l1 = long( INTEGER(object)[i]);
4461  memcpy(buf + j, &l1, size);
4462  }
4463  break;
4464  }
4465 #elif SIZEOF_LONG_LONG == 8
4466  case sizeof(_lli_t):
4467  {
4468  _lli_t ll1;
4469  for (i = 0, j = 0; i < len; i++, j += size) {
4470  ll1 = _lli_t( INTEGER(object)[i]);
4471  memcpy(buf + j, &ll1, size);
4472  }
4473  break;
4474  }
4475 #endif
4476  case 2:
4477  {
4478  short s1;
4479  for (i = 0, j = 0; i < len; i++, j += size) {
4480  s1 = short( INTEGER(object)[i]);
4481  memcpy(buf + j, &s1, size);
4482  }
4483  break;
4484  }
4485  case 1:
4486  for (i = 0; i < len; i++)
4487  buf[i] = static_cast<signed char>(INTEGER(object)[i]);
4488  break;
4489  default:
4490  Rf_error(_("size %d is unknown on this machine"), size);
4491  }
4492  break;
4493  case REALSXP:
4494  switch (size) {
4495  case sizeof(double):
4496  memcpy(buf, REAL(object), size * len);
4497  break;
4498  case sizeof(float):
4499  {
4500  float f1;
4501  for (i = 0, j = 0; i < len; i++, j += size) {
4502  f1 = float( REAL(object)[i]);
4503  memcpy(buf+j, &f1, size);
4504  }
4505  break;
4506  }
4507 #if HAVE_LONG_DOUBLE && (SIZEOF_LONG_DOUBLE > SIZEOF_DOUBLE)
4508  case sizeof(long double):
4509  {
4510  /* some systems have problems with memcpy from
4511  the address of an automatic long double,
4512  e.g. ix86/x86_64 Linux with gcc4 */
4513  static long double ld1;
4514  for (i = 0, j = 0; i < len; i++, j += size) {
4515  ld1 = static_cast<long double>(REAL(object)[i]);
4516  memcpy(buf+j, &ld1, size);
4517  }
4518  break;
4519  }
4520 #endif
4521  default:
4522  Rf_error(_("size %d is unknown on this machine"), size);
4523  }
4524  break;
4525  case CPLXSXP:
4526  memcpy(buf, COMPLEX(object), size * len);
4527  break;
4528  case RAWSXP:
4529  memcpy(buf, RAW(object), len); /* size = 1 */
4530  break;
4531  default: // -Wswitch
4532  break;
4533  }
4534 
4535  if(swap && size > 1) {
4536  if (TYPEOF(object) == CPLXSXP)
4537  for(i = 0; i < len; i++) {
4538  int sz = size/2;
4539  swapb(buf+sz*2*i, sz);
4540  swapb(buf+sz*(2*i+1), sz);
4541  }
4542  else
4543  for(i = 0; i < len; i++) swapb(buf+size*i, size);
4544  }
4545 
4546  /* write it now */
4547  if(isRaw) { /* We checked size*len < 2^31-1 above */
4548  PROTECT(ans = Rf_allocVector(RAWSXP, size*len));
4549  memcpy(RAW(ans), buf, size*len);
4550  } else {
4551  size_t nwrite = con->write(buf, size, len, con);
4552  if(static_cast<int>(nwrite) < len) Rf_warning(_("problem writing to connection"));
4553  }
4554  Free(buf);
4555  }
4556  } catch (...) {
4557  if (!wasopen && con->isopen)
4558  con->close(con);
4559  throw;
4560  }
4561 
4562  if(!wasopen) {
4563  checkClose(con);
4564  }
4565  if(isRaw) {
4566  R_Visible = TRUE;
4567  UNPROTECT(1);
4568  } else R_Visible = FALSE;
4569  return ans;
4570 }
4571 
4572 /* FIXME: could do any MBCS locale, but would need pushback */
4573 static SEXP readFixedString(Rconnection con, int len, int useBytes)
4574 {
4575  SEXP ans;
4576  char* buf;
4577  int m;
4578  const void* vmax = vmaxget();
4579 
4580  if(utf8locale && !useBytes) {
4581  int i, clen;
4582  char *p, *q;
4583 
4584  p = buf = static_cast<char *>(R_alloc(MB_CUR_MAX*len+1, sizeof(char)));
4585  memset(buf, 0, MB_CUR_MAX*len+1);
4586  for(i = 0; i < len; i++) {
4587  q = p;
4588  m = int(con->read(p, sizeof(char), 1, con));
4589  if(!m) { if(i == 0) return nullptr; else break;}
4590  clen = utf8clen(*p++);
4591  if(clen > 1) {
4592  m = int(con->read(p, sizeof(char), clen - 1, con));
4593  if(m < clen - 1) Rf_error(_("invalid UTF-8 input in readChar()"));
4594  p += clen - 1;
4595  /* NB: this only checks validity of multi-byte characters */
4596  if(int(mbrtowc(nullptr, q, clen, nullptr)) < 0)
4597  Rf_error(_("invalid UTF-8 input in readChar()"));
4598  }
4599  }
4600  } else {
4601  buf = static_cast<char *>(R_alloc(len+1, sizeof(char)));
4602  memset(buf, 0, len+1);
4603  m = int(con->read(buf, sizeof(char), len, con));
4604  if(len && !m) return nullptr;
4605  }
4606  /* String may contain nuls which we now (R >= 2.8.0) assume to be
4607  padding and ignore silently */
4608  ans = Rf_mkChar(buf);
4609  vmaxset(vmax);
4610  return ans;
4611 }
4612 
4613 static SEXP rawFixedString(Rbyte *bytes, int len, int nbytes, int *np, int useBytes)
4614 {
4615  char* buf;
4616  SEXP res;
4617  const void* vmax = vmaxget();
4618 
4619  if(*np + len > nbytes) {
4620  len = nbytes - *np;
4621  if (!len) return(nullptr);
4622  }
4623 
4624  if(utf8locale && !useBytes) {
4625  int i, clen, iread = *np;
4626  char *p;
4627  Rbyte *q;
4628 
4629  p = buf = static_cast<char *>(R_alloc(MB_CUR_MAX*len+1, sizeof(char)));
4630  for(i = 0; i < len; i++, p += clen, iread += clen) {
4631  if (iread >= nbytes) break;
4632  q = bytes + iread;
4633  clen = utf8clen(*q);
4634  if (iread + clen > nbytes)
4635  Rf_error(_("invalid UTF-8 input in readChar()"));
4636  memcpy(p, q, clen);
4637  }
4638  clen = iread - (*np);
4639  *np = iread;
4640  *p = '\0';
4641  res = Rf_mkCharLenCE(buf, clen, CE_NATIVE);
4642  } else {
4643  /* no terminator */
4644  buf = static_cast<char *>(R_chk_calloc(len + 1, 1));
4645  memcpy(buf, bytes + (*np), len);
4646  *np += len;
4647  res = Rf_mkCharLenCE(buf, len, CE_NATIVE);
4648  Free(buf);
4649  }
4650  vmaxset(vmax);
4651  return res;
4652 }
4653 
4654 
4655 /* readChar(con, nchars) */
4656 HIDDEN SEXP do_readchar(/*const*/ Expression* call, const BuiltInFunction* op, RObject* con_, RObject* nchars_, RObject* useBytes_)
4657 {
4658  SEXP ans = nullptr, onechar, nchars;
4659  R_xlen_t i, n, m = 0;
4660  int nbytes = 0, np = 0, useBytes;
4661  Rboolean wasopen = TRUE, isRaw = FALSE;
4662  Rconnection con = nullptr;
4663  Rbyte *bytes = nullptr;
4664 
4665  if(TYPEOF(con_) == RAWSXP) {
4666  isRaw = TRUE;
4667  bytes = RAW(con_);
4668  nbytes = LENGTH(con_);
4669  } else {
4670  con = getConnection(Rf_asInteger(con_));
4671  if(!con->canread)
4672  Rf_error(_("cannot read from this connection"));
4673  }
4674  /* We did as.integer in the wrapper */
4675  nchars = nchars_;
4676  n = XLENGTH(nchars);
4677  if(n == 0) return Rf_allocVector(STRSXP, 0);
4678  useBytes = Rf_asLogical(useBytes_);
4679  if(useBytes == R_NaLog)
4680  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "useBytes");
4681 
4682  if (!isRaw) {
4683  wasopen = con->isopen;
4684  if(!wasopen) {
4685  /* Documented behaviour */
4686  char mode[5];
4687  strcpy(mode, con->mode);
4688  strcpy(con->mode, "rb");
4689  if(!con->open(con)) Rf_error(_("cannot open the connection"));
4690  strcpy(con->mode, mode);
4691  if(!con->canread)
4692  con->close(con);
4693  }
4694  if(!con->canread) Rf_error(_("cannot read from this connection"));
4695  }
4696  try {
4697  if (mbcslocale && !utf8locale && !useBytes)
4698  Rf_warning(_("can only read in bytes in a non-UTF-8 MBCS locale" ));
4699  PROTECT(ans = Rf_allocVector(STRSXP, n));
4700  for(i = 0, m = 0; i < n; i++) {
4701  int len = INTEGER(nchars)[i];
4702  if(len == R_NaInt || len < 0)
4703  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "nchar");
4704  onechar = isRaw ? rawFixedString(bytes, len, nbytes, &np, useBytes)
4705  : readFixedString(con, len, useBytes);
4706  if(onechar != nullptr) {
4707  SET_STRING_ELT(ans, i, onechar);
4708  m++;
4709  } else break;
4710  }
4711  } catch (...) {
4712  if (!wasopen && con->isopen)
4713  con->close(con);
4714  throw;
4715  }
4716  if(!wasopen) con->close(con);
4717  if(m < n) {
4718  PROTECT(ans = Rf_xlengthgets(ans, m));
4719  UNPROTECT(1);
4720  }
4721  UNPROTECT(1);
4722  ProvenanceTracker::flagXenogenesis();
4723  return ans;
4724 }
4725 
4726 /* writeChar(object, con, nchars, sep, useBytes) */
4727 HIDDEN SEXP do_writechar(/*const*/ Expression* call, const BuiltInFunction* op, RObject* object_, RObject* con_, RObject* nchars_, RObject* eos_, RObject* useBytes_)
4728 {
4729  SEXP object, nchars, sep, ans = nullptr, si;
4730  R_xlen_t i, n, len;
4731  int useBytes;
4732  size_t slen, tlen, lenb, lenc;
4733  char *buf;
4734  const char *s, *ssep = "";
4735  Rboolean wasopen = TRUE, usesep, isRaw = FALSE;
4736  Rconnection con = nullptr;
4737  mbstate_t mb_st;
4738 
4739  object = object_;
4740  if(TYPEOF(object) != STRSXP)
4741  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "object");
4742  if(TYPEOF(con_) == RAWSXP) {
4743  isRaw = TRUE;
4744  } else {
4745  con = getConnection(Rf_asInteger(con_));
4746  if(!con->canwrite)
4747  Rf_error(_("cannot write to this connection"));
4748  wasopen = con->isopen;
4749  }
4750 
4751  /* We did as.integer in the wrapper */
4752  nchars = nchars_;
4753  sep = eos_;
4754  useBytes = Rf_asLogical(useBytes_);
4755  if(useBytes == R_NaLog)
4756  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "useBytes");
4757 
4758  if(Rf_isNull(sep)) {
4759  usesep = FALSE;
4760  slen = 0;
4761  } else {
4762  usesep = TRUE;
4763  if (!Rf_isString(sep) || Rf_length(sep) != 1)
4764  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "sep");
4765  if(useBytes)
4766  ssep = R_CHAR(STRING_ELT(sep, 0));
4767  else
4768  ssep = Rf_translateChar(STRING_ELT(sep, 0));
4769  slen = strlen(ssep) + 1;
4770  }
4771  n = XLENGTH(nchars);
4772  if(XLENGTH(object) < n)
4773  Rf_error(_("'object' is too short"));
4774  if(n == 0) {
4775  if(isRaw) return Rf_allocVector(RAWSXP, 0); else return nullptr;
4776  }
4777 
4778  len = 0;
4779  if (!isRaw) {
4780  for(i = 0; i < n; i++) {
4781  /* This is not currently needed, just future-proofing in case
4782  the logic gets changed */
4783  if(useBytes)
4784  tlen = strlen(R_CHAR(STRING_ELT(object, i)));
4785  else
4786  tlen = strlen(Rf_translateChar(STRING_ELT(object, i)));
4787  if (static_cast<R_xlen_t>(tlen) > len) len = tlen;
4788  int tt = INTEGER(nchars)[i];
4789  if(tt == R_NaInt || tt < 0)
4790  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "nchars");
4791  if (tt > len) len = tt;
4792  }
4793  buf = static_cast<char *>(R_alloc(len + slen, sizeof(char)));
4794  } else {
4795  double dlen = 0;
4796  for (auto i = 0; i < n; i++)
4797  dlen += double(INTEGER(nchars)[i] + slen);
4798  if (dlen > double(R_XLEN_T_MAX))
4799  Rf_error("too much data for a raw vector on this platform");
4800  len = R_xlen_t(dlen);
4801  PROTECT(ans = Rf_allocVector(RAWSXP, len));
4802  buf = reinterpret_cast<char*>(RAW(ans));
4803  }
4804 
4805  if(!wasopen) {
4806  /* Documented behaviour */
4807  char mode[5];
4808  strcpy(mode, con->mode);
4809  strcpy(con->mode, "wb");
4810  if(!con->open(con)) Rf_error(_("cannot open the connection"));
4811  strcpy(con->mode, mode);
4812  if(!con->canwrite) {
4813  con->close(con);
4814  Rf_error(_("cannot write to this connection"));
4815  }
4816  }
4817 
4818 
4819  try {
4820  for(auto i = 0; i < n; i++) {
4821  len = INTEGER(nchars)[i];
4822  si = STRING_ELT(object, i);
4823  if(int(strlen(R_CHAR(si))) < LENGTH(si)) {
4824  if(len > LENGTH(si)) {
4825  Rf_warning(_("writeChar: more bytes requested than are in the string - will zero-pad"));
4826  }
4827  memset(buf, '\0', len + slen);
4828  memcpy(buf, R_CHAR(si), len);
4829  if (usesep) {
4830  strcpy(buf + len, ssep);
4831  len += slen;
4832  }
4833  if (!isRaw) {
4834  size_t nwrite = con->write(buf, sizeof(char), len, con);
4835  if(!nwrite) {
4836  Rf_warning(_("problem writing to connection"));
4837  break;
4838  }
4839  } else
4840  buf += len;
4841  } else {
4842  if(useBytes)
4843  s = R_CHAR(si);
4844  else
4845  s = Rf_translateChar(si);
4846  lenb = lenc = strlen(s);
4847  if(mbcslocale) lenc = mbstowcs(nullptr, s, 0);
4848  /* As from 1.8.1, zero-pad if too many chars are requested. */
4849  if(len > static_cast<R_xlen_t>(lenc)) {
4850  Rf_warning(_("writeChar: more characters requested than are in the string - will zero-pad"));
4851  lenb += (len - lenc);
4852  }
4853  if(len < static_cast<R_xlen_t>(lenc)) {
4854  if(mbcslocale) {
4855  /* find out how many bytes we need to write */
4856  size_t used;
4857  const char *p = s;
4858  mbs_init(&mb_st);
4859  for(auto i = 0, lenb = 0; static_cast<R_xlen_t>(i) < len; i++) {
4860  used = Rf_mbrtowc(nullptr, p, MB_CUR_MAX, &mb_st);
4861  p += used;
4862  lenb += used;
4863  }
4864  } else
4865  lenb = len;
4866  }
4867  memset(buf, '\0', lenb + slen);
4868  strncpy(buf, s, lenb);
4869  if (usesep) {
4870  strcpy(buf + lenb, ssep);
4871  lenb += slen;
4872  }
4873  if (!isRaw) {
4874  size_t nwrite = con->write(buf, sizeof(char), lenb, con);
4875  if(!nwrite) {
4876  Rf_warning(_("problem writing to connection"));
4877  break;
4878  }
4879  } else
4880  buf += lenb;
4881  }
4882  }
4883  } catch (...) {
4884  if (!wasopen && con->isopen)
4885  con->close(con);
4886  throw;
4887  }
4888  if(!wasopen) {
4889  checkClose(con);
4890  }
4891  if(isRaw) {
4892  R_Visible = TRUE;
4893  UNPROTECT(1);
4894  } else {
4895  ans = nullptr;
4896  R_Visible = FALSE;
4897  }
4898  return ans;
4899 }

4901 /* ------------------- push back text --------------------- */
4902 
4903 
4904 /* used in readLines and scan */
4905 void con_pushback(Rconnection con, Rboolean newLine, char *line)
4906 {
4907  int nexists = con->nPushBack;
4908  char **q;
4909 
4910  if (nexists == INT_MAX)
4911  Rf_error(_("maximum number of pushback lines exceeded"));
4912  if(nexists > 0) {
4913  q = static_cast<char **>(realloc(con->PushBack, (nexists+1)*sizeof(char *)));
4914  } else {
4915  q = static_cast<char **>(malloc(sizeof(char *)));
4916  }
4917  if(!q) Rf_error(_("could not allocate space for pushback"));
4918  else con->PushBack = q;
4919  q += nexists;
4920  *q = static_cast<char *>(malloc(strlen(line) + 1 + newLine));
4921  if(!(*q)) Rf_error(_("could not allocate space for pushback"));
4922  strcpy(*q, line);
4923  if(newLine) strcat(*q, "\n");
4924  q++;
4925  con->posPushBack = 0;
4926  con->nPushBack++;
4927 }

4930 HIDDEN SEXP do_pushback(/*const*/ Expression* call, const BuiltInFunction* op, RObject* data_, RObject* connection_, RObject* newLine_, RObject* encoding_)
4931 {
4932  int n, nexists, newLine, type;
4933  Rconnection con = nullptr;
4934  SEXP stext;
4935  const char *p;
4936  char **q;
4937 
4938  stext = data_;
4939  if(!Rf_isString(stext))
4940  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "data");
4941  con = getConnection(Rf_asInteger(connection_));
4942  newLine = Rf_asLogical(newLine_);
4943  if(newLine == R_NaLog)
4944  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "newLine");
4945  type = Rf_asInteger(encoding_);
4946  if(!con->canread && !con->isopen)
4947  Rf_error(_("can only push back on open readable connections"));
4948  if(!con->text)
4949  Rf_error(_("can only push back on text-mode connections"));
4950  nexists = con->nPushBack;
4951  if((n = Rf_length(stext)) > 0) {
4952  if(nexists > 0)
4953  q = static_cast<char **>(realloc(con->PushBack, (n+nexists)*sizeof(char *)));
4954  else
4955  q = static_cast<char **>(malloc(n*sizeof(char *)));
4956  if(!q) Rf_error(_("could not allocate space for pushback"));
4957  con->PushBack = q;
4958  q += nexists;
4959  for(auto i = 0; i < n; i++) {
4960  p = type == 1 ? Rf_translateChar(STRING_ELT(stext, n - i - 1))
4961  : ((type == 3) ? Rf_translateCharUTF8(STRING_ELT(stext, n - i - 1))
4962  : R_CHAR(STRING_ELT(stext, n - i - 1)));
4963  *q = (char *) malloc(strlen(p) + 1 + newLine);
4964  if(!(*q)) Rf_error(_("could not allocate space for pushback"));
4965  strcpy(*q, p);
4966  if(newLine) strcat(*q, "\n");
4967  q++;
4968  }
4969  con->posPushBack = 0;
4970  con->nPushBack += n;
4971  }
4972  return nullptr;
4973 }

4983 HIDDEN SEXP do_clearpushback(/*const*/ Expression* call, const BuiltInFunction* op, RObject* connection_)

4990  for(size_t j = 0; j < con->nPushBack; j++) free(con->PushBack[j]);
4991  free(con->PushBack);

4997 /* ------------------- sink functions --------------------- */
4998 
4999 /* Switch output to connection number icon, or pop stack if icon < 0
5000  */
5001 
5002 static Rboolean
5003 switch_or_tee_stdout(int icon, int closeOnExit, int tee)
5004 {
5005  int toclose;
5006 
5007  if(icon == R_OutputCon) return FALSE;
5008 
5009  if(icon >= 0 && R_SinkNumber >= NSINKS - 1)
5010  Rf_error(_("sink stack is full"));
5011 
5012  if(icon == 0)
5013  Rf_error(_("cannot switch output to stdin"));
5014  else if(icon == 1 || icon == 2) {
5015  R_OutputCon = SinkCons[++R_SinkNumber] = icon;
5016  R_SinkSplit[R_SinkNumber] = tee;
5017  SinkConsClose[R_SinkNumber] = 0;
5018  } else if(icon >= 3) {
5019  Rconnection con = getConnection(icon); /* checks validity */
5020  toclose = 2*closeOnExit;
5021  if(!con->isopen) {
5022  char mode[5];
5023  strcpy(mode, con->mode);
5024  strcpy(con->mode, "wt");
5025  if(!con->open(con)) Rf_error(_("cannot open the connection"));
5026  strcpy(con->mode, mode);
5027  if(!con->canwrite) {
5028  con->close(con);
5029  Rf_error(_("cannot write to this connection"));
5030  }
5031  toclose = 1;
5032  } else if(!con->canwrite)
5033  Rf_error(_("cannot write to this connection"));
5034  R_OutputCon = SinkCons[++R_SinkNumber] = icon;
5035  SinkConsClose[R_SinkNumber] = toclose;
5036  R_SinkSplit[R_SinkNumber] = tee;
5037  R_PreserveObject(static_cast<SEXP>(con->ex_ptr));
5038  } else { /* removing a sink */
5039  if (R_SinkNumber <= 0) {
5040  Rf_warning(_("no sink to remove"));
5041  return FALSE;
5042  } else {
5043  R_OutputCon = SinkCons[--R_SinkNumber];
5044  if((icon = SinkCons[R_SinkNumber + 1]) >= 3) {
5045  Rconnection con = getConnection(icon);
5046  R_ReleaseObject(static_cast<SEXP>(con->ex_ptr));
5047  if(SinkConsClose[R_SinkNumber + 1] == 1) { /* close it */
5048  checkClose(con);
5049  } else if (SinkConsClose[R_SinkNumber + 1] == 2) /* destroy it */
5050  con_destroy(icon);
5051  }
5052  }
5053  }
5054  return TRUE;
5055 }
5056 
5057 /* This is only used by cat() */
5058 HIDDEN Rboolean switch_stdout(int icon, int closeOnExit)
5059 {
5060  return switch_or_tee_stdout(icon, closeOnExit, 0);
5061 }
5062 
5063 HIDDEN SEXP do_sink(/*const*/ Expression* call, const BuiltInFunction* op, RObject* file_, RObject* append_, RObject* type_, RObject* split_)
5064 {
5065  int icon, closeOnExit, errcon, tee;
5066 
5067  icon = Rf_asInteger(file_);
5068  closeOnExit = Rf_asLogical(append_);
5069  if(closeOnExit == R_NaLog)
5070  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "closeOnExit");
5071  errcon = Rf_asLogical(type_);
5072  if(errcon == R_NaLog) Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "type");
5073  tee = Rf_asLogical(split_);
5074  if(tee == R_NaLog) Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "split");
5075 
5076  if(!errcon) {
5077  /* allow space for cat() to use sink() */
5078  if(icon >= 0 && R_SinkNumber >= NSINKS - 2)
5079  Rf_error(_("sink stack is full"));
5080  switch_or_tee_stdout(icon, closeOnExit, tee);
5081  } else {
5082  if(icon < 0) {
5083  R_ReleaseObject(static_cast<SEXP>(getConnection(R_ErrorCon)->ex_ptr));
5084  R_ErrorCon = 2;
5085  } else {
5086  getConnection(icon); /* check validity */
5087  R_ErrorCon = icon;
5088  R_PreserveObject(static_cast<SEXP>(getConnection(icon)->ex_ptr));
5089  }
5090  }
5091 
5092  return nullptr;
5093 }

5133 {

5137  if (Connections[i])
5138  n++;

5147 HIDDEN SEXP
5148 do_getconnection(/*const*/ Expression* call, const BuiltInFunction* op, RObject* what_)
5149 {

5155  if (what == R_NaInt)
5156  Rf_error(_("there is no connection NA"));

5158  Rf_error(_("there is no connection %d"), what);

5172 HIDDEN SEXP do_sumconnection(/*const*/ Expression* call, const BuiltInFunction* op, RObject* object_)
5173 {
5174  SEXP ans, names, tmp;
5175  Rconnection Rcon;
5176 
5177  Rcon = getConnection(Rf_asInteger(object_));
5178  PROTECT(ans = Rf_allocVector(VECSXP, 7));
5179  PROTECT(names = Rf_allocVector(STRSXP, 7));
5180  SET_STRING_ELT(names, 0, Rf_mkChar("description"));
5181  if(Rcon->enc == CE_UTF8)
5182  tmp = Rf_ScalarString(Rf_mkCharCE(Rcon->description, CE_UTF8));
5183  else
5184  tmp = Rf_ScalarString(Rf_mkChar(Rcon->description));
5185  SET_VECTOR_ELT(ans, 0, tmp);
5186  SET_STRING_ELT(names, 1, Rf_mkChar("class"));
5187  SET_VECTOR_ELT(ans, 1, Rf_mkString(Rcon->connclass));
5188  SET_STRING_ELT(names, 2, Rf_mkChar("mode"));
5189  SET_VECTOR_ELT(ans, 2, Rf_mkString(Rcon->mode));
5190  SET_STRING_ELT(names, 3, Rf_mkChar("text"));
5191  SET_VECTOR_ELT(ans, 3, Rf_mkString(Rcon->text? "text":"binary"));
5192  SET_STRING_ELT(names, 4, Rf_mkChar("opened"));
5193  SET_VECTOR_ELT(ans, 4, Rf_mkString(Rcon->isopen? "opened":"closed"));
5194  SET_STRING_ELT(names, 5, Rf_mkChar("can read"));
5195  SET_VECTOR_ELT(ans, 5, Rf_mkString(Rcon->canread? "yes":"no"));
5196  SET_STRING_ELT(names, 6, Rf_mkChar("can write"));
5197  SET_VECTOR_ELT(ans, 6, Rf_mkString(Rcon->canwrite? "yes":"no"));
5198  Rf_setAttrib(ans, Symbols::NamesSymbol, names);
5199  UNPROTECT(2);
5200  return ans;
5201 }

5203 
5204 #if defined(USE_WININET_ASYNC) && !defined(USE_WININET)
5205 # define USE_WININET 2
5206 #endif
5207 
5208 // in internet module: 'type' is unused
5209 extern Rconnection
5210 R_newCurlUrl(const char *description, const char * const mode, int type);
5211 
5212 /* op = 0: .Internal( url(description, open, blocking, encoding, method))
5213  op = 1: .Internal(file(description, open, blocking, encoding, method, raw))
5214 */
5215 HIDDEN SEXP do_url(/*const*/ Expression* call, const BuiltInFunction* op, int num_args, ...)
5216 {
5217  SEXP scmd, sopen, ans, connclass, enc;
5218  const char *class2 = "url";
5219  const char *url, *open;
5220  int ncon, block, raw = 0, defmeth,
5221  meth = 0, // 0: "internal", 1: "libcurl"
5222  urlmeth; // 0: (Unix || "default"), 1: UseInternet2 || "wininet"
5223  cetype_t ienc = CE_NATIVE;
5224  Rconnection con = nullptr;
5225 
5226  va_list args;
5227  va_start(args, num_args);
5228  scmd = NEXT_ARG;
5229  sopen = NEXT_ARG;
5230  block = Rf_asLogical(NEXT_ARG);
5231  enc = NEXT_ARG;
5232  const char* cmeth = R_CHAR(Rf_asChar(NEXT_ARG));
5233  if (op->variant() == 1) { // file() -- has extra 'raw' argument
5234  raw = Rf_asLogical(NEXT_ARG);
5235  }
5236  va_end(args);
5237 
5238  // --------- description
5239  if(!Rf_isString(scmd) || Rf_length(scmd) != 1)
5240  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "description");
5241  if(Rf_length(scmd) > 1)
5242  Rf_warning(_("only first element of 'description' argument used"));
5243 #ifdef Win32
5244  urlmeth = 1;
5245  if(PRIMVAL(op) == 1 && !IS_ASCII(STRING_ELT(scmd, 0)) ) { // file(<non-ASCII>, *)
5246  ienc = CE_UTF8;
5247  url = Rf_translateCharUTF8(STRING_ELT(scmd, 0));
5248  } else {
5249  ienc = Rf_getCharCE(STRING_ELT(scmd, 0));
5250  if(ienc == CE_UTF8)
5251  url = R_CHAR(STRING_ELT(scmd, 0));
5252  else
5253  url = Rf_translateChar(STRING_ELT(scmd, 0));
5254  }
5255 #else
5256  urlmeth = 0;
5257  url = Rf_translateChar(STRING_ELT(scmd, 0));
5258 #endif
5259 
5260  UrlScheme type = HTTPsh; /* -Wall */
5261  Rboolean inet = TRUE;
5262  if (streqln(url, "http://", 7))
5263  type = HTTPsh;
5264  else if (streqln(url, "ftp://", 6))
5265  type = FTPsh;
5266  else if (streqln(url, "https://", 8))
5267  type = HTTPSsh;
5268  // ftps:// is available via most libcurl.
5269  else if (streqln(url, "ftps://", 7))
5270  type = FTPSsh;
5271  else
5272  inet = FALSE;
5273 
5274  // --------- open
5275  if(!Rf_isString(sopen) || Rf_length(sopen) != 1)
5276  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "open");
5277  open = R_CHAR(STRING_ELT(sopen, 0)); /* ASCII */
5278  // --------- blocking
5279  if(block == R_NaLog)
5280  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "block");
5281  // --------- encoding
5282  if(!Rf_isString(enc) || Rf_length(enc) != 1 ||
5283  strlen(R_CHAR(STRING_ELT(enc, 0))) > 100) /* ASCII */
5284  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "encoding");
5285 
5286  // --------- method
5287  meth = streql(cmeth, "libcurl"); // 1 if "libcurl", else 0
5288  defmeth = streql(cmeth, "default");
5289 #ifndef Win32
5290  if(defmeth) meth = 1;
5291 #endif
5292  if (streql(cmeth, "wininet")) {
5293 #ifdef Win32
5294  urlmeth = 1; // it already was as this is the default
5295 #else
5296  Rf_error(_("method = \"wininet\" is only supported on Windows"));
5297 #endif
5298  }
5299 #ifdef Win32
5300  else if (streql(cmeth, "internal")) urlmeth = 0;
5301 #endif
5302 
5303  if(op->variant() == 1) { // file() -- has extra 'raw' argument
5304  if(raw == R_NaLog)
5305  Rf_error(_("invalid '%s' argument"), "raw");
5306  }
5307 
5308  if(!meth) {
5309  if (streqln(url, "ftps://", 7)) {
5310 #ifdef HAVE_LIBCURL
5311  if (defmeth) meth = 1; else
5312 #endif
5313  Rf_error("ftps:// URLs are not supported by this method");
5314  }
5315 #ifdef Win32
5316  if (!urlmeth && streqln(url, "https://", 8)) {
5317 # ifdef HAVE_LIBCURL
5318  if (defmeth) meth = 1; else
5319 # endif
5320  Rf_error("https:// URLs are not supported by this method");
5321  }
5322 #else // Unix
5323  if (streqln(url, "https://", 8)) {
5324  // We check the libcurl build does support https as from R 3.3.0
5325  if (defmeth) meth = 1; else
5326  Rf_error("https:// URLs are not supported by the \"internal\" method");
5327  }
5328 #endif
5329  }
5330 
5331  ncon = NextConnection();
5332  if(streqln(url, "file://", 7)) {
5333  int nh = 7;
5334 #ifdef Win32
5335  /* on Windows we have file:///d:/path/to
5336  whereas on Unix it is file:///path/to */
5337  if (strlen(url) > 9 && url[7] == '/' && url[9] == ':') nh = 8;
5338 #endif
5339  con = newfile(url + nh, ienc, strlen(open) ? open : "r", raw);
5340  class2 = "file";
5341  } else if (inet) {
5342  if(meth) {
5343 # ifdef HAVE_LIBCURL
5344  con = R_newCurlUrl(url, strlen(open) ? open : "r", 0);
5345 # else
5346  Rf_error("url(method = \"libcurl\") is not supported on this platform");
5347 # endif
5348  } else {
5349  con = R_newurl(url, strlen(open) ? open : "r", urlmeth);
5350  ((Rurlconn)con->connprivate)->type = type;
5351  }
5352  } else {
5353  if(op->variant() == 1) { /* call to file() */
5354  if(strlen(url) == 0) {
5355  if(!strlen(open)) open ="w+";
5356  if(strcmp(open, "w+") != 0 && strcmp(open, "w+b") != 0) {
5357  open ="w+";
5358  Rf_warning(_("file(\"\") only supports open = \"w+\" and open = \"w+b\": using the former"));
5359  }
5360  }
5361  if(streql(url, "clipboard") ||
5362 #ifdef Win32
5363  streqln(url, "clipboard-", 10)
5364 #else
5365  streql(url, "X11_primary")
5366  || streql(url, "X11_secondary")
5367  || streql(url, "X11_clipboard")
5368 #endif
5369  )
5370  con = newclp(url, strlen(open) ? open : const_cast<char *>("r"));
5371  else {
5372  if (!raw &&
5373  (!strlen(open) || streql(open, "r") || streql(open, "rt"))) {
5374  /* check if this is a compressed file */
5375  FILE *fp = fopen(R_ExpandFileName(url), "rb");
5376  char buf[7];
5377  int ztype = -1, subtype = 0, compress = 0;
5378  if (fp) {
5379  memset(buf, 0, 7);
5380  size_t res = fread(buf, 5, 1, fp);
5381  fclose(fp);
5382  if(res == 1) {
5383  if(buf[0] == '\x1f' && buf[1] == '\x8b') ztype = 0;
5384  if(streqln(buf, "BZh", 3)) ztype = 1;
5385  if((buf[0] == '\xFD') && streqln(buf+1, "7zXZ", 4))
5386  ztype = 2;
5387  if((buf[0] == '\xFF') && streqln(buf+1, "LZMA", 4))
5388  { ztype = 2; subtype = 1;}
5389  if(!memcmp(buf, "]\0\0\200\0", 5))
5390  { ztype = 2; subtype = 1;}
5391  }
5392  }
5393  switch(ztype) {
5394  case -1:
5395  con = newfile(url, ienc, strlen(open) ? open : "r", raw);
5396  break;
5397  case 0:
5398  con = newgzfile(url, strlen(open) ? open : "rt", compress);
5399  break;
5400  case 1:
5401  con = newbzfile(url, strlen(open) ? open : "rt", compress);
5402  break;
5403  case 2:
5404  con = newxzfile(url, strlen(open) ? open : "rt", subtype, compress);
5405  break;
5406  }
5407  } else
5408  con = newfile(url, ienc, strlen(open) ? open : "r", raw);
5409  }
5410  class2 = "file";
5411  } else { // url()
5412  Rf_error(_("URL scheme unsupported by this method"));
5413  }
5414  }
5415 
5416  Connections[ncon] = con;
5417  con->blocking = Rboolean(block);
5418  strncpy(con->encname, R_CHAR(STRING_ELT(enc, 0)), 100); /* ASCII */
5419  con->encname[100 - 1] = '\0';
5420 
5421  /* only text-mode connections are affected, but we can't tell that
5422  until the connection is opened, and why set an encoding on a
5423  connection intended to be used in binary mode? */
5424  if (con->encname[0] && !streql(con->encname, "native.enc"))
5425  con->canseek = FALSE;
5426  /* This is referenced in do_getconnection, so set up before
5427  any warning */
5428  con->ex_ptr = PROTECT(R_MakeExternalPtr(con->id, Rf_install("connection"), nullptr));
5429 
5430  /* open it if desired */
5431  if(strlen(open)) {
5432  Rboolean success = con->open(con);
5433  if(!success) {
5434  con_destroy(ncon);
5435  Rf_error(_("cannot open the connection"));
5436  }
5437  }
5438 
5439  PROTECT(ans = Rf_ScalarInteger(ncon));
5440  PROTECT(connclass = Rf_allocVector(STRSXP, 2));
5441  SET_STRING_ELT(connclass, 0, Rf_mkChar(class2));
5442  SET_STRING_ELT(connclass, 1, Rf_mkChar("connection"));
5443  Rf_classgets(ans, connclass);
5444  Rf_setAttrib(ans, Symbols::ConnIdSymbol, static_cast<SEXP>(con->ex_ptr));
5445  R_RegisterCFinalizerEx(static_cast<SEXP>(con->ex_ptr), conFinalizer, FALSE);
5446  UNPROTECT(3);
5447 
5448  return ans;
5449 }

5454  if(!con->canwrite) Rf_error(_("cannot write to this connection"));
5455 
5456  return con->write(buf, 1, n, con);
5457 }

5459 size_t R_ReadConnection(Rconnection con, void *buf, size_t n)
5460 {
5461  if(!con->isopen) Rf_error(_("connection is not open"));
5462  if(!con->canread) Rf_error(_("cannot read from this connection"));
5463

5465 }
