5471 
5472 /* ------------------- (de)compression functions --------------------- */
5473 
5474 /* Code for gzcon connections is modelled on gzio.c from zlib 1.2.3 */
5475 
5476 #define get_byte() (icon->read(&ccc, 1, 1, icon), ccc)
5477 
5478 static Rboolean gzcon_open(Rconnection con)
5479 {
5480  Rgzconn priv = static_cast<Rgzconn>(con->connprivate);
5481  Rconnection icon = priv->con;
5482 
5483  if(!icon->isopen && !icon->open(icon)) return FALSE;
5484  con->isopen = TRUE;
5485  con->canwrite = icon->canwrite;
5486  con->canread = Rboolean(!con->canwrite);
5487  con->save = -1000;
5488 
5489  priv->s.zalloc = nullptr;
5490  priv->s.zfree = nullptr;
5491  priv->s.opaque = nullptr;
5492  priv->s.next_in = Z_NULL;
5493  priv->s.next_out = Z_NULL;
5494  priv->s.avail_in = priv->s.avail_out = 0;
5495  priv->z_err = Z_OK;
5496  priv->z_eof = 0;
5497  priv->crc = crc32(0L, Z_NULL, 0);
5498 
5499  if(con->canread) {
5500  /* read header */
5501  char c, ccc, method, flags, dummy[6];
5502  unsigned char head[2];
5503  uInt len;
5504 
5505  icon->read(head, 1, 2, icon);
5506  if(head[0] != gz_magic[0] || head[1] != gz_magic[1]) {
5507  if(!priv->allow) {
5508  Rf_warning(_("file stream does not have gzip magic number"));
5509  return FALSE;
5510  }
5511  priv->nsaved = 2;
5512  priv->saved[0] = head[0];
5513  priv->saved[1] = head[1];
5514  return TRUE;
5515  }
5516  icon->read(&method, 1, 1, icon);
5517  icon->read(&flags, 1, 1, icon);
5518  if (method != Z_DEFLATED || (flags & RESERVED) != 0) {
5519  Rf_warning(_("file stream does not have valid gzip header"));
5520  return FALSE;
5521  }
5522  icon->read(dummy, 1, 6, icon);
5523  if ((flags & EXTRA_FIELD) != 0) { /* skip the extra field */
5524  len = uInt( get_byte());
5525  len += (uInt( get_byte())) << 8;
5526  /* len is garbage if EOF but the loop below will quit anyway */
5527  while (len-- != 0 && get_byte() != EOF) ;
5528  }
5529  if ((flags & ORIG_NAME) != 0) { /* skip the original file name */
5530  while ((c = get_byte()) != 0 && c != EOF) ;
5531  }
5532  if ((flags & COMMENT) != 0) { /* skip the .gz file comment */
5533  while ((c = get_byte()) != 0 && c != EOF) ;
5534  }
5535  if ((flags & HEAD_CRC) != 0) { /* skip the header crc */
5536  for (len = 0; len < 2; len++) (void) get_byte();
5537  }
5538  priv->s.next_in = priv->buffer;
5539  inflateInit2(&(priv->s), -MAX_WBITS);
5540  } else {
5541  /* write a header */
5542  char head[11];
5543  snprintf(head, 11, "%c%c%c%c%c%c%c%c%c%c", gz_magic[0], gz_magic[1],
5544  Z_DEFLATED, 0 /*flags*/, 0,0,0,0 /*time*/, 0 /*xflags*/,
5545  OS_CODE);
5546  icon->write(head, 1, 10, icon);
5547  deflateInit2(&(priv->s), priv->cp, Z_DEFLATED, -MAX_WBITS,
5548  8, Z_DEFAULT_STRATEGY);
5549  priv->s.next_out = priv->buffer;
5550  priv->s.avail_out = Z_BUFSIZE;
5551  }
5552 
5553  return TRUE;
5554 }
5555 
5556 static void putLong(Rconnection con, uLong x)
5557 {
5558  int n;
5559  unsigned char buf[4];
5560 
5561  for (n = 0; n < 4; n++) {
5562  buf[n] = (x & 0xff);
5563  x >>= 8;
5564  }
5565  con->write(&buf, 4, 1, con);
5566 }
5567 
5568 
5569 static void gzcon_close(Rconnection con)
5570 {
5571  Rgzconn priv = static_cast<Rgzconn>(con->connprivate);
5572  Rconnection icon = priv->con;
5573 
5574  if(icon->canwrite) {
5575  uInt len;
5576  int done = 0;
5577  priv->s.avail_in = 0; /* should be zero already anyway */
5578  for (;;) {
5579  len = Z_BUFSIZE - priv->s.avail_out;
5580 
5581  if (len != 0) {
5582  if (icon->write(priv->buffer, 1, len, icon) != len) {
5583  priv->z_err = Z_ERRNO;
5584  Rf_error(_("writing error whilst flushing 'gzcon' connection"));
5585  }
5586  priv->s.next_out = priv->buffer;
5587  priv->s.avail_out = Z_BUFSIZE;
5588  }
5589  if (done) break;
5590  priv->z_err = deflate(&(priv->s), Z_FINISH);
5591 
5592  /* deflate has finished flushing only when it hasn't used up
5593  * all the available space in the output buffer:
5594  */
5595  done = (priv->s.avail_out != 0 || priv->z_err == Z_STREAM_END);
5596 
5597  if (priv->z_err != Z_OK && priv->z_err != Z_STREAM_END) break;
5598  }
5599  deflateEnd(&(priv->s));
5600  /* NB: these must be little-endian */
5601  putLong(icon, priv->crc);
5602  putLong(icon, uLong( (priv->s.total_in & 0xffffffff)));
5603  } else inflateEnd(&(priv->s));
5604 
5605  if(icon->isopen) icon->close(icon);
5606  con->isopen = FALSE;
5607 }
5608 
5609 static int gzcon_byte(Rgzconn priv)
5610 {
5611  Rconnection icon = priv->con;
5612 
5613  if (priv->z_eof) return EOF;
5614  if (priv->s.avail_in == 0) {
5615  priv->s.avail_in = uInt( icon->read(priv->buffer, 1, Z_BUFSIZE, icon));
5616  if (priv->s.avail_in == 0) {
5617  priv->z_eof = 1;
5618  return EOF;
5619  }
5620  priv->s.next_in = priv->buffer;
5621  }
5622  priv->s.avail_in--;
5623  return *(priv->s.next_in)++;
5624 }
5625 
5626 
5627 static size_t gzcon_read(void *ptr, size_t size, size_t nitems,
5628  Rconnection con)
5629 {
5630  Rgzconn priv = static_cast<Rgzconn>(con->connprivate);
5631  Rconnection icon = priv->con;
5632  Bytef *start = static_cast<Bytef*>(ptr);
5633  uLong crc;
5634  int n;
5635 
5636  if (priv->z_err == Z_STREAM_END) return 0; /* EOF */
5637 
5638  /* wrapped connection only needs to handle INT_MAX */
5639  if (double(size) * double(nitems) > INT_MAX)
5640  Rf_error(_("too large a block specified"));
5641  if (priv->nsaved >= 0) { /* non-compressed mode */
5642  size_t len = size*nitems;
5643  int nsaved = priv->nsaved;
5644  if (len == 0) return 0;
5645  if (len >= 2) {
5646  for(auto i = 0; i < priv->nsaved; i++)
5647  (static_cast<char *>(ptr))[i] = priv->saved[i];
5648  priv->nsaved = 0;
5649  return (nsaved + icon->read(static_cast<char *>(ptr)+nsaved, 1, len - nsaved,
5650  icon))/size;
5651  }
5652  if (len == 1) { /* size must be one */
5653  if (nsaved > 0) {
5654  (static_cast<char *>(ptr))[0] = priv->saved[0];
5655  priv->saved[0] = priv->saved[1];
5656  priv->nsaved--;
5657  return 1;
5658  } else
5659  return icon->read(ptr, 1, 1, icon);
5660  }
5661  }
5662 
5663  priv->s.next_out = static_cast<Bytef*>(ptr);
5664  priv->s.avail_out = uInt(size*nitems);
5665 
5666  while (priv->s.avail_out != 0) {
5667  if (priv->s.avail_in == 0 && !priv->z_eof) {
5668  priv->s.avail_in = uInt(icon->read(priv->buffer, 1, Z_BUFSIZE, icon));
5669  if (priv->s.avail_in == 0) priv->z_eof = 1;
5670  priv->s.next_in = priv->buffer;
5671  }
5672  priv->z_err = inflate(&(priv->s), Z_NO_FLUSH);
5673 
5674  if (priv->z_err == Z_STREAM_END) {
5675  /* Check CRC */
5676  priv->crc = crc32(priv->crc, start,
5677  uInt(priv->s.next_out - start));
5678  start = priv->s.next_out;
5679  crc = 0;
5680  for (n = 0; n < 4; n++) {
5681  crc >>= 8;
5682  crc += (uLong( gzcon_byte(priv)) << 24);
5683  }
5684  if (crc != priv->crc) {
5685  priv->z_err = Z_DATA_ERROR;
5686  REprintf(_("crc error %x %x\n"), crc, priv->crc);
5687  }
5688  /* finally, get (and ignore) length */
5689  for (n = 0; n < 4; n++) gzcon_byte(priv);
5690  }
5691  if (priv->z_err != Z_OK || priv->z_eof) break;
5692  }
5693  priv->crc = crc32(priv->crc, start, uInt(priv->s.next_out - start));
5694  return size_t(size*nitems - priv->s.avail_out)/size;
5695 }
5696 
5697 static size_t gzcon_write(const void *ptr, size_t size, size_t nitems,
5698  Rconnection con)
5699 {
5700  Rgzconn priv = static_cast<Rgzconn>(con->connprivate);
5701  Rconnection icon = priv->con;
5702 
5703  if (double(size) * double(nitems) > INT_MAX)
5704  Rf_error(_("too large a block specified"));
5705  priv->s.next_in = static_cast<Bytef*>(const_cast<void*>(ptr));
5706  priv->s.avail_in = uInt(size*nitems);
5707 
5708  while (priv->s.avail_in != 0) {
5709  if (priv->s.avail_out == 0) {
5710  priv->s.next_out = priv->buffer;
5711  if (icon->write(priv->buffer, 1, Z_BUFSIZE, icon) != Z_BUFSIZE) {
5712  priv->z_err = Z_ERRNO;
5713  Rf_warning(_("write error on 'gzcon' connection"));
5714  break;
5715  }
5716  priv->s.avail_out = Z_BUFSIZE;
5717  }
5718  priv->z_err = deflate(&(priv->s), Z_NO_FLUSH);
5719  if (priv->z_err != Z_OK) break;
5720  }
5721  priv->crc = crc32(priv->crc, static_cast<const Bytef *>(ptr), uInt(size*nitems));
5722  return size_t(size*nitems - priv->s.avail_in)/size;
5723 }
5724 
5725 static int gzcon_fgetc(Rconnection con)
5726 {
5727  unsigned char c;
5728  size_t n = gzcon_read(&c, 1, 1, con);
5729  return (n == 1) ? c : R_EOF;
5730 }

5732 
5733 /* gzcon(con, level, allowNonCompressed) */
5734 HIDDEN SEXP do_gzcon(/*const*/ Expression* call, const BuiltInFunction* op, RObject* con_, RObject* level_, RObject* allowNonCompressed_, RObject* text_)
5735 {
5736  SEXP ans, connclass;
5737  int icon, level, allow;
5738  Rconnection incon = nullptr, newconn = nullptr;
5739  char *m, description[1000];
5740  const char* mode = nullptr;
5741  Rboolean text;
5742 
5743  if(!Rf_inherits(con_, "connection"))
5744  Rf_error(_("'con' is not a connection"));
5745  incon = getConnection(icon = Rf_asInteger(con_));
5746  level = Rf_asInteger(level_);
5747  if(level == R_NaInt || level < 0 || level > 9)
5748  Rf_error(_("'level' must be one of 0 ... 9"));
5749  allow = Rf_asLogical(allowNonCompressed_);
5750  if(allow == R_NaInt)
5751  Rf_error(_("'allowNonCompression' must be TRUE or FALSE"));
5752  text = Rboolean(Rf_asLogical(text_));
5753  if(text == R_NaInt)
5754  Rf_error(_("'text' must be TRUE or FALSE"));
5755 
5756  if(incon->isGzcon) {
5757  Rf_warning(_("this is already a 'gzcon' connection"));
5758  return con_;
5759  }
5760  m = incon->mode;
5761  if(streql(m, "r") || streqln(m, "rb", 2)) mode = "rb";
5762  else if (streql(m, "w") || streqln(m, "wb", 2)) mode = "wb";
5763  else Rf_error(_("can only use read- or write- binary connections"));
5764  if(streql(incon->connclass, "file") &&
5765  (streql(m, "r") || streql(m, "w")))
5766  Rf_warning(_("using a text-mode 'file' connection may not work correctly"));
5767 
5768  else if(streql(incon->connclass, "textConnection") && streql(m, "w"))
5769  Rf_error(_("cannot create a 'gzcon' connection from a writable textConnection; maybe use rawConnection"));
5770 
5771  newconn = static_cast<Rconnection>(malloc(sizeof(struct Rconn)));
5772  if(!newconn) Rf_error(_("allocation of 'gzcon' connection failed"));
5773  newconn->connclass = static_cast<char *>(malloc(strlen("gzcon") + 1));
5774  if(!newconn->connclass) {
5775  free(newconn);
5776  Rf_error(_("allocation of 'gzcon' connection failed"));
5777  /* for Solaris 12.5 */ newconn = nullptr;
5778  }
5779  strcpy(newconn->connclass, "gzcon");
5780  snprintf(description, 1000, "gzcon(%s)", incon->description);
5781  newconn->description = static_cast<char *>(malloc(strlen(description) + 1));
5782  if(!newconn->description) {
5783  free(newconn->connclass); free(newconn);
5784  Rf_error(_("allocation of 'gzcon' connection failed"));
5785  /* for Solaris 12.5 */ newconn = nullptr;
5786  }
5787  init_con(newconn, description, CE_NATIVE, mode);
5788  newconn->text = text;
5789  newconn->isGzcon = TRUE;
5790  newconn->open = &gzcon_open;
5791  newconn->close = &gzcon_close;
5792  newconn->vfprintf = &dummy_vfprintf;
5793  newconn->fgetc = &gzcon_fgetc;
5794  newconn->read = &gzcon_read;
5795  newconn->write = &gzcon_write;
5796  newconn->connprivate = malloc(sizeof(struct gzconn));
5797  if(!newconn->connprivate) {
5798  free(newconn->description); free(newconn->connclass); free(newconn);
5799  Rf_error(_("allocation of 'gzcon' connection failed"));
5800  /* for Solaris 12.5 */ newconn = nullptr;
5801  }
5802  (static_cast<Rgzconn>((newconn->connprivate)))->con = incon;
5803  (static_cast<Rgzconn>((newconn->connprivate)))->cp = level;
5804  (static_cast<Rgzconn>((newconn->connprivate)))->nsaved = -1;
5805  (static_cast<Rgzconn>((newconn->connprivate)))->allow = Rboolean(allow);
5806 
5807  /* as there might not be an R-level reference to the wrapped connection */
5808  R_PreserveObject(static_cast<SEXP>(incon->ex_ptr));
5809 
5810  Connections[icon] = newconn;
5811  strncpy(newconn->encname, incon->encname, 100);
5812  newconn->encname[100 - 1] = '\0';
5813  newconn->ex_ptr = PROTECT(R_MakeExternalPtr((void *)newconn->id, Rf_install("connection"),
5814  nullptr));
5815  if(incon->isopen) newconn->open(newconn);
5816 
5817  PROTECT(ans = Rf_ScalarInteger(icon));
5818  PROTECT(connclass = Rf_allocVector(STRSXP, 2));
5819  SET_STRING_ELT(connclass, 0, Rf_mkChar("gzcon"));
5820  SET_STRING_ELT(connclass, 1, Rf_mkChar("connection"));
5821  Rf_classgets(ans, connclass);
5822  Rf_setAttrib(ans, Symbols::ConnIdSymbol, static_cast<SEXP>(newconn->ex_ptr));
5823  /* Disable, as e.g. load() leaves no reference to the new connection */
5824  //R_RegisterCFinalizerEx(static_cast<SEXP>(newconn->ex_ptr), conFinalizer, FALSE);
5825  UNPROTECT(3);
5826 
5827  return ans;
5828 }
5829 
5830 
5831 /* code for in-memory (de)compression
5832  of data stored in a scalar string. Uses a 4-byte header of length,
5833  in XDR order. */
5834 
5835 #ifndef WORDS_BIGENDIAN
5836 static unsigned int uiSwap (unsigned int x)
5837 {
5838  return((x << 24) | ((x & 0xff00) << 8) | ((x & 0xff0000) >> 8) | (x >> 24));
5839 }
5840 #else
5841 inline static unsigned int uiSwap (unsigned int x)
5842 {
5843  return x;
5844 }
5845 #endif
5846 
5847 /* These are all hidden and used only in serialize.cpp,
5848  so managing R_alloc stack is prudence. */
5849 HIDDEN
5850 SEXP R_compress1(SEXP in)
5851 {
5852  const void *vmax = vmaxget();
5853  unsigned int inlen;
5854  uLong outlen;
5855  int res;
5856  Bytef *buf;
5857  SEXP ans;
5858 
5859  if(TYPEOF(in) != RAWSXP)
5860  Rf_error("R_compress1 requires a raw vector");
5861  inlen = LENGTH(in);
5862  outlen = uLong(1.001*inlen + 20);
5863  buf = static_cast<Bytef *>(RHO_alloc(outlen + 4, sizeof(Bytef)));
5864  /* we want this to be system-independent */
5865  *(reinterpret_cast<unsigned int *>(buf)) = uiSwap(inlen);
5866  res = compress(buf + 4, &outlen, static_cast<Bytef *>(RAW(in)), inlen);
5867  if(res != Z_OK) Rf_error("internal error %d in R_compress1", res);
5868  ans = Rf_allocVector(RAWSXP, outlen + 4);
5869  memcpy(RAW(ans), buf, outlen + 4);
5870  vmaxset(vmax);
5871  return ans;
5872 }
5873 
5874 HIDDEN SEXP R_decompress1(SEXP in, Rboolean* err)
5875 {
5876  const void *vmax = vmaxget();
5877  uLong inlen, outlen;
5878  int res;
5879  Bytef *buf;
5880  unsigned char *p = RAW(in);
5881  SEXP ans;
5882 
5883  if(TYPEOF(in) != RAWSXP)
5884  Rf_error("R_decompress1 requires a raw vector");
5885  inlen = LENGTH(in);
5886  outlen = uLong( uiSwap(*(reinterpret_cast<unsigned int *>(p))));
5887  buf = static_cast<Bytef *>(RHO_alloc(outlen, sizeof(Bytef)));
5888  res = uncompress(buf, &outlen, static_cast<Bytef *>(p + 4), inlen - 4);
5889  if(res != Z_OK) {
5890  Rf_warning("internal error %d in R_decompress1", res);
5891  *err = TRUE;
5892  return nullptr;
5893  }
5894  ans = Rf_allocVector(RAWSXP, outlen);
5895  memcpy(RAW(ans), buf, outlen);
5896  vmaxset(vmax);
5897  return ans;
5898 }

5900 HIDDEN SEXP R_compress2(SEXP in)
5901 {
5902  const void *vmax = vmaxget();
5903  unsigned int inlen, outlen;
5904  int res;
5905  char *buf;
5906  SEXP ans;
5907 
5908  if(TYPEOF(in) != RAWSXP)
5909  Rf_error("R_compress2 requires a raw vector");
5910  inlen = LENGTH(in);
5911  outlen = static_cast<unsigned int>(1.01*inlen + 600);
5912  buf = R_alloc(outlen + 5, sizeof(char));
5913  /* we want this to be system-independent */
5914  *(reinterpret_cast<unsigned int *>(buf)) = uiSwap(inlen);
5915  buf[4] = '2';
5916  res = BZ2_bzBuffToBuffCompress(buf + 5, &outlen,
5917  reinterpret_cast<char *>(RAW(in)), inlen,
5918  9, 0, 0);
5919  if(res != BZ_OK) Rf_error("internal error %d in R_compress2", res);
5920  /* printf("compressed %d to %d\n", inlen, outlen); */
5921  if (res != BZ_OK || outlen > inlen) {
5922  outlen = inlen;
5923  buf[4] = '0';
5924  memcpy(buf+5, RAW(in), inlen);
5925  }
5926  ans = Rf_allocVector(RAWSXP, outlen + 5);
5927  memcpy(RAW(ans), buf, outlen + 5);
5928  vmaxset(vmax);
5929  return ans;
5930 }

5932 HIDDEN SEXP R_decompress2(SEXP in, Rboolean* err)
5933 {
5934  const void *vmax = vmaxget();
5935  unsigned int inlen, outlen;
5936  int res;
5937  char *buf, *p = reinterpret_cast<char *>(RAW(in)), type;
5938  SEXP ans;
5939 
5940  if(TYPEOF(in) != RAWSXP)
5941  Rf_error("R_decompress2 requires a raw vector");
5942  inlen = LENGTH(in);
5943  outlen = uiSwap(static_cast<unsigned int>(*p));
5944  buf = R_alloc(outlen, sizeof(char));
5945  type = p[4];
5946  if (type == '2') {
5947  res = BZ2_bzBuffToBuffDecompress(buf, &outlen, p + 5, inlen - 5, 0, 0);
5948  if(res != BZ_OK) {
5949  Rf_warning("internal error %d in R_decompress2", res);
5950  *err = TRUE;
5951  return nullptr;
5952  }
5953  } else if (type == '1') {
5954  uLong outl;
5955  res = uncompress(reinterpret_cast<unsigned char *>(buf), &outl,
5956  reinterpret_cast<Bytef *>((p + 5)), inlen - 5);
5957  if(res != Z_OK) {
5958  Rf_warning("internal error %d in R_decompress1");
5959  *err = TRUE;
5960  return nullptr;
5961  }
5962  } else if (type == '0') {
5963  buf = p + 5;
5964  } else {
5965  Rf_warning("unknown type in R_decompress2");
5966  *err = TRUE;
5967  return nullptr;
5968  }
5969  ans = Rf_allocVector(RAWSXP, outlen);
5970  memcpy(RAW(ans), buf, outlen);
5971  vmaxset(vmax);
5972  return ans;
5973 }

5976 HIDDEN SEXP do_sockselect(/*const*/ Expression* call, const BuiltInFunction* op, RObject* socklist_, RObject* write_, RObject* timeout_)
5977 {
5978  Rboolean immediate = FALSE;
5979  int nsock, i;
5980  SEXP insock, write, val, insockfd;
5981  double timeout;
5982 
5983  insock = socklist_;
5984  if (TYPEOF(insock) != VECSXP || LENGTH(insock) == 0)
5985  Rf_error(_("not a list of sockets"));
5986  nsock = LENGTH(insock);
5987 
5988  write = write_;
5989  if (TYPEOF(write) != LGLSXP || LENGTH(write) != nsock)
5990  Rf_error(_("bad write indicators"));
5991 
5992  timeout = Rf_asReal(timeout_);
5993 
5994  PROTECT(insockfd = Rf_allocVector(INTSXP, nsock));
5995  PROTECT(val = Rf_allocVector(LGLSXP, nsock));
5996 
5997  for (i = 0; i < nsock; i++) {
5998  Rconnection conn = getConnection(Rf_asInteger(VECTOR_ELT(insock, i)));
5999  Rsockconn scp = static_cast<Rsockconn>(conn->connprivate);
6000  if (strcmp(conn->connclass, "sockconn") != 0)
6001  Rf_error(_("not a socket connection"));
6002  INTEGER(insockfd)[i] = scp->fd;
6003  if (! LOGICAL(write)[i] && scp->pstart < scp->pend) {
6004  LOGICAL(val)[i] = TRUE;
6005  immediate = TRUE;
6006  }
6007  else LOGICAL(val)[i] = FALSE;
6008  }
6009 
6010  if (! immediate)
6011  Rsockselect(nsock, INTEGER(insockfd), LOGICAL(val), LOGICAL(write),
6012  timeout);
6013 
6014  UNPROTECT(2);
6015  return val;
6016 }
6017 
6018 static lzma_filter filters[LZMA_FILTERS_MAX + 1];
6019 
6020 static void init_filters(void)
6021 {
6022  static uint32_t preset_number = 6; /* 9 | LZMA_PRESET_EXTREME; */
6023  static lzma_options_lzma opt_lzma;
6024  static Rboolean set = FALSE;
6025  if(set) return;
6026  if(lzma_lzma_preset(&opt_lzma, preset_number))
6027  Rf_error("problem setting presets");
6028  filters[0].id = LZMA_FILTER_LZMA2;
6029  filters[0].options = &opt_lzma;
6030  filters[1].id = LZMA_VLI_UNKNOWN;
6031  set = TRUE;
6032  /*
6033  printf("encoding memory usage %lu\n", lzma_raw_encoder_memusage(filters));
6034  printf("decoding memory usage %lu\n", lzma_raw_decoder_memusage(filters));
6035  */
6036 }

6038 HIDDEN SEXP R_compress3(SEXP in)
6039 {
6040  const void *vmax = vmaxget();
6041  unsigned int inlen, outlen;
6042  unsigned char *buf;
6043  SEXP ans;
6044  lzma_stream strm = LZMA_STREAM_INIT;
6045  lzma_ret ret;
6046 
6047  if(TYPEOF(in) != RAWSXP)
6048  Rf_error("R_compress3 requires a raw vector");
6049  inlen = LENGTH(in);
6050  outlen = inlen + 5; /* don't allow it to expand */
6051  buf = reinterpret_cast<unsigned char *>(R_alloc(outlen + 5, sizeof(unsigned char)));
6052  /* we want this to be system-independent */
6053  *(reinterpret_cast<unsigned int *>(buf)) = uiSwap(inlen);
6054  buf[4] = 'Z';
6055 
6056  init_filters();
6057  ret = lzma_raw_encoder(&strm, filters);
6058  if (ret != LZMA_OK) Rf_error("internal error %d in R_compress3", ret);
6059  strm.next_in = RAW(in);
6060  strm.avail_in = inlen;
6061  strm.next_out = buf + 5;
6062  strm.avail_out = outlen;
6063  while(!ret) ret = lzma_code(&strm, LZMA_FINISH);
6064  if (ret != LZMA_STREAM_END || (strm.avail_in > 0)) {
6065  Rf_warning("internal error %d in R_compress3", ret);
6066  outlen = inlen;
6067  buf[4] = '0';
6068  memcpy(buf+5, reinterpret_cast<char *>(RAW(in)), inlen);
6069  } else outlen = static_cast<unsigned int>(strm.total_out);
6070  lzma_end(&strm);
6071 
6072  /* printf("compressed %d to %d\n", inlen, outlen); */
6073  ans = Rf_allocVector(RAWSXP, outlen + 5);
6074  memcpy(RAW(ans), buf, outlen + 5);
6075  vmaxset(vmax);
6076  return ans;
6077 }
6078 
6079 HIDDEN SEXP R_decompress3(SEXP in, Rboolean* err)
6080 {
6081  const void *vmax = vmaxget();
6082  unsigned int inlen, outlen;
6083  unsigned char *buf, *p = RAW(in), type = p[4];
6084  SEXP ans;
6085 
6086  if(TYPEOF(in) != RAWSXP)
6087  Rf_error("R_decompress3 requires a raw vector");
6088  inlen = LENGTH(in);
6089  outlen = uiSwap(*(reinterpret_cast<unsigned int *>(p)));
6090  buf = reinterpret_cast<unsigned char *>(R_alloc(outlen, sizeof(unsigned char)));
6091 
6092  if (type == 'Z') {
6093  lzma_stream strm = LZMA_STREAM_INIT;
6094  lzma_ret ret;
6095  init_filters();
6096  ret = lzma_raw_decoder(&strm, filters);
6097  if (ret != LZMA_OK) {
6098  Rf_warning("internal error %d in R_decompress3", ret);
6099  *err = TRUE;
6100  return nullptr;
6101  }
6102  strm.next_in = p + 5;
6103  strm.avail_in = inlen - 5;
6104  strm.next_out = buf;
6105  strm.avail_out = outlen;
6106  ret = lzma_code(&strm, LZMA_RUN);
6107  if (ret != LZMA_OK && (strm.avail_in > 0)) {
6108  Rf_warning("internal error %d in R_decompress3 %d",
6109  ret, strm.avail_in);
6110  *err = TRUE;
6111  return nullptr;
6112  }
6113  lzma_end(&strm);
6114  } else if (type == '2') {
6115  int res;
6116  res = BZ2_bzBuffToBuffDecompress(reinterpret_cast<char *>(buf), &outlen,
6117  reinterpret_cast<char *>((p + 5)), inlen - 5, 0, 0);
6118  if(res != BZ_OK) {
6119  Rf_warning("internal error %d in R_decompress2", res);
6120  *err = TRUE;
6121  return nullptr;
6122  }
6123  } else if (type == '1') {
6124  uLong outl; int res;
6125  res = uncompress(buf, &outl, static_cast<Bytef *>((p + 5)), inlen - 5);
6126  if(res != Z_OK) {
6127  Rf_warning("internal error %d in R_decompress1");
6128  *err = TRUE;
6129  return nullptr;
6130  }
6131  } else if (type == '0') {
6132  buf = p + 5;
6133  } else {
6134  Rf_warning("unknown type in R_decompress3");
6135  *err = TRUE;
6136  return nullptr;
6137  }
6138  ans = Rf_allocVector(RAWSXP, outlen);
6139  memcpy(RAW(ans), buf, outlen);
6140  vmaxset(vmax);
6141  return ans;
6142 }

6144 HIDDEN SEXP
6145 do_memCompress(/*const*/ Expression* call, const BuiltInFunction* op, RObject* from_, RObject* type_)
6146 {
6147  SEXP ans, from;
6148  int type, res;
6149 
6150  ans = from = from_;
6151  if(TYPEOF(from) != RAWSXP) Rf_error("'from' must be raw or character");
6152  type = Rf_asInteger(type_);
6153  switch(type) {
6154  case 1: break; /* none */
6155  case 2: /*gzip */
6156  {
6157  Bytef *buf;
6158  /* could use outlen = compressBound(inlen) */
6159  uLong inlen = LENGTH(from),
6160  outlen = uLong(1.001*inlen + 20);
6161  buf = reinterpret_cast<Bytef *>(R_alloc(outlen, sizeof(Bytef)));
6162  res = compress(buf, &outlen, static_cast<Bytef *>(RAW(from)), inlen);
6163  if(res != Z_OK) Rf_error("internal error %d in memCompress", res);
6164  ans = Rf_allocVector(RAWSXP, outlen);
6165  memcpy(RAW(ans), buf, outlen);
6166  break;
6167  }
6168  case 3: /* bzip */
6169  {
6170  char *buf;
6171  unsigned int inlen = LENGTH(from),
6172  outlen = static_cast<unsigned int>(1.01*inlen + 600);
6173  buf = R_alloc(outlen, sizeof(char));
6174  res = BZ2_bzBuffToBuffCompress(buf, &outlen, reinterpret_cast<char *>(RAW(from)),
6175  inlen, 9, 0, 0);
6176  if(res != BZ_OK) Rf_error("internal error %d in memCompress", res);
6177  ans = Rf_allocVector(RAWSXP, outlen);
6178  memcpy(RAW(ans), buf, outlen);
6179  break;
6180  }
6181  case 4: /* xz */
6182  {
6183  unsigned char *buf;
6184  unsigned int inlen = LENGTH(from), outlen;
6185  lzma_stream strm = LZMA_STREAM_INIT;
6186  lzma_ret ret;
6187  lzma_filter filters[LZMA_FILTERS_MAX + 1];
6188  uint32_t preset_number = 9 | LZMA_PRESET_EXTREME;
6189  lzma_options_lzma opt_lzma;
6190 
6191  if(lzma_lzma_preset(&opt_lzma, preset_number))
6192  Rf_error("problem setting presets");
6193  filters[0].id = LZMA_FILTER_LZMA2;
6194  filters[0].options = &opt_lzma;
6195  filters[1].id = LZMA_VLI_UNKNOWN;
6196 
6197  ret = lzma_stream_encoder(&strm, filters, LZMA_CHECK_CRC32);
6198  if (ret != LZMA_OK) Rf_error("internal error %d in memCompress", ret);
6199 
6200  outlen = static_cast<unsigned int>(1.01 * inlen + 600); /* FIXME, copied from bzip2 */
6201  buf = reinterpret_cast<unsigned char *>(R_alloc(outlen, sizeof(unsigned char)));
6202  strm.next_in = RAW(from);
6203  strm.avail_in = inlen;
6204  strm.next_out = buf;
6205  strm.avail_out = outlen;
6206  while(!ret) ret = lzma_code(&strm, LZMA_FINISH);
6207  if (ret != LZMA_STREAM_END || (strm.avail_in > 0))
6208  Rf_error("internal error %d in memCompress", ret);
6209  /* If LZMZ_BUF_ERROR, could realloc and continue */
6210  outlen = static_cast<unsigned int>(strm.total_out);
6211  lzma_end(&strm);
6212  ans = Rf_allocVector(RAWSXP, outlen);
6213  memcpy(RAW(ans), buf, outlen);
6214  break;
6215  }
6216  default:
6217  break;
6218  }
6219 
6220  return ans;
6221 }
6222 
6223 HIDDEN SEXP
6224 do_memDecompress(/*const*/ Expression* call, const BuiltInFunction* op, RObject* from_, RObject* type_)
6225 {
6226  SEXP ans, from;
6227  int type, subtype = 0;
6228 
6229  ans = from = from_;
6230  if(TYPEOF(from) != RAWSXP) Rf_error("'from' must be raw or character");
6231  type = Rf_asInteger(type_);
6232  if (type == 5) {/* type = 5 is "unknown" */
6233  char *p = reinterpret_cast<char *>(RAW(from));
6234  if (streqln(p, "BZh", 3)) type = 3; /* bzip2 always uses a header */
6235  else if(p[0] == '\x1f' && p[1] == '\x8b') type = 2; /* gzip files */
6236  else if((p[0] == '\xFD') && streqln(p+1, "7zXZ", 4)) type = 4;
6237  else if((p[0] == '\xFF') && streqln(p+1, "LZMA", 4)) {
6238  type = 4; subtype = 1;
6239  } else if(!memcmp(p, "]\0\0\200\0", 5)) {
6240  type = 4; subtype = 1;
6241  } else {
6242  Rf_warning(_("unknown compression, assuming none"));
6243  type = 1;
6244  }
6245  }
6246 
6247  switch(type) {
6248  case 1: break; /* none */
6249  case 2: /* gzip */
6250  {
6251  uLong inlen = LENGTH(from), outlen = 3*inlen;
6252  int res;
6253  Bytef *buf, *p = static_cast<Bytef *>(RAW(from));
6254  /* we check for a file header */
6255  if (p[0] == 0x1f && p[1] == 0x8b) { p += 2; inlen -= 2; }
6256  while(1) {
6257  buf = reinterpret_cast<Bytef *>(R_alloc(outlen, sizeof(Bytef)));
6258  res = uncompress(buf, &outlen, p, inlen);
6259  if(res == Z_BUF_ERROR) { outlen *= 2; continue; }
6260  if(res == Z_OK) break;
6261  Rf_error("internal error %d in memDecompress(%d)", res, type);
6262  }
6263  ans = Rf_allocVector(RAWSXP, outlen);
6264  memcpy(RAW(ans), buf, outlen);
6265  break;
6266  }
6267  case 3: /* bzip2 */
6268  {
6269  unsigned int inlen = LENGTH(from), outlen = 3*inlen;
6270  int res;
6271  char *buf, *p = reinterpret_cast<char *>(RAW(from));
6272  while(1) {
6273  buf = R_alloc(outlen, sizeof(char));
6274  res = BZ2_bzBuffToBuffDecompress(buf, &outlen, p, inlen, 0, 0);
6275  if(res == BZ_OUTBUFF_FULL) { outlen *= 2; continue; }
6276  if(res == BZ_OK) break;
6277  Rf_error("internal error %d in memDecompress(%d)", res, type);
6278  }
6279  ans = Rf_allocVector(RAWSXP, outlen);
6280  memcpy(RAW(ans), buf, outlen);
6281  break;
6282  }
6283  case 4: /* xz */
6284  {
6285  unsigned char *buf;
6286  unsigned int inlen = LENGTH(from);
6287  size_t outlen = 3*inlen;
6288  lzma_stream strm = LZMA_STREAM_INIT;
6289  lzma_ret ret;
6290  while(1) {
6291  /* Initialize lzma_stream in each iteration. */
6292  /* probably at most 80Mb is required, but 512Mb seems OK as a limit */
6293  if (subtype == 1)
6294  ret = lzma_alone_decoder(&strm, 536870912);
6295  else
6296  ret = lzma_stream_decoder(&strm, 536870912, LZMA_CONCATENATED);
6297  if (ret != LZMA_OK)
6298  Rf_error(_("cannot initialize lzma decoder, error %d"), ret);
6299 
6300  buf = reinterpret_cast<unsigned char *>(R_alloc(outlen, sizeof(unsigned char)));
6301  strm.avail_in = inlen;
6302  strm.avail_out = outlen;
6303  strm.next_in = RAW(from);
6304  strm.next_out = buf;
6305 
6306  ret = lzma_code(&strm, LZMA_FINISH);
6307  /* Did lzma_code() leave some input? */
6308  if (strm.avail_in > 0) {
6309  /* Decompression failed, free lzma_stream. */
6310  lzma_end(&strm);
6311  /* Because it ran out of output buffer?
6312  *
6313  * This used to only check if LZMA_BUF_ERROR was
6314  * returned, but apparently XZ will also signal an out
6315  * of buffer condition by returning LZMA_OK and
6316  * leaving avail_in > 0 (i.e. not all input was
6317  * consumed).
6318  */
6319  if (ret == LZMA_BUF_ERROR || ret == LZMA_OK) {
6320  outlen *= 2;
6321  continue;
6322  } else {
6323  Rf_error("internal error %d in memDecompress(%d) at %d",
6324  ret, type, strm.avail_in);
6325  }
6326  } else {
6327  break;
6328  }
6329  }
6330  outlen = size_t(strm.total_out);
6331  lzma_end(&strm);
6332  ans = Rf_allocVector(RAWSXP, outlen);
6333  memcpy(RAW(ans), buf, outlen);
6334  break;
6335  }
6336  default:
6337  break;
6338  }
6339  return ans;
6340 }
6341 
6342 /* --- C-level entry to create a custom connection object -- */
6343 /* The returned value is the R-side instance. To avoid additional call to getConnection()
6344  the internal Rconnection pointer will be placed in ptr[0] if ptr is not NULL.
6345  It is the responsibility of the caller to customize callbacks in the structure,
6346  they are initialized to dummy_ (where available) and null_ (all others) callbacks.
6347  Also note that the resulting object has a finalizer, so any clean up (including after
6348  errors) is done by garbage collection - the caller may not free anything in the
6349  structure explicitly (that includes the con->connprivate pointer!).
6350  */
6351 SEXP R_new_custom_connection(const char *description, const char *mode, const char *class_name, Rconnection *ptr)
6352 {
6353  Rconnection newconn;
6354  SEXP ans, connclass;
6355 
6356  int ncon = NextConnection();
6357 
6358  /* built-in connections do this in a separate new<class>() function */
6359  newconn = Rconnection(malloc(sizeof(struct Rconn)));
6360  if(!newconn) Rf_error(_("allocation of %s connection failed"), class_name);
6361  newconn->connclass = static_cast<char *>(malloc(strlen(class_name) + 1));
6362  if(!newconn->connclass) {
6363  free(newconn);
6364  Rf_error(_("allocation of %s connection failed"), class_name);
6365  /* for Solaris 12.5 */ newconn = nullptr;
6366  }
6367  strcpy(newconn->connclass, class_name);
6368  newconn->description = static_cast<char *>(malloc(strlen(description) + 1));
6369  if(!newconn->description) {
6370  free(newconn->connclass); free(newconn);
6371  Rf_error(_("allocation of %s connection failed"), class_name);
6372  /* for Solaris 12.5 */ newconn = nullptr;
6373  }
6374  init_con(newconn, description, CE_NATIVE, mode);
6375  /* all ptrs are init'ed to null_* so no need to repeat that,
6376  but the following two are useful tools which could not be accessed otherwise */
6377  newconn->vfprintf = &dummy_vfprintf;
6378  newconn->fgetc = &dummy_fgetc;
6379 
6380  /* here we use the new connection to create a SEXP */
6381  Connections[ncon] = newconn;
6382  /* newconn->blocking = block; */
6383  newconn->encname[0] = 0; /* "" (should have the same effect as "native.enc") */
6384  newconn->ex_ptr = PROTECT(R_MakeExternalPtr(newconn->id, Rf_install("connection"), nullptr));
6385 
6386  PROTECT(ans = Rf_ScalarInteger(ncon));
6387  PROTECT(connclass = Rf_allocVector(STRSXP, 2));
6388  SET_STRING_ELT(connclass, 0, Rf_mkChar(class_name));
6389  SET_STRING_ELT(connclass, 1, Rf_mkChar("connection"));
6390  Rf_classgets(ans, connclass);
6391  Rf_setAttrib(ans, Symbols::ConnIdSymbol, static_cast<SEXP>(newconn->ex_ptr));
6392  R_RegisterCFinalizerEx(static_cast<SEXP>(newconn->ex_ptr), conFinalizer, FALSE);
6393  UNPROTECT(3);
6394 
6395  if (ptr) ptr[0] = newconn;
6396 
6397  return ans;
6398 }
